texts.en:
Leticia Silva, who lives in the San Roque de C.D.E neighborhood, organized her neighbors and friends into the area committee. The committee is called “San Roque” in honor of their neighborhood’s name. It is made up of 18, very active and united women from the same area. They are requesting funds that range from Gs.300.000 o Gs. 500.000; they are in their second cycle. The funds will be used in their respective commercial activities, to buy merchandise and basic needs items to sell. 1. Amanda R., grocery store; 2. Graciela P., fruit sales; 3. María Torrez, clothing sales; 4. Lucia B., eggs and sugar sales; 5. Estelvina R., clothing sales; 6. Sandra B., clothing sales; 7. Máxima R., seamstress; 8. Daily González, beauty salon; 9. Leidy Cabañas, Internet-Phone booths; 10. Cinthya U., clothing sales; 11. Nimia R., grocery store; 12. Guillermina G., empanada (turnovers) sales; 13. Felicia S., chipas (a variety of breads made with manioc or corn flour); 14. Alba A., clothing sales; 15. Fátima D., clothing sales; 16. Marta R., cosmetics sales; 17. Nancy R., Copetín (informal snack bars); 18. Viviana C., underwear sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and work tools according to each member's commercial activity such as: for the grocery store (bakery goods, milk, basic needs items), for the beauty salon (diffusers, hair straighteners), etc.

loans.name: Maria  Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa es comerciante madre de dos hijos está domiciliada en el Km 5 Monday de la Ciudad de Presidente Franco la misma se dedica a  la compra y venta de bebidas, en una bodega que tiene instalada en su domicilio.
 Las mercaderías que se ofrece en su negocio son  adquiridas de la Argentina, y son de primera calidad y son productos bien variados a fin de mantener la con clientela formada que la misma tiene, elle solicitó el crédito en la Fundación Paraguaya y a la vez para  aumentar la demanda que se registra en fin de año, se trata de una persona trabajadora y honesta, y agradece el apoyo de la función.-
texts.en:
María Luisa is a shopkeeper and mother of two children. She lives on Km 5 Monday in the city of President Franco. She dedicates herself to buying and selling drinks through a liquor store located in her house. The merchandise that she offers in her store is from Argentina and is high quality. She offers a variety of products so that she maintains the clientele that has formed. She requested this loan from Fundación Paraguay in order to meet the increased demand that occurs at the end of the year. She is a hardworking and honest person and is thankful for the support of the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different types of drinks consumed during this season of festivities, such as wine, cider, soft drinks, liquor, etc.

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Rafael G. Calonge posee un comercio de venta de teléfonos celulares, accesorios, activación de lineas de celulares y reparación de celulares. 

Su comercio posee 5 años de antigüedad, clientela formada y muy buena venta.

El cliente es soltero, tiene 30 años, no tiene hijos es oriundo de 

Nueva Londres pero hace 8 años reside en la cuidad de Encarnación.

Vive en alquiler y sera relocalizado por la Entidad Binacional

Yacyreta tanto con un local comercial como con una vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge Rafael G. Calonge owns a business that sells cellular telephones and accessories, activates cellular phone lines, and repairs cell phones. He has owned this business for five years, has formed a clientele, and has very good sales. Jorge is single, is 30 years old, and does not have children. He is a native of Nueva Londres but has lived in the city of Encarnación for eight years. He lives in a rental and will relocate to Entidad Binacional Yacyreta to a place that will serve as a locale for his business as well as a home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Sounkar DIaye B. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle Est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis 05 ans. Elle a bonne expérience du crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 10 fois de suite. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, du lait, du sucre, de l'huile végétale etc... Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Sounkar Diaye B., 60, is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Bakidioto for five years. She has good loan experience, having received ten loans in a row. She has a shop where she sells diverse products such as rice, milk, sugar, vegetable oil, etc. She helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Verónica Z. de Gomez tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada desde hace tiempo con el señor Sabino Gomez Rios, tienen 1 hijo joven que vive con ellos. 

 Viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora distrito de Cambyreta. 

 La señora Maria Verónica se dedica a la elaboración y venta de masas, tortas, pan dulces y otros, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y tiene mucha clientela de la zona a quienes les distribuye sus productos, y como son de buena calidad tiene éxito y cada vez tiene mas pedidos. 

Mediante esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante y mantener su hogar y a sus hijos.  

Su esposo, el señor Sabino, tambien trabaja como funcionario de un Colegio, por tal motivo tambien tiene un ingreso seguro cada mes y asi puede aportar al hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto que se le presente. 


La señora hoy día esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de insumos varios para elaborar pan dulce, ya que por la temporada de fin de año esta teniendo muchos pedidos y no quiere fallar con su clientela.
texts.en:
Maria Verónica Z. de Gomez is 45 years old and has been married to Sabino Gomez Rios for some time. They have 1 child that lives with them. They live in their own home which is located in the neighborhood Arroyo Pora in the district of Cambyreta. Maria Verónica dedicates herself to making and selling pastries, pies, sweet breads, etc. She has dedicated herself to this activity for several years and has many clients in the area where she distributes her products. Since her products are high quality, she is successful and each time receives more orders. Through this activity, she has been able to progress and maintain her home and support her children. Her husband, Sabino, also works as an employee at a high school. For this reason, he also has a secure income each month and can contribute to the household expenses and pay for whatever unexpected expenses present themselves. Maria Verónica is now requesting this loan to buy various supplies to make sweet breads since she is receiving many orders during this holiday season and does not want to fail her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various supplies including flour, yeast, candied fruit, eggs, butter, etc.

texts.es: La Sra. Adela, es cliente antigua, trabajo desde el año 2002 con credito individual, ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, salchipapas, y otro tipo de comida rápida, a la vez tambien se dedica a la repostería, elaborando alfajores, queques, etc, La Sra. Adela estuvo en contrato mucho tiempo en el Colegio Loretto, atendiendo servicio de té y comida, ahora tiene contratos con empresas particulares, colegios, ella tiene dos hijos jovenes, quienes ya trabajan independientemente, el esposo que es mecánico y electricista siempre se encuentra de viaje por trabajar en una empresa constructora, es una cliente muy trabajadora y cumple con sus pagos de manera regular.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela is a long-time client of Emprender. She has been receiving individual loans since 2002.

Adela sells hamburgers, salchipapas (sausages & French fries), and other types of fast food. Sometimes she also sells sweets such as shortbread, sponge cakes, and other items. Adela has an extended contract with Loretto High School, where she sells food and tea. Now she has contracts with other businesses and schools.

She has two teenage children who already work independently. Her husband is both a mechanic and an electrician and always travels for his job at a construction company. Adela is a hardworking client who always makes her payments regularly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El Solicitante es Miguel Angel S. tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado. Vive en casa propia en san Juan del Parana. 

El destino del crédito es para compras de mercadería ya que se acerca la temporada de fin de año .
texts.en:
The borrower is Miguel Angel S.. He is 45 years old and is married. He lives in his own home in San Juan del Parana. He will use this loan to purchase merchandise since the end-of-year season is nearing.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Ana Belki U. C., Karla Patricia A. y Martha Lorena M. integran al grupo Santa Ana. La especialidad de estas tres mujeres trabajadoras es la cosa de horno, postre nicaragüense a base de maíz, dulce, queso y cuajada.

Karla Patricia A. aprendió este oficio a la  edad de 5 años ya que ella iba con su madre a distribuir el producto y con el pasar de los años empezó a tener mayores responsabilidades en el negocio desde la producción hasta su venta.  A. asegura que a la edad de quince años se independizó y empezó a comercializar cosa de horno, atolillo, arroz de leche, pilloquinto y repostería.

Mientras Ana Belki U. C. de 43 años desde hace cinco años empezó a vender cosa de horno en su hogar y Martha Lorena M. desde hace cuatro años compra y vende cosa de horno.
texts.en:
Ana Belki U. C., Karla Patricia A., and Martha Lorena M. make up the group, Santa Ana. The speciality of these three working women is making baked goods, Nicaraguan desserts with a corn base, sweets, cheese, and custard. Karla Patricia A. learned this skill when she was five years old when she would go with her mother to distribute the goods. Over time, she began to have greater responsibilities in the business, from production to sales. A. says that at the age of 15 she became independent and began to sell baked goods, atolillo [a Nicaraguan dish], arroz con leche [a Nicaraguan dish], pillo quinto [a Nicaraguan dish], and pastries. Meanwhile Ana Belki U. C. is 43 years old and five years ago began to sell baked goods in her home. Martha Lorena M. has bought and sold baked goods for four years.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, milk, cheese, sugar, and other ingredients to make baked goods

texts.fr: Kanda Mama D. est âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 09 bonnes expérience avec le crédit. Elle possède d'un réfrigérateur pour la fabrication et vente de glace et de jus de fruits naturels. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de soutenir son mari dans certaines charges familiales.
texts.en:
Kanda Mama D. is a 28 year-old married woman with four children. She has been a member of the village bank for the past 4 ½ years and has had nine previous loans. She owns a refrigerator that she uses make and sell ice cream and natural fruit juices. Her revenues allow her to support her children and help her husband meet some of the household expenses.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Margoth Yolanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por mujeres emprendedoras, visionarias micro empresarias cabeza de hogar que residen en  distintas localidades de la urbe cuencana,  ésta ciudad majestuosa y soberana se caracteriza por  la riqueza de su arquitectura y valor histórico  así como su  paisaje de inigualable belleza por lo que   ha sido declarada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.

Margoth E. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca en el sector Miraflores  sólo con su hijo de siete años  que  estudia en la unidad educativa Voltaire  porque su esposo migro al exterior  hace un año cuatro meses y no volvió a saber de él, nuestra socia tiene 34 años  y aún vive con su madre porque no tiene  casa propia. 

Nuestra socia  trabaja  en una fábrica de confección de ropa lleva cuatro años laborando allí en turnos rotativos de lunes a viernes,  pero también tiene un negocio en sociedad con su hermana  en la feria libre desde  hace catorce años en él labora los  fines de semana,  aquí expende productos de primera necesidad, limpieza y aseo personal. 

Margoth se  inicio hace diez años en su banco comunal  gracias a un familiar de su esposo, todo este tiempo los préstamos recibidos ha ido invirtiendo en su negocio para incrementarlo cada día más y con el nuevo crédito solicitado va a comprar arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, shampoo y más artículos para mantener un stock surtido para sus clientes.

Su meta es ver a su hijo  crecer, darle la mejor herencia que es el estudio y apoyarlo en todo lo que él necesita.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Fuerza del Manana (strength of tomorrow) was formed by a group of enterprising women who each run their own small business, as well as take care of their homes. They live in various parts of Cuencana, a majestic area characterized by its architecture and rich history and named by the ministry of culture because of its beauty.

Margoth E. is 34 years old and lives in the city of Cuenca, in Milaflores. She is on her own now, and cares for her 7 year old son who attends school. They both live with Margoth's mother since Margoth's husband left the city more than 16 months ago and she doesn't know if he will return. Margoth has a business making a kind of rope candy. She has been doing this work for 4 years Monday through Friday. She has also worked with her brother for the last 14 years on the weekends, selling household staples in the marketplace.

She has been with the communal bank for 10 years thanks to a friend of her husband. All this time she has used the loans she's received to invest in her businesses, slowly growing them day by day. The new loan will be used to purchase rice, sugar, coffee, oil, shampoo and other products to stock for her customers. Margoth's hope is to be able to give her son a good education, and support him in anything he needs as he grows up.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, salt, coffee, shampoo and other household items to stock for her customers

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga es casada con 4 hijos menores que aun dependen de ella.-
Actualmente su marido se encuentra trabajando en el extranjero y desde allí le ayuda económicamente con los gastos del hogar.
Olga se inicio en esta actividad con una amiga que le enseño a fabricar los productos y con la ayuda de sus hijos venden en despensas y casas de familias.
Ella ya tiene una clientela formada.
Gracias al sacrificio que realiza con sus hijos consigue superar la crisis y educa a sus hijos  sin mayores inconvenientes.
Gracias al apoyo que le estamos brindando ella está logrando salir adelante y cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Ella está demostrando ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Olga is married with 4 young children. Her husband is working outside of the country and his income helps with the household expenses. Olga began her business with a friend who taught her how to make the products. Her children help her sell to dispensaries and to private homes. Now Olga has an established customer base. Thanks to the sacrifice she and her children have made, she is able to provide an education for her children. Thanks to the loans she receives, she is able to continue to improve the quality of life for herself and her children. Olga has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make the cleaning products she sells

loans.name: Onofre

texts.es: El Sr. Onofre F. es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya con buen histórico de pago, el mismo está domiciliado en el -km 7 Ciudad Nueva de Ciudad del Este, es casado padre de una hija de cuatro años el mismo se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de sillones de varios tipos: chicos, grandes, fijos, con resortes, ya cuenta con una clientela formada en la zona, dicho crédito va destinado a la compra de hierros y accesorios para sillones, se trata de una persona con una visión amplia de crecimiento, y con disponibilidad y voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Mr. Onofre F. is a returning client of the Paraguaya Foundation. He has a good loan repayment history. Onofre lives in Ciudad Nueva, about 7 km from Ciudad del Este. He's married and has a four-year-old daughter. He builds and sells various kinds of chairs: large, small, hard, cushioned, etc. Onofre already has a customer base in the area. He just needs this loan to purchase iron and some chair-making accessories. Onofre is a man with a vision for his growing business, who is both able and willing to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying furniture-making materials: iron, accessories, other components

loans.name: Pio

texts.es: Se trata de un cliente recurrente de la Suc. es casado posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar tiene 1 hija el mismo es microempresario es propietario de un Comercial ventas de ropería, mercería, bazar, ventas de articulos de primera necesidad denominado Los amigos cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad e rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela he ingresos el mismo solicito para compra de mercaderias para estas fiestas que estaría trayendo de la ciudad de Puerto Rico Argentina que es de menor costo y le estaría dando mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Pio is a returning client. He is married, has his own home with all of the necessary comforts, and he has one daughter. He owns a store that sells clothing, general merchandise, and basic necessities called "Los Amigos." The business is 5 years old and this type of business allows him to have a very good customer base and a good income. He is requesting a loan to buy products for the festivities that would be brought from the city of Puerto Rico in Argentina, because there the cost is lower and this would give him a better profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothing for women and men and drinks from Puerto Rico. Argentina

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: La Sra. Zulma María es empleada en casa comercial denominada Planeta Modas ubicado en micro centro de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el Sr. Pedro Vázquez, el mismo se dedica al comercio, a la compra de mercaderías del vecino país como ser: pollos, azúcar, aceites etc., lo cual le generan mayor ingreso en la unidad familiar, están domiciliados en el Km 5 Barrio María Auxiliadora son padres de dos hijos, cuenta con un buen histórico de pago con la Fundación Paraguaya, se tratan de personas trabajadoras y con voluntad de pago
texts.en:
Zulma Maria works in a business known as Planeta Modas, located in the center of Ciudad del Este. She is married to Pedro Vazquez, who is also engaged in commerce, specifically, buying merchandise from the neighboring country, such as chickens, sugar, oils, etc. This generates the largest part of the family’s income. They live at Km. 5 in the Maria Auxiliadora Section, and have two children. Their payment history with the Paraguayan Foundation is good, for they are hard working and accept the responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as chickens, soft drinks, breads, staples (rice, sugar)

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eladio G. tiene 52 años, esta casado con la Sra. María tiene 2 hijos mayores que ya no dependen de el ellos ya son profesionales e independientes.
 Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de aproximadamente 8 años,  el comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias a sus ahorro que venía juntando de otros trabajos que realizaba anteriormente. Es decir, que  el negocio fue montado con  las ganancias que  obtenía de las ventas de mercaderías, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante. 
Hoy día don Eladio y la Sra. Maria atienden el negocio; que gracias a sus esfuerzos  esta a nivel de la competencia y con un crecimiento sistemático.
 El Sr. Eladio  tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus compras y así consigue descuentos interesantes y en consecuencia logra mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas.
 El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es através de los créditos, por que le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Eladio G. is 52 years old. With his wife Maria, he has two grown children, who are working professionals and independent. His business is about 8 years old. He was able to start working for himself with the help of savings he accumulated from jobs he held previously. That is, his business is the result of earnings derived from his work as a traveling salesman. Today Eladio and Maria run the business, and through their efforts it has experienced regular growth and stands up to the competition. Eladio has his own home. He would like to purchase in larger quantities, to benefit from discounts and thus enjoy a larger profit margin from his sales. He states that the only way to grow is through credit, because it would be hard from him to accumulate operating capital. This is why he is requesting a loan. He is a responsible person, eager to achieve, and he has a cheerful outlook. He is enterprising, and there is no doubt but that he will reach any goals he sets for himself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pasta products, Yerba mate, rice, sugar, flour, and other commodities

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El Sr. Celso está casado con la Sra. Marciana tienen 2 hijos 1 de ellos es un adolescente y la mujer ya es independiente además de los hijos están por ser  abuelos.
Ellos tienen una lavandería familiar en donde todo trabajan, don Celso realiza entregas de las ropas limpias y planchadas y la Sra. Marciana con sus hijas son las encargadas de lavar y planchar. Ellos tiene cliente de grandes empresas cobran en forma mensual por los servicios realizados 
Además de la lavandería don Celso trabaja como vidriero de puertas y ventanas de vidrios templados y de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos del hogar.
El nos ha comentando que está muy contento con la ayuda que le hemos brindado con el crédito  ya que es la única manera de conseguir un dinerito junto  así conseguir superar a la crisis y de esa manera ayudar a los integrantes de su familia para no realizar trabajos fuera de su hogar ya que su empresa es familiar.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Celso and Marciana are married and have two children, one an adolescent, and a daughter who is independent. They are about to become grandparents. They have a family-owned laundry where everyone works. Celso delivers the items cleaned and pressed, and Marciana with her daughters are responsible for washing and ironing. Their customers include large companies, and they collect monthly for their services. In addition to the laundry, Celso works as a glazier (tempered-glass windows and doors), to supplement their income. He stated that he is very happy with the help we have provided, since credit is the only way to gather enough money to face tough times, and thus make it possible for his family to avoid taking on work outside the family’s business. He has proven himself to be a hard working person who keeps his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an industrial washing machine

loans.name: Victor Jose

texts.es:
Víctor P. de 51 años de edad, vive en una casa de caña en un sector de escasos servicios básicos ubicado en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es costurera y vende arroz y legumbres, tienen 3 hijos 2 viven con el uno de 3 años otro de 1 años y una niña de 12 años que vive en la casa de ex esposa.

Víctor comenzó hace 3 años atrás con un pequeño puesto de legumbres en la calle Valle de la Flor de Paraíso Guayaquil, Ahora Víctor tiene un horario de 06h00 hasta las 12h00 y 14h00 hasta las 20h00 vendiendo legumbres y frutas, una de las mayores complicaciones es el trasporte porque tiene que pagar todos los días $ 5.00.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas por cajas, legumbres por cajas para poder agrandar el negocio, en el futuro quiere poner una tienda ya establecida en su casa y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor is 51 years old. He lives in a house made out of cane, in an area with few basic services. It is located in the Paradise Zone of Guayaquil. His wife is a seamstress and she sells rice and vegetables. They have three children. Two of the children live with him. One is three years old and the other is one year old. The twelve-year-old girl lives with his ex-wife. Victor has had a small booth (on the Valle de la Flor Street in Guayaquil) for the past three years where he has sold vegetables. Victor works from 6:00am until 12pm and from 2pm until 8pm selling vegetables and fruit. One of his biggest problems is transportation. He pays $5.00 each day for transportation. With this loan he would like to buy boxes of fruit so that he can grow his business. In the future he would like to have an established store at his house. He would also like to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, tomatoes and onions

texts.en:
Kamala N. is a 47 years old school teacher and sheep breeder in the small village of Imishli.  She is married and has one adorable daughter.  Kamala works long hours to help cover her family's needs. 

Once every two week her husband takes her sheep to the central livestock bazaar to sell them.  Kamala needs additional funds to increase her income, to save enough money to send her daughter to college.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila B. is 54 years old and is married with three children. She is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family.

More than fifteen years ago, Rahila got an idea to start raising cattle to contribute to her family's finances, taking advantage of the space she had available at her house for this business. Her son helps her with the business.

With an endless list of requests, Rahila has finally decided to increase the number of the animals she keeps. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. Please be an important part of the growth of Rahila’s business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

texts.es:
El grupo el Tucan está integrado por Digmara, Luz Marina, Yaritza y Yamil. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que desean salir adelante y velar por el bienestar de sus familias.

Digmara comenzó hace cuatro años a echar tortilla en esa epoca contaba con lo mínimos recursos ahora le a proporcionado una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Mientra su compañera Luz Marina vende verduras en el mercado oriental, Yaritza vende nacatamales y Yamil vende frutas en Masaya.
texts.en:
The El Tucan group is made up of Digmara, Luz Marina, Yaritza and Yamil. They are hard-working people who want to progress and ensure the welfare of their families. Digmara began making tortillas four years ago. At that time he had few resources and now he has been able to give his family a better quality of life. His partner Luz Marina sells vegetables in the Mercado Oriental market. Yaritza sells nacatamales and Yamil sells fruit in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

Valida A. is 40 years old. She’s married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 14 years, she has been purchasing young cattle and calves at the local market, and then raising and selling them. 

Valida is a very hard-working woman. Her diligence is incredible. Valida wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls so she can fatten them and sell them at the best price in the local market. Her husband actively helps her with operations. Thanks to this activity, she can pay for her children's education. Valida wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have set for themselves. 

She is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to buy four calves to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.name: Mujeres Idóneas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipé surgió por contacto D. una D. las integrantes con la fundación .

 Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta D. ropas, venta D. joyas, peluquera, taller D. costuras, venta D. artículos para limpieza, venta D. comestibles etc.

 El monto que recibe cada señora varía D. 300.000 a 1000.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya están realizando actualmente.
texts.en:
This group from the Chaipé neighbourhood arose from contact with one of the members with the foundation. All the ladies perform productive activities such as: clothing sales, jewellery sales, hair dressing, sewing workshops, sale of cleaning products, sale of groceries etc. The total that each lady will receive varies between 300 and 1000. All the ladies' loans are destined for the activities that they are now doing.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes, cosmetics, grocery items, jewellery, threads and fabric, sweets, cleaning articles etc

texts.es: Fátima tiene 41 años de edad por lo que anteriormente ella tenía un financiamiento que le fue de mucha ayuda. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad por lo que siempre le ha gustado, además ella sale a ofrecer sus productos en un carretón ya que es el único medio de transporte que posee. Por lo que tiene 1 hijo por cual preocuparse. Ha sido muy difícil salir adelante pues no tenía el suficiente apoyo. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos ya que en esta temporada navideña tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Fátima is 41 years old. She previously had finance that helped her a lot. She works raising pigs, and has done this humble activity for more than 7 years because she has always liked it. She goes out to offer her products in a cart, as it's the only mode of transport she possesses. She has one child whom she worries about. It has been very difficult to move forward as she hasn't had sufficient support. She is seeking this finance for working capital to purchase pigs as in this Christmas period she has many orders. Her desire is to maintain this economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

Diribash F. is a 58-year-old man on a pension. He owns a petrol station on the road between his village and Imishli City. He has about 5-6 clients a day. His business is stable and brings good income to his family, which consists of his wife and 4 children. He has more that 20 years in this business. His petrol pumps are getting old and sometimes break, so Diribash has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase better petrol pumps.

texts.es:
Klever Z. de 48 años de edad, vive en una casa de cemento en un sector de escasos servicios  básicos ubicado en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es costurera y le ayuda en algunos gastos familiares con ella tienen 3 hijos una de 23 años, 25 años, 19 años todos trabajan.

Klever comenzó como empleado vendiendo pollos fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta que pudo completar para comprarse unos pollos y criarlos hasta venderlos, ya hace 4 años atrás Klever trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h00 vendiendo pollos y bebidas, una de los inconvenientes es no poder trabajar mas de las 18h00 por la inseguridad del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más pollos, aguas, jugos para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar una camioneta para poder transportar sus pollos.
texts.en:
Klever Z. is 48 years old, and lives in a cement house in a sector with poor basic services located in the zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. His wife is a seamstress and she helps him with some family costs. They have 3 children - 23, 25 and 19 years of age. All of them work. Klever began as an employee selling chickens. Little by little he saved until he could buy some chickens and raise them until he sold them. For 4 years Klever has worked from 6am until 6pm selling chickens and drinks. One of the inconveniences is that he can't work past 6pm because of the insecurity of the sector. With the loan he wants to buy more chickens, water, juices to enlarge his business. In the future he wants to buy a truck to be able to transport his chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está integrado por Alma Nubia M. C. quien hace 20 años inicio vendiendo 10 pares de zapatos los cual con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias a los préstamos y sus estrategias de mercado.

 Sus compañeras Gladis V. R. de 24 años también vende zapatos y Rosa Argentina S. desde hace quince años tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste  en alimento fritos como tajas con queso, enchilada, carne asada, cerdo asado, frito, pollo etc.
texts.en:
The group Concepción is integrated because of Almba Nubia M. C., who 20 years ago initiated selling 10 pairs of shoes, with which in time she grew her business thanks to loans and her market strategies. Her partners are Gladis (24 years old) who also sellis shoes, and Rosa, who for 15 years has had a fried snack shop, a popular restaurant which consists of fried food such as cheese bread, enchiladas, barbecued meat, barbecued pork, chicken etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El señor Felix G. es un comerciante antiguo del distrito

de Cambyreta su comercio lleva el nombre de Despensa El 

Abuelo, vive en casa propia es casado y tiene dos hijos.

 

Su comercio tiene ya varios años y tambien realiza pastas, dulces y helados.  

 

El destino del credito fue para la compra de

mercaderias para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Señor Felix G. is an old merchant of the Cambyreta district. His business has the name Despensa El Abuela. He lives in his own house and has 2 children. His business is many years old and he makes pastas, sweets and ice creams. This loan is destined for the purchase of grocery items to expand his stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es: Edma tiene 86 años, no es el primer financiamiento que solicito a Fundación León 2000 le han sido de muy buena ayuda por lo que han sido para la inversión de su negocio. Por lo que logro pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma, la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que esta temporada del año tiene los encargos suficientes y ella está muy alegre  por lo ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzado, sobre cama, vestidos entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio, que le ha brindado lo necesario para el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Edma, 86, has had prior loans with Fundación León 2000 that have been very helpful to her as investments in her business. She was able to repay them in a timely fashion. Her commercial activity is the sale of general merchandise. She has many customers so this time of year has sufficient orders. She is very cheerful and she enjoys chatting with her customers. She needs financing in order to buy purses, footwear, bedspreads, dresses, among other things. Her wish is to continue with her work, which has provided her with income to cover her basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy purses, footwear, bedspreads, dresses, etc.

texts.es:
Narcisa V. de 46 años de edad, vive en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su vivienda es de cemento tiene como servicio básico agua y luz sin caminos pavimentados, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas una de 20 años que estudia en la Universidad y otra de 13 años que todavía esta en una Escuela Particular. 

Narcisa comenzó hace 5 años comprando poco a poco esmaltes y binchas, vendía en su casa así pudo completar capital para ahora tener un bazar surtido con peluches, tarjetas, maquillajes, papelería etc. Narcisa ahora trabaja desde las  07h30 hasta las 21h00 atendiendo solo el bazar, una de sus mayores complicaciones es tener que ir a comprar mercadería al centro de Guayaquil.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más peluches, tarjetas, ropa interior para agrandar más su bazar. En el futuro quiere poner otro bazar para que su hija de 20 años lo atienda.
texts.en:
Narcisa V., 46, lives in the Paraíso sector of Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and has basic services like running water and electricity although the streets are still unpaved. She is a single mother of two daughters; a 20-year-old university student, and a 13-year-old who is in private school. About five years ago she began to buy fingernail polish and hair bands. She would sell them from her house and began to make enough money to set up a store where she sells stuffed toys, greeting cards, make-up, stationery, etc. Narcisa works from 7:30am until 9pm. One of her greatest difficulties is having to go to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise. With the financing she wants to buy more stuffed toys, greeting cards, and underwear to enlarge her store. In the future she wants to set up a second store that her 20-year-old daughter can run.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

Elza A. is a 51-year-old woman who has a poultry business. She has 10 years of experience in this field. She is married and has 3 sons who are the apple of her eye. Once each week, Elza sells poultry in the central livestock bazaar . Every week, one of her dear sons helps her to take the birds to the bazaar. 

She has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to build a good shelter for her birds and to purchase more hens, turkeys and ducks.

loans.name: Eudocio

texts.en:
Eudocio began his family-car fiberglass manufacturing business with a 500 square foot warehouse, some tools, a few molds, some clients, and many hopes of achieving success! A few years after he began, he was able to buy more tools and molds, hire an employee, and eventually move to a 1,000 square foot warehouse. Today he is progressing even further by creating a new line of products for fishing boats. Eudocio says that thanks to lots of experience in the business and the success they have had in the last few years they have become a notable name in the car fiberglass business. The challenge lies in creating new products and expanding outside of Florida.

Eudocio will use his loan to increase his inventory so that more is available on hand. This helps him to meet the needs of his customers who many times have immediate demands. In the past, Eudocio hasn't relied on credit but he realized how this loan will be helpful for increasing stock that he couldn't afford to buy otherwise - the demand is there and he would like to meet it. He hopes to attend events this next year that will further market his business.

Eudocio's business goals are to become a public company with a well known product - one that is regarded for high quality. He sees his business prospering and, with this success, his daughter will know that with personal strength and family unity you can achieve any goal you desire.


 About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy fiberglass, resin, gel coating, acetone, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy painting materials for bigger jobs

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: When Mario first moved to the United States over thirty years ago, he worked in food preparation. After years of working in a freezer he began to have troubles with his hands and the doctor recommended that he find a new way of earning a living. Mario decided to get a commercial driving license and soon started operating his own food transportation business. Mario has been driving a commercial truck for about twenty-six years. He makes, on average, two long distance trips per week. Because of the high cost of his commercial truck tires, Mario requested a loan from ACCION USA to purchase ten tires to improve the safety of his truck during the harsh winter road conditions. The cost of each tire is around $450. Mario mentioned that he'd just returned from Houston last week and he will be headed out to Michigan in a few days. He loves his job; it's allowed him to visit many museums across the country, which is one of his favorite hobbies. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy ten new tires for his truck

loans.name: Salote

texts.en:
Salote S. is 52 and married with 9 children (ages 18 - 36).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Salote has many years of experience in this business.  Salote needs a loan of WST $1750 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 tala or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Salote joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Salote's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Salote S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

texts.es: Araceli Del Carmen tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y están a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra-venta de cosméticos, ella ha logrado obtener clientes fijos desde que inicio su negocio y esto le ha permitido obtener ganancias que le han ayudado a solventar gastos en su hogar para sus hijos quienes han sabido corresponder al esfuerzo de su madre. Hoy recurre a esta organización con la necesidad de un financiamiento que le permita comprar ciertos artículos como y sus clientes las requieren, pues ella desea aumentar sus ventas, con artículos de cosméticos como: delineadores, pinturas labiales y de uñas, polvo, brillos, tintes, cremas, perfumería entre otros. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Araceli Del Carmen, 38, has two children under her care. She is a cosmetics merchant. Since the beginning, she has been acquiring regular customers that have produced income for her to be able to meet household expenses for her children, who appreciate their mother's efforts. Today, she calls upon this organization to request financing that will allow her to buy certain items that her customers require: eyeliner, lipstick, nail polish, powder, eye shadow, hair dyes, creams, perfumes, etc. She wants to increase her sales so that she can reach her ultimate goal, which is to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nicolás León vive en una casa de caña ubicada en la zona de la Paraíso de Guayaquil, es viudo tuvo con su cónyuge hijos y todos estan casados y trabajando.

Nicolás inicio su negocio hace ya 8 años atrás cuando se quedo sin trabajo, comenzó vendiendo queso por libra, de hay hasta ahora el vende sandia por unidades y queso por libra desde las 06h00 hasta las 18h00 de lunes a domingos, una de las complicaciones en el negocio es que no tiene medio de transporte y tiene que estar pagando los fletes por lo que el trabaja solo le es my difícil dejar solo el negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar queso y sandias para incrementar el negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un puesto más grande y poder así vender más productos como arroz, aceites.
texts.en:
Nicolás León lives in a house made out of sugar cane stalks in the Paraíso sector of Guayaquil. He is a widower and had children with his wife, all of whom are now married and working. Eight years ago, when he became unemployed, Nicolás started his business: he began selling cheese by the pound. Until today, he continues to sell cheese by the pound and watermelons by the unit. He works from 6am until 6pm from Monday through Sunday. One of the complications he faces is that he has no means of transportation and has to pay shipping fees because, since he works alone, it's difficult for him to leave his business unattended. This loan will be used to buy cheese and watermelons. In the future, he'd like to have a larger stand so that he could sell other products like rice and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

Su actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, maíz y maní, para despues comercializar sus productos en el mercado de la zona. El cliente esta agradecido con la institución por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Gregorio was born in La Paz on May 9, 1954. He has been living on the plain of El Coscal for the past 18 years. Gregorio is a widower who lives with his children. He is a farmer who grows potatoes, corn, and peanuts and sells his products at the local market.

Gregorio thanks the Institution for providing him with financing.

loans.name: Crecer Con Libertad Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Crecer con Libertad" (Grow with Freedom) and has 18 members, all hardworking men and women of various ages.  They work in different trades; for example, some make and sell artisanal goods made of wire, stones, and cloth, among other materials.  Other borrowers make handicrafts or work in repairing broken household items, dressmaking, and weaving.  Some borrowers work in sales, selling food, clothing, and maintaining their grocery shops.
 
This group's objective is to grow in their respective businesses and reach their goals, while promoting their quality products.  Above all, they want to grow their businesses to create more economic stability for their families, continuing to develop and grow better with each day.

Jocelyn is the secretary of the group (in the photo, she is the pregnant woman on the far right).  She is an artisan who makes necklaces, rings, hoop earrings, and bracelets using several different materials.  She works with beads, stones, wood, and cloth, among others.  Jocelyn often travels to Santiago, Chile’s capital city, to purchase these materials.  She sells the products from her home, in markets, and in other well-populated areas.  She will use this loan to purchase more materials for her artisan work in order to expand the diversity of her products.

The experience that they have had with Fondo Esperanza, according to Jocelyn, has surpassed the group's expectations. Beyond giving them the tools they need to meet their businesses' needs, they have felt an unparalleled quality of people among the group's members and they have found this very gratifying.

The Chilean province of Talca is located in the Maule region of central Chile. Maule has the largest rural population of any of Chile's 15 regions.  Its citizens typically work in farming and agriculture.  Talca is known for its beautiful artisan work, colonial architecture, vineyards, and scenery.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory, materials, and equipment

texts.es: El señor Juan Alberto, tiene  41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor tiene la actividad económica de  un taller de carpintería. Este está ubicado en su vivienda. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 15 años con muy pocos materiales, influenciado en parte por sus familiares que se dedican a este negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de muebles ya que su negocio está ubicado en una zona de fácil acceso que le permite realizar la venta de sus muebles, por lo que vende más. por lo cual también aporta para el sustento del hogar. Su sueño siempre ha sido tener un taller grande el cual pueda abastecer a muchas personas y también brindar empleos.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is 41 and married. He has two minor children. He has a carpenter’s shop that is located in his house. He started the business with very few materials 15 years ago. He was partially influenced by relatives in the same business. The loan is to buy furniture because his business is located in an area with easy access. This allows him to sell his furniture, which he sells the most. It also contributes to the support of his household. His dream has always been to have a large shop where he could serve a lot of people and also have employees.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: “Amanecer” es un grupo de 8 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Panamericana”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de ropa,  tejido de mantas, chompas,  venta de madera, venta de verduras, venta de ají, atención de tienda de barrio. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Liderizadas por su mesa directiva desarrollan su reunión de manera ordenada.
texts.en:
“Amanecer” (Dawn) is a group of eight women who hold their meetings at the Panamericana Community Center. They joined together because they wanted to access loans to increase their working capital. The members are engaged in businesses selling clothing, woven blankets, sweaters, timber, vegetables, chili peppers, and groceries. They are aware that they have several competitors and have worked to become better than them by serving their customers in the best manner and offering them quality products. The group leaders conduct their meetings in an orderly manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El señor Apolinar L. está muy agradecido con su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo poner el piso de concreto en toda la casa. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para poder colocar el vitropiso (cerámico) en toda la casa, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejora. 
Desea que su casa ya este terminada ya que tiene un hijo pequeño de edad y quiere que viva mejor.
texts.en:
Apolinar L. is very grateful for his past loan with which he was able to install a concrete floor througout his entire house. Again, he is asking for financing to install ceramic tile flooring throughout the entire house because he doesn't have sufficient funds at the moment to complete the project. He hopes to have his house finished because he has a young son and he wants him to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fuerza del Mañana está formado por mujeres emprendedoras, visionarias micro empresarias cabeza de hogar que residen en  distintas localidades de la urbe cuencana,  ésta ciudad majestuosa y soberana se caracteriza por  la riqueza de su arquitectura y valor histórico  así como su  paisaje de inigualable belleza por lo que   ha sido declarada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.

Es así que Mónica B. tiene 29 años y es una de las  socias activas  hace cuatro ciclos,  vive en el centro de la ciudad  con su esposo, él trabaja como mecánico industrial y ella como consultora de belleza,  aun no tienen hijos y tampoco casa propia.

 Mónica se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal por catálogo, lleva un año realizando esta actividad  que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, sus clientes son principalmente su familia sus amigas y ex compañeros de trabajo.

Nuestra socia nos comenta que una tía la incentivó para que forme parte del banco comunal, los créditos recibidos ha invertido en adquirir mercadería para su negocio  y con el nuevo préstamo que recibirá de la Fundación va a comprar perfumes, cremas, labiales, rímel, pinta uñas y mas cosméticos para damas y caballeros.

Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
“Fuerza del Mañana” (“Strength for Tomorrow”) Communal Bank is made of enterprising woman. They are visionary entrepreneurs who are the heads of their households and reside in various locations around the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a majestic city known for its architectural richness and historical importance and has been declared an important Cultural Heritage Site for its incomparable beauty. Mónica B. is 29, and she has been an active member for four cycles. She lives in the center of the city with her husband. He works as an industrial mechanic, and she is a beauty consultant. They do not have children yet, nor do they have their own house. Mónica sells Yanbal products by catalog. She has been doing this for one year. It has given her a lot of satisfaction. Her customers are primarily her family, friends, and ex colleagues from work. She comments that an aunt motivated her to become part of the communal bank. She has used the loans she has received to acquire merchandise for her business. With the new loan she will receive from the Foundation she will buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, mascara, nail polish, and more cosmetics for women and men. Her greatest dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, cream, lipstick, shadow, mascara, nail polish, and more cosmetics for women and men

texts.es:
El grupo Chiltoma está integrado por Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón G., Consuelo del Carmen P. G. y Matilde Patricia G. ellas desean que este nuevo año sus negocios prosperen y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Nubia de 23 años trabaja arduamente desde muy tempranas horas en el mercado oriental vendiendo frutas y verduras. De la misma manera  Matilde de 38 años quien también vende frutas y verduras.
 
Consuelo por su parte se dedica al engorde y crianza de cerdo, pelibuey y gallinas con lo cual paga los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
The Chiltoma Group has three members: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón G., Consuelo del Carmen P. G. and Matilde Patricia G.. Their plan for the New Year is to improve their businesses and their quality of life. Nubia is 23 years old. She is hard at work early each morning, selling fruits and vegetables at the eastern market. Matilda is 38 years old; she also sells fruits and vegetables. Consuelo breeds and raises pigs, hens and pelibüey sheep. She's putting her two daughters through college.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer
