loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Noin

texts.en: Two people are shown in the picture above: Mrs. S. and her husband at their house. To earn a living, the family has cultivated rice, raised many pigs and climbed palm trees, and they can make US$7 a day from their enterprises. Mrs. S. now has five teenage children, all five of whom are farming rice or going to school. Mrs. S. lacks money and is asking for capital to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda P., 56 years old, is a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting corn and maintaining a good and quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well but she admitted that she still needs additional capital to grow her business.

Lutgarda joined the loan program of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2008. She likes the program very much and that is why she is still a member of the CEVI cluster association.

Lutgarda would like to apply for another loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs and supplies. In this way, she believes she will be able to obtain a greater harvest and more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and supplies

texts.en: Herminia T., 61 years old, is a residence of Banga, South Cotabato. She has a farm and grows rice. She works from morning until sunset to ensure that she has a very abundant harvest. She wants to earn a bigger income to help her family buy food, clothes and other basic needs. Herminia is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will go far buying farm supplies to double the size of her harvest.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Haem Him is 45 years old and lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. He is the father of three children who are employed in a garment factory. He is farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Heng Vath, is a pig breeder. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their family living. Thus, Mr. Haem Him decided to ask for a loan to start a new business using rice to make wine to sell. He would use the rest of money to buy five more piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.use: To start a rice wine business and to buy five piglets and pig feed

texts.en: Genny B. manages a small rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old and capable of handling a business. She says that as she continues to work on the farm, she really needs additional capital. She says that working on a farm is not easy – hard work, patience and money are needed to achieve your desired harvest. Genny would like a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest. When she has firmly established her business, she dreams of buying more land to help her relatives.

Phan N., 60, is a widow who lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and raising livestock since 1979 and is able to earn a gross income of US $0.50 per day. One of her children who works at a local garment factory earns an income of US $4 per day. This money helps cover the family expenses. N. and her children try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for the family. And they are seeking to improve their businesses. As a result, she is requesting a loan of US $800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, she will able to cut back on public transportation expense and save up more money for the future. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn S. lives in Daeum Rumdael village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she needs a loan to buy a water pump, gasoline, and pesticides to support her rice farming. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sen San, is a palm juice collector. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other is employed at the Thai border. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy water pump, gasoline, and pesticides to support her rice farming

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T. is engaged in corn and coconut farming and trading. He grows rice and sells his harvest to generate additional income for the family. He said, his harvest is what he uses to buy food and basic needs. The farm is very important to him, especially because it is the only source of income of the family.

Francisco is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy the needed farm supplies to grow his rice well. The loan will help not just to improve his harvest but to increase the family income as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his rice farm

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda H. is 28 years old and she lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She has three children, two of whom are attending the local school; the youngest is too little to work or study.

Chenda is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Lach Kosal, is a construction worker.

Now Chenda is applying for a loan to buy five piglets plus pig food, and to use the rest of money to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. Her husband and one of her children are in this photo with her.

loans.use: To buy five piglets, pig food and fertilizer for her rice farm.

texts.en:
Catalina P., 58 years old, owns and manages a small corn farm in Banga, a municipality of South Cotabato province in southern Mindanao. She has five children. Her eldest child is 24 years old and was not able to go to college because of financial difficulties. She would like to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support all of her family’s needs.

Catalina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase both the size of her harvest and income.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mrs. NoeU. U., 27 years old, is a villager in PoU. in Takéo province. She is the mother of two children. The older child is attending the local school, while the younger is too little for work or study. Her husband, Mr. San Ty, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field where he cultivates rice.

NoeU. is a grocer and breeds pigs. Since her businesses are going well, she wants to expand them by purchasing more products for her grocery plus a piglet and pig food.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock plus a piglet and pig food.

texts.en:
Carmen C., 52 years old, is a rice farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. She started her business in 1990 and is still tilling her farm hoping that she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

When she started farming, Carmen said that it was really difficult, especially since the farm needed enough capitalization to grow rice. She was happy that she joined CEVI and was able to get access to small loans.

Now, Carmen would like to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en: Mrs. Chuk K. is 52 years old and resides in the province of Pursat, where she and her husband earn a living as local rice cultivators. Additionally, Chuk K. owns a machine that she uses to provide a rice plucking service to farmers for a fee.  She earns an average of $5 per day to help cover her family’s financial crisis. Chuk K. needs a loan to buy more gasoline for her machine and to hire laborers to harvest her mature crop. (Chuk K. and her family are in the photo at their house.)

loans.use: To buy more gasoline and to hire laborers

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla D. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five children, three of whom are already adults while the remaining two are still studying. Luzvilla owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of food products including chicken barbecue in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month. In 2007, Luzvilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Luzvilla is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital for the business. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for her children's education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena O. is from the village of Galas. She is 62 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Elena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month. In 2008, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

texts.en:
Annie Sol S. is 44 years old. She has a farm and a piggery business. She makes sure that her crops are well taken care of. She learned to farm from her parents. She says if she only had more resources, she would buy more farms to plant more rice. Now, she just focuses on the business she has at present. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and income.

Arleen P. is a mother and a farmer in Norala South Cotabato. She has three children. The eldest is 13, the second child is 12 and the youngest is 4 years old.  She works from morning until sunset so that she will be able to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest.

She is hoping to receive a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way she will be able to improve the size of her harvest, and her income as well.

Emma L. is 26 years old. She has a farm. Her main crop is rice because people in their village are constantly buying it for food for their respective families. She has two children. Her eldest is only 6 years old. She dreams of sending her children to school until they reach college so that when they are older they will land a better job. 

She is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to grow her harvest and her income.

Emmie B. has a farm. She grows rice to be able to provide an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs for her family. She has one child who is 16 years old now. Currently her child is studying in high school. She dreams to save money to pay for her child's college tuition and books in the future.

Now, she is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan is truly helpful in buying farm supplies to grow the harvest.

Jane B., 43 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm in Banga South Cotabato Mindanao. She has four children. Her eldest child is 15. The second child is 14. The third child is 13 and the youngest is only 6 years old.  She wishes to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support their education and all the family needs.

She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan of PHP 6,000 to buy farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: C. is a local rice farmer, aged 29. In addition, she works to sell cake around her village for extra income. She also depends on her husband’s income; he works as a food cooker for wedding parties. The couple has been married a lot of years and is blessed with four teenage children, who are students and dependent on their income. C. said that her current income is not adequate to cover her family expenses and she hopes to resign from her job and then go to work as a house cleaner in Malaysia through the private company. Because she is required to pay the company a service fee, she decided to seek a loan of $300 from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: To pay a service fee to a new employer

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: Ludivina G. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 60 years old, is widowed, and has three adult children. Ludivina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Ludivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia A. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

texts.en:
Merlyn, 29 years old, is a married woman with three children, the oldest aged 10. She has a lot of dreams for her family, especially her children. She wants all of them to have proper education and someday find jobs for themselves.

Merlyn is a rice farmer. The farm requires hard work so she makes sure to keep herself healthy and strong. She needs additional capital for her farm so she applied for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. This loan will help fund Merlyn’s farm and eventually give her a better income.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi L., 35 years old, has been married for almost eleven years and has two children. His older child is nine years old while the younger is only two years old. He has a farm and a piggery.

Levi is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), as he needs additional capital for his businesses. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies, piglets and feed. He likes CEVI because not only do its loans have only a 2% interest rate, he was able to buy insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed and farm supplies.

texts.en: Turbat P., 35, lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan, one of Mongolia's western provinces.  His two children are 11 and 13 years old and both attend local secondary schools.  His wife is a construction worker and usually travels to various construction sites outside the town.  Turbat usually takes care of his two children and is responsible for family duties. He sells various food products like fruit, dairy products and more from a stall he rents at the local food market.   He sells fruit during warm season and dairy products when it is cold. With his business profits, he started to build a small house for his family.  He says that he would like to see his two children obtain a good education and pursue their dreams without any financial setbacks.  He requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn L., 42 years old, owns and works a two-hectare rice field in Banga, a municipality in the province of South Cotabato on southern Mindanao island. She started her business way back in 1996. With the income she receives from her farm, the financial needs of her family are met.

Marialyn is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. as additional capital for her business. With this amount she will buy fertilizer, seed and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed and other farm supplies.

texts.en:
Mary Grace B., 35 years old, is a rice farmer. She has four children. Her eldest, who is sixteen years old, might not be able to go to college. As the family’s finances are already tight, enrolling her child in college would surely eat up the family’s limited income.

Mary Grace is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., as she would like to grow her business. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies, allowing her to increase profits from her crops and so send her children to school.

Toem S. was born in 1966 in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  She has a small family home and lives with others. 

She and her husband are rice growers. In addition, Toem hawks bananas around the village.  Her husband builds and sells wooden furniture. The couple has five kids who attend school or work. 

Toem faces difficulty with irrigating her crop because her field is located away the water system.  Because of the obstacle, she is applying for a loan to buy a machine to pump water.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren L. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His only daughter is a student at the State Arts School of Ulaanbaatar. Lhagvasuren's family moved to the capital city from the countryside in 2000. In the beginning, he did not know what to do, but he eventually rented someone's car and drove it as a taxi in the city. Later, he bought a car for himself with the profits he earned and drives his own car as a taxi now. Since he is good at repairing old cars, he usually purchases broken cars and fixes them up to sell them at a higher price. It gives him a chance to earn extra income besides his main taxi business. In the future, he dreams of having his own car repair shop where he would be able to do what he is best at and fix many types of small cars.

Right now he is requesting a loan to fix his own car and buy necessary accessories for his taxi car.

loans.use: To fix his own car and buy necessary accessories for his taxi business

texts.en:
Rosalinda M., 34 years old, is a farmer. She helps her husband till a one-hectare farm to produce quality corn to feed and clothe their family. She has been a farmer since she got married. The income her family gets from the farm is helpful in paying the daily expenses in their home. She joined in the CEVI credit program in 2008 and really likes the program.

She would like to request another loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so that she will be able to have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L., 43 years old, is a rice farmer and a sari-sari store owner from Banga, South Cotabato. She said that her family relies very much on her farm and store. Whatever income she makes from growing rice and from selling goods helps her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs.

She would like to request a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise for her store. In that way, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Farm supplies and additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

texts.en: Ang C. is a single man who currently lives with his parents and his three siblings, who are working as farmers and silk weavers. Ang C. works to farm rice as well as weaving silk skirts, from which he earns a living. Recently he has exhausted his silk stock and he is looking for a loan to be used to buy more silk to continue weaving.

loans.name: Boun

texts.en:
Mrs. Boun R., age 51, is a good mother caring for five kids. Two of her children are already married and have started new homes and the others are single. Boun R. has a store on the street where she and her husband sell a variety of desserts to passers-by. She normally starts selling her items in the evening and finishes in the middle of the night. She is generating approximately $6 income per day to help solve her family’s problems. Boun R. will be used her first loan to purchase a vehicle for transportation. She proposes to spend any remainder on enlarging her business. 
Boun R. was busy buying her ingredients at the market when the photo was taken so her husband appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to use as transportation

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Armelinda P., 44, is a resident of Minsubong, Tangub City. She is married to George P. and blessed with 5 children, who are now in their teens and school age. Her husband earns an average net income of just 2,700 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $58 US) from labor and because of this they have experienced hardships in raising their children.  

To help her husband, Armelinda decided to engage in charcoal buying and selling. For 6 years, she was able to sustain it even in times of crisis. Currently she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,600 PHP (about $78 US) a month, which is very helpful in supporting the family. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao: we were named Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

As this is her second loan, Armelinda was allowed to request a loan of 8,000 PHP to add her capital for her business. She will use the future income from this business for her family's daily needs and to save for her children's future.

loans.use: Additional capital for charcoal sales business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima M. is from the village of Dulapo. She is 60 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Maxima owns and operates a retail flower business, selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Maxima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Maxima is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Gia

texts.en: Gia S. is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo. She is 26 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Gia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Gia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nerlyn

texts.en:
Nerlyn B. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon, Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child.

Nerlyn operates business selling home made amakan (bamboo mat) products to tourist and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nerlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was use to invest in expanding her business.

Nerlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice P. is from the village of Barra. She is 48 years old, is single, and has one school-aged child. Alice owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Alice is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the education of her child. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en: Maria Luz B. is from the village of Daang Lungsod. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Maria Luz owns and operates a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Maria Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Maria Luz is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her children's education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga D. is forty-six years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His two sons are ten and thirteen years old and both go to a local secondary school. Battulga is a herder with livestock including horses, cattle, sheep, and goats. He has been herding animals for the last twenty years and is an experienced herder in the town. In the winter, he sends his animals to a better pastoral land. While he is away from his animals, he sells dairy products and meat. He rents a small shop where he sells various dairy products including cheese, curds, and milk cream, and meat such as beef and mutton for locals. He requests a loan to purchase more dairy products and increase shop inventory products to meet the demand from local customers.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and increase shop inventory

texts.en: Jamsran L. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's far western provinces. His two children both go to a local secondary school. Jamsran is a talented carpenter. He makes traditional wooden furniture such as chairs, tables, beds, etc. He has been making handcrafted traditional furniture since 2002. He is quite successful with his business at this point. His furniture is quite well known among the locals for its good quality and he has one full-time employee who helps him in his business. Besides the furniture, he also makes handcrafted traditional wood frame tents. Most of the local people live in wooden felt-covered tents in which Mongols have been living for more than thousands of years. For now, he has two purchase orders for fully equipped tents and he requests a loan to purchase the necessary wood and other materials to finish his two tent orders.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom V. is a local fisherman, aged 48. He relies on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake and the public ponds in the village. He normally uses a lot of equipment for fishing. He can make an average revenue of $4 per day to help be responsible for his family’s food needs. Besides this he also cultivates rice. His wife, who is 44, is named Thon. She sells the fish she gets from her husband's fishing in the market. The family has five children: four are single and one is married and lives independently, working as a fisher. As it approaches the dry season here there are good weather conditions for a rice drying business. Prom V. is lacking some farm supplies and is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and a cultivating machine for farming rice.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and a cultivating machine

loans.name: Keuk

texts.en: Y. is 46 years old and the mother of eight children who are still living at home. Two of her sons are employed as internal staff for a hotel. Y. sells fritters to people who are her nearby neighbors for a profit. In addition, her husband fishes in and around the Tunle Sap River. Y. requested a Kiva loan to build a new house many months ago but now the construction is suspended due to the lack of money to continue. Therefore, Y. would like to request a second loan to finish the construction.

loans.use: To finish the construction of a new house

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia C. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Letecia operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets and other fishing materials. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoem S., 42, is a widow and has four children. One of her children is married and the others are single. One of her daughters works in a garment factory. To earn a living, Chhoem S. plants a rice crop on land in the village. One of Chhoem S.’s daughters needs to get married but she doesn’t money to create a wedding party. Therefore, Chhoem S. looks for a loan in order to pay anything costs of creating a wedding party.

loans.use: To pay anything costs of creating a wedding party

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from the Village of Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-age children.

Merlyn operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling personal home products to local community members. She has operated her business for more than five years and she earns approximately 6,800 PHP per month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined Paglaum MPC to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 4,000 from PMPC.

Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improved the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her sari-sari store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Agnes owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling different cosmetic products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Agnes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to fully pay for a television and to support monthly payments of her refrigerator. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to fully pay for the said refrigerator. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. Agnes plans to own more appliances for the family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete the payment for her refrigerator

texts.en: Piriyev A. is 58 years old. He is married and has three children. A. lives in Baku city. He has had a taxi business for 20 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

Pen S., 25, is a mother who is caring for one child. She owns and runs a small wooden store in front of her house, where she sells little snack foods and some groceries for her neighborhood in the village. She is married to Sopheak, 28, who is a local goldsmith. S. needs a loan to purchase a use motorbike which she will use to make her family transportation easier.

Mrs. Yorn R. lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband and her two teenage children. Both of the children are students in the local public school. Mrs. Yorn R. earns a living by making silk skirts by hand. On a typical day, she makes one or two skirts for her customers. Most of her clients also come to receive the advance for a few days or a week. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and farmer. Recently Yorn R. has received many orders from her clients but she does not have enough silk to make the orders. That is why she is applying for a loan to buy more silk from other weavers to fulfill the orders from her customers.

Yashar A. is married. He has one child. Yashar was born in 1974. A.'s family lives in Baku city. He has had a taxi business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

S. is 52 years old and resides in Kandal Province in Cambodia, where he makes a living as a fisherman. He earns an average of US$3 per day. He is married with five children. Three of his children are single and two are married. His wife, Touch, age 42, is a local mat maker. She can earn approximately US$3 a day to help with the family's expenses. S. is applying for a loan which he will use to buy fresh fish. He will then turn them into paste fish to sell for an additional profit. With any remaining money from the loan, he will purchase mats for his wife to sell

loans.name: Anayo Bethrand

texts.en: Mr. O. was born in Enugu, Nigeria but now works in the Kégué region of Lomé, Togo. He works selling spare auto parts and has been in the business for over a year.  He is married and has one child. This will be his first loan with WAGES. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of auto parts for resale. The profits from this loan will help Mr. O. reinvest in his business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spare auto parts

texts.en: Ramal A. lives in Baku city. He is 20 years old and single. Ramal has had a cattle breeding business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

Mr. A. was born in 1972 and is trained as a taxi driver. He now works with the Société Générale des Moulins du Togo as a wheat flour supplier. He is married and has over 10 years experience in this field. With this loan from WAGES, Mr. A. will purchase 27 bags of wheat flour for resale. This loan will allow him to continue his endeavor in this profitable sector.

loans.name: Albina's Group

texts.en:
Lives of many people turn out in such a way that they do not get an opportunity to go to college. The circumstances force these people to go to work as soon as they graduate from high school. The life makes these people grow up earlier and start supporting their families, whereas their peers may still enjoy their youth. However, there is an advantage to this state of affairs. Beginning to support one’s family from early age makes this person mature and better prepared for life. From this point they could regard themselves even as fortunate ones. T. K. Albina, the leader of this group, is one of these fortunate youngsters, who started earning their livelihood at an early age. Albina is nineteen years old. She is single and lives with her family. She has a sister, who is two years younger than her. Albina combines two jobs. During her spare time she helps her mother, who is occupied with manufacturing traditional articles of bedding and coverlets. Her mother used to work in a sewing workshop, but because of the low salary, she decided to start her own business. Albina has applied for this loan to help her mother purchase fabric and expand their business.

Albina’s partners are:

Ainur, 45, is single. She lives with her father. Because of her father’s illness Ainur is temporarily not working, as she has to stay by her father’s side and take care of him. Her brother provides them with food and medicine. Ainur needs this loan to buy a washing machine, a DVD player and a ton of coal. 

Svetlana, 47, is a mother of four children. Her husband works as a bus driver. Svetlana is a teacher in an elementary school. One of Svetlana’s daughters goes to college and Svetlana needs a loan to pay for tuition. 

Alisa, 55, lives in a city of Balykchi. Alisa trades in sea–buckthorn. Her husband, 65, is retired. Her youngest son, 21, works as a waiter in a café. At weekends he helps Alisa sell the sea–buckthorn. Alisa has applied for this loan to purchase ten sheep for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and expand her business

texts.en: Aliheydar was born in 1989. He lives in Baku city, and he is single. Aliheydar G. has a cafe business. He has been in this business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs to improve his cafe.

Vladimir is married with 5 sons. He and his wife have a family business - growing early spring vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, etc) in greenhouses. They have been in this business for 20 years. They moved to this particular location 3 years ago though. All his sons help their parents in business too. Vladimir would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to build three more greenhouses that would allow him to increase the sales in spring. Vladimir would also like to purchase some land from his neighbor to build even more greenhouses next year.

loans.name: Amelegan

texts.en: Mrs. A. runs a busy general store in Lomé, Togo. She is married to a taxi driver, and they have 3 children. She has been running this business for almost 15 years, and is asking for her first loan from WAGES to expand her stock. With this loan, Mrs. A. will purchase 5 bags of rice, 10 drums of oil, and a variety of other products needed to fill her shelves.

loans.use: To buy a variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Dope Afi

texts.en: Mrs. G. is a married mother of two. She works selling firewood and charcoal from her home in Lomé, and has been in this business since 2005. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will use to refill her supply of charcoal, firewood, and any products necessary to keep her business running smoothly. This loan will help her continue to support her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married. He and his wife Anzhella have two children. Evgeniy sells sport shoes at one of the markets in Melitopol town. He started this business 12 years ago. Today he owns two business locations and offers a large assortment of sport shoes to his clients. Evgeniy loves wearing sport shoes himself and enjoys his work. 
Evgeniy would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase winter inventories. He hopes to increase his sales and save enough money to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase sport shoes to sell.

texts.en: Nadir is married. He has 3 children and he was born in 1968. D.'s family live in Baku city. Nadir D. has cooked and sold kebabs for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy meat to improve his business.

texts.fr: Madame Amy D. âgée de 64 ans est vendeuse de légumes dans sa localité à Bambey. C’est une activité qu’elle a embrassée par passion depuis 20 ans. Elle est mère d’enfants âgés et c’est  toujours l’amour du commerce qui la motive sur les affaires. Elle sollicite,ainsi, un crédit de 100 000 frs CFA pour acheter des légumes verts comme les navets, les carottes, les aubergines et du piment. Elle compte avec ce crédit  relancer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa  charmante clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy D., aged 64, is a vegetable seller in her village of Bambey. She started this business with a great passion 20 years ago and her love for her business is still motivating her. She is the mother of grown-up children. She applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to buy fresh vegetables, such as turnips, carrots, eggplant and pepper. This loan will hopefully enable Amy to stimulate her business and better serve her charming clientele.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbacke Modou, célibataire âgé de 23 ans est boutiquier à Bambey. C’est après son apprentissage à l’école coranique qu’il a embrassé ce secteur. Ainsi, à la recherche d’une certaine indépendance et à défaut de qualification professionnelle, Monsieur Modou Mbacke décida d’ouvrir une boutique dans son quartier. Cependant, Monsieur Mbacke demande un crédit de 150 000 frs CFA pour réapprovisionner  sa boutique. Il compte acheter avec le prêt du riz, de l’huile et du sucre qui sont des marchandises très prisées par la communauté. Avec cette première demande de crédit, Monsieur Modou Mbacké espère accroitre ses bénéfices afin d’être bien considérer dans sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Mbacké, aged 23, is single and a storekeeper in Bambey. He launched his business after having studied at the Islamic school. In his quest for some independence and since he mastered no craft, he decided to open a convenience store in his neighborhood. He applies now for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to resupply his store. He will buy rice, oil and sugar, which are products in high demand in the local community. This is Mr. Mbacké’s first loan and he hopes that it will enable him to increase his earnings and be well regarded in his family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and sugar

texts.en:
Mr. G. is a tailor who works from home. This popular, yet challenging, profession is essential to creating the colourful Togolese attire seen throughout the country.

Mr. G. lives with his girlfriend and has one child. This will be his first loan with WAGES, which he will use to purchase a sewing machine and make other improvements to his workplace. With this loan, Mr. G.’s professional life and personal life will continue to prosper.

texts.fr:
Caissière en stage à IMCEC Bambey, Madame Aïda Camara S. sollicite un financement de 300 000 frs CFA pour relancer une activité secondaire. Elle compte acheter  avec  ce crédit des produits céréaliers (mil, arachide, niébé) qu’elle place sur le marché de Bambey.  
Entré dans le commerce  par passion et pour aider son mari retraité, Madame S. ne veut pas rater l’opportunité d’avoir  des produits hivernaux au bon marché dans la zone. Elle pense gagner beaucoup dans ce commerce afin d’améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille en prenant en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A cashier in training at IMCEC Bambey, Ms. Aïda Camara S. is requesting financing in the amount of 300,000 francs CFA to restart a secondary business.  She plans on using this loan to buy grains (millet, peanuts, black-eye peas) to put on the Bambey market.  In commerce for the love of it and to help her retired husband, Ms. S. doesn't want to miss the chance to obtain off-season goods locally.  She believes she will earn a lot in this business, so as to improve her family's living conditions by meeting the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mr. A. is a trained nurse who runs a clinic in Adidogomé, Togo. He has been running this business since 2007. He is married and has one child. 

This will be his first loan with WAGES, which will be used to restock his pharmaceuticals and purchase any other supplies needed for the clinic.  This loan will help Mr. A. help others in need.

Jean M., who is 55 years old, owns a small rice field in Santo Nino, South Cotabato. She said that she needs additional capital to run her rice farm business because the farm supplies are expensive.  Her family relies on the income she makes from the farm. The harvest is saved for family consumption while the remainder is sold to rice traders for additional income for the family.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow more of her crop and better support her family.

Analyn, 33 years old, is a married woman. She has three children, the oldest being seven years old. She is a rice farmer. According to her, farming is like gambling. There are times that you win and also times that you lose. But Analyn is determined to go on and win. She works hard to ensure her crops are healthy and that they will produce an abundant harvest.

She applied for a loan to assist her farm financially. She requested 12,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use this loan to purchase the supplies she needs on her farm, like seeds, fertilizers and also crude oil for the tractor.

Goncha N. lives in the Fuzuli region. She is 50 years old. She is the mother of three children. Goncha has been cooking "qutab" (a sort of pancake turnover stuffed with minced lamb, cheese or spinach) for three years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN for improving her business.

49-year-old Nena has been married to her husband, Felix, for twenty-seven years. They are blessed with four children. The oldest among their children is twenty-four years old. Nena is involved in rice farming. The farm was inherited from her parents. She works hard to maintain it and keep it productive so she can earn more. She said that her farm is now being prepared for the next planting.

She joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to gain access to its financial services. She applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP. This loan will help increase Nena’s working capital. She will now be able to fund her farm.

Juvy is a 34-year-old rice farmer. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is now twenty years old. Juvy wants to give her kids a bright future. She tills her 1-hectare of rice field with patience. She makes sure weeds do not grow at her farm, to keep her crops growing healthy. Like any other farmer, she also wants to have an abundant harvest.

Juvy joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, in the hope of having access to financial services. Her previous loans were used to finance her farm. Now she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to be used for her farm. This loan will help immensely to grow Juvy’s farm.

31-year-old Erwin is a hard-working farmer. He is married and has four young children. His oldest child is only nine years old. He wants them to have a proper education and have a bright future. Erwin shares that his farm is now being prepared for planting. He also said that he needs seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. He will use this loan to finance his farm. Hopefully, this loan may help Erwin double his harvest and will give him a better income.

Leonore, 29 years old, is the mother of an 8-year-old child. She has been married to her husband, Rufel, for nine years. She is engaged in rice farming to earn a living. She works hard to keep up with her family’s growing needs. She also wants to save up for her child’s future. Her farm currently needs farm supplies.

She borrowed 12,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use this loan to fund her farm. With this loan, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies she needs.

32-year-old Marites is the mother of two kids. She has been married to her husband, Ramie, since 1998. Their oldest child is now 11 years old. She does farming for a living. She cultivates her land for rice crops. She chose to plant rice because it is the basic food for Filipinos, so it is easier to sell. She also does not want to sell just any other rice; she wants to serve people in her community the best kind of rice.

Marites joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to gain access to its financial services. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies, like quality seeds and fertilizers. This loan will help her achieve her goals.

Kim is a 24-year-old farmer. He got married a year ago and now has a 1-year-old baby. Now that he has his own family, he doubles his efforts in farming. He also raises chickens and pigs to add income for his family. He has dreams for his family, especially his child.

Kim used to borrow money from individuals who charged high interest. It was hard for him, because he ended up with nearly nothing. Now that he is a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI, he is grateful for the financial service he gained access to, especially its low interest rate. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

23-year-old Hernane is the father of a 1-year-old. He got married to his wife, Almaluna, in 2007. He is a rice farmer. He works hard to keep up with his family’s needs. He also wants to save up for his child’s future. To finance his farm, he used to borrow money from individuals who charged very high interest. This brought problems for him, because he barely had any income for his family. Upon learning about the Kiva field partneer,  CEVI, he made sure to settle his obligations and then joined the MFI. He likes its program, especially the low interest rate offered. He is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will use this loan to finance his farm by purchasing farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and other needs.

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 2 enfants,  Madame Sala D.  s’active dans le commerce  depuis 2006. Elle a été influencée par sa maman dans la vente  des tissus de choix différents  dans  tout Bambey. Par rapport à l’importance de sa clientèle, elle décida d’adhérer  à l’IMCEC Bambey   afin de bénéficier d’un prêt. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs CFA. Elle compte avec ce financement  acheter des tissus  afin de livrer  à une bonne partie de ses clients qui  préparent les fêtes de fin d’année. Ainsi, les bénéfices gagnés pourraient lui permetttre de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 2 children, Madam D. Sala has been engaged in trading since 2006. She was influenced by her mother in the sale of different fabrics in the whole of Bambey town. With regards to the importance of her clientele, she decided to join IMCEC Bambey inorder to benefit from a loan. This is why she is requesting a loan of 150,000 frs CFA. She intends, with this loan, to buy fabrics in order to deliver to a good number of her customers who are preparing for the New Year's party. Profits, thus realized, could enable her to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge is a diligent farmer. He is 35 years old, married and has a 1-year-old child. He plants rice on his farm. He spends most of his time at the farm, making sure it’s free of weeds and other pests. He wants to achieve an abundant harvest so he can earn more. He wants to improve his family’s living conditions and save for his child’s future.

Jorge became a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI, early this year. He used his first loan to finance his farm. Now he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. With this loan, Jorge will be able to buy farm supplies like fertilizers to be used at his farm. He will also be able to pay the laborers who help at the farm.

Marianita, 52 years old, is a married woman. She farms for a living. She plants rice crops on her farm. She sells the harvest and saves some for her family’s consumption. Marianita wants to increase her income so she works hard to make her farm productive.

Needing additional capital, she turned to the Kiva field partner, CEVI, a micro-finance institution in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP. Marianita will use this loan to buy seeds, complete fertilizers and other farm supplies. She will also buy crude oil for the tractor.

27-year-old Lian is a resident of Agusan Del Sur. Like most of the people in her town, she farms for a living. She plants rice, which is one of the major agricultural crops in her area. She has experienced failures in farming, like some of her friends who also farm. Despite that, she is determined to succeed.

Lian joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to gain access to its financial services and get the help she needs for her farm. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will help Lian on her way to success.

Hydie, 32 years old, is a married woman. She has three children, and her oldest is only seven years old. She has dreams for her family, especially her children. She wants all of them to have a proper education and a bright future.

Working at her farm can be very tiring, but Hydie keeps herself strong enough so that she can still take care of her family. She and her husband work hand-in-hand in doing farming chores. Their farm is now being prepared for planting.

Hydie requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies needed at their farm.

Joebert is a 28-year-old married man. His wife, Rosalie, is pregnant with their first baby. Joebert farms for a living. He plants rice crops. Now that they are anticipating a baby, he works extra hard to secure their finances. He makes sure his farm will be productive so he will have a good income.

He also sought the help of one of Kiva's field partners, CEVI, which is a micro-finance institution in the Philippines, to assist his farm financially. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers and other needs.

33-year-old Arnold is the father of two children. He is married and his oldest child is only 1-year-old. Arnold is a rice farmer. He is happy to say that his business is going well, and he was able to save a small amount of money from the last harvest. He wants to continue saving so he can give his children a proper education.

Arnold is a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI. He is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which he will use to finance his farm. With this loan, he will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farming necessities. This loan will also help Arnold earn more.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is only thirteen years old. Her children go to school.

Josefina works hard to support her children's needs and education. She is involved in rice farming. She said that failure is really not absent when it comes to farming, especially if you lack financially.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to its financial service. She applied for a loan of Php10,000. This loan will be used for farm inputs, like seeds, fertilizers, and crude oil for the tractor.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and crude oil for the tractor.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, inició la Señora  Josefina V.,  domiciliada en el Barrio Padre Damián de la Zona de Pdte. Franco. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El mismo se denomina “La Esperanza”;  las mismas están  en el Octavo Ciclo, cuenta con 23 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable; ellas tienen actividades diferentes, como ser: venta de: joyas,  ropas, perfumes, remedios yuyos, venta de hamburguesa, etc. Otras, están emprendiendo una nueva labor.
Las Señoras retiran un crédito de g s 300.000  hasta 1100.000gs para la compra de mercaderías para la posterior venta.

texts.en:
The group "La Esperanza" was formed initially by Josefina V., a resident of Padre Damián neighborhood in the area of Pdte. Franco. Josefina contacted her neighbors and friends in the area to form a group together. The women of the group are now in their eighth loan cycle with 23 members. As a group, the women stand out in their community because of their solidarity, unity, and responsibility. They work in many different industries, such as selling clothing, jewelry, medicines, food, and the like. Others in the group are working to learn a new trade. In their prior loan cycle, the ladies received individual loans ranging from 300,000 guaranis (approx. $63 USD) to 1,100,000 guaranis (approx. $233 USD), for the purchase of merchandise. The group members work in the following industries, as follows: Gladys Zunilda O., Deisy V., and Celina B. sell herbal remedies. Lissa López sells perfumes. Gloria M. sells fruit. Rosalía Benítez sells lottery tickets. Irene González is a seamstress. María M. and María López cook and sell meals. Carmen A., Josefina V., and Gloria Rodríguez run food pantries. Estela T. sells jewelry. Eduarda R. sells hamburgers. Amalia E., Aida G., Graciela Fariña, Susana P., Nilda T., Gloria López, Andrea M., Mirian C., and Norma T. sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise including clothing, jewelry, perfumes, fabric for dressmaking, and herbal remedies.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Descripción: Doña María es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos mayores y cuenta con el apoyo de todos ellos, con sus 44 años ella sigue con espíritu jovial y emprendedor, trabaja desde tempranas horas; ella se dedica en la compra de mercaderías del Brasil y la Argentina y las comercializa en su salón comercial ubicado en el mercado de Ciudad del Este. 
Doña María tiene casa propia, pues, la construyo con el sudor de su frente y necesita de un apoyo crediticio constante por que la única manera de obtener mayor ingreso es mejorando los precios de las compras, el cual puede conseguir adquiriendo los productos que comercializa al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ms. María is a single mother, she has 4 grown children and she can count on the support of each of them. At her 44 years she still has a cheerful and enterprising spirit. She works from early in the morning at purchasing merchandise from Brasil and Argentina and she commercializes it in her store, located in the market in Ciudad del Este.

Ms. María owns her own home, which she built by the sweat of her brow, and she needs a financial support because the only way to increase revenue is by getting better prices in her purchases, which she can achieve by buying the products she sells by bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, sugar, flour, noodles, rice, bread products, dairy products and others

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan de _C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “ están en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 21  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité de Mujeres Santa María posee un ahorro gs 2.030.000.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
 Cada una realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a la facilidad que posee cada integrante así Doña Gladyz trabaja en su pequeño negocio que posee en su casa, el negocio es una despensa con todos los artículos de primera necesidad para la casa y es atendida por toda la familia. Así con el apoyo de su familia la señora Gladyz trabaja día a día para mantener a su familia y agradece a la fundación por el crédito concedido.

texts.en:
Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan began this group. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in the area known as the Zone. The group is called Santa Maria and is in its forth loan cycle with 21 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because the members, possessing a great entrepreneurial spirit, are very united, committed, and responsible to each other. Since they began efforts to collect funds for the group the Women of Santa Maria have accumulated an amount of 2,030,000 PYG. They withdraw loans of 300,000 to 1,000,000 PYG to buy merchandise for future sale. Each member undertakes a different activity according to her skills and abilities, so Doña Gladyz works in a small business that she has in her house. The business is a shop with all the items of basic necessity for the home. With the help of all the family members, Señora Gladyz works day by day to maintain her family. She thanks the foundation for the credit extended to her. 1) Rosalina R. - Sells drinks 2) Blanca López - Sale of electronics 3) Jacinta Salguero - Clothing sales 4) Natividad Fernández - Clothing sales 5) Nelly Sánchez – Has a shop 6) Marta P. - Sale of undergarmets 7) María V. - Clothing sales 8) Sinforiana Espínola - Sells cleaning products 9) María Fernández - Sewing. 10) Ubalda A. - Used clothing sales 11) Eusebia O. - Clothing sales 12) Rosana B. - Clothing sales 13) Fidelina Carísimo - Sells jewelery and clothing 14) Delia Oviedo - Sells empanadas 15) María González - Clothing sales 16) Cristina I. - Sells shoes 17) Elsa R. - Sewing 18) Elena M. - Underwear sales 19) Gladys O. – Has a shop 20) Lucia A. - Sells drinks 21) Celia I. - Sells empanadas

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale to meet basic needs like flour, sugar, meat, and oil and other products like clothing, shoes, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: San Ignacion Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inicio la Señora Delia L. quien vive en la zona del km 10 Acaray de   _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina” San Ignacio“ están en el Sexto Ciclo   con 17  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas.
Cada una recibió su crédito y lo invierte de forma independiente de acuerdo a la actividad a que se dedican cada una de las integrantes, así cada una son mujeres madres muy sacrificada que luchan para satisfacer todas las necesidades básicas de sus familias.
La Sra Esabel E. se dedica a la venta de ropa y su marido es albañil, la pareja tiene 4 hijos y los trabjan desde muy temprana hora de la mañana para trabajar. Doña Isabel se traslada a diferentes zonas y recorre de casa en casa para vender sus productos. 
Ella  comenta que el trabajo es nuy sacrificado pero que lo debe realizar por su familia y en ocasiones ayuda bastante los ingresos que obtengo. Agradezco a la Fundación por la ayuda que me brindaron por que mediante el crédito pude adquirir nuevas prendas y conseguir nuevos y mas clientes.

texts.en:
Delia L. started the group. She lives in the neighborhood Km 10 Acaray of C.D.E. She contacted her neighbors and friends in her community to form the group. The group is called San Ignacio. They are in their sixth cycle, and there are 17 members. In the neighborhood the group stands out for being very united, supportive, and responsible. Each one received their loan, and they invested it independently in their own business. They are all sacrificing mothers who fight to provide all of their families’ necessities. Esabel E. sells clothes, and her husband is a bricklayer. They have four children. They both start work at a very early hour in the morning. Isabel travels to different areas to go door to door to sell her products. She says that the work is arduous, but she needs to do it for her family. Sometimes the income she gets really helps. I am grateful to the Foundation for the help they have given me. With the loan I was able to get new articles of clothing and more new customers. 1 Delia L. Sells Plastics 2 Sonia Espínola Sells Clothes 3 Miguelina Vázquez Sells Fruit 4 Silvina D. Santos Sells Clothes 5 Celina C.. Sells Footwear 6 Benigna B.. Sells Clothes 7 Benigna C. Sells Clothes and Footwear 8 Carolina Vázquez Manicure and Pedicure 9 Liliana A.. Sells CDS y Electronics 10 Maximiana F. Sells Vegetables 11 Francisca López Sells Fruit 12 María A. Sells Perfume 13 Isabel E. Sells Clothes 14 Elizabeth González. Sells Clothes 15 Marlene B. Sells Clothes 16 Maria R. Grocery Store 17 Ramona E. Sells Fruit

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, plastics, basic needs items like oil, flour, sugar, fruit, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité, inició la señora Gloria Coronel, integrante del comité Fronteras del Este de la zona del km 10 Acaray _C.D.E.
Ella es amiga de la señora Olga Soto, quien vive en la zona del km 10 Acaray. La  señora contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona .
El mismo se denomina “Santa Lucía”;  las mismas están  en el Décimo Primer  Ciclo; cuenta con 16  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable; ellas tienen actividades diferentes, como ser: venta de: joyas,  ropas,pollo , cosméticos, medias , etc . Otras, están emprendiendo una nueva labor.
Las Señoras retiran un crédito de gs 300.000  hasta 1.500.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para la posterior venta.
