texts.en:
Gloria Coronel started the group. She is a member of the Fronteras del Este group in the neighborhood Km 10 Acaray _ C.D.E. She is a friend of Olga Soto who lives in the neighborhood Km 10 Acaray _ C.D.E. She contacted her neighbors and friends in the neighborhood to form the group. The group is called Santa Lucía, and they are in their eleventh loan cycle. There are 16 members, and the group stands out in the neighborhood for being united, supportive, and responsible. They have different activities like selling jewelry, clothes, chicken, cosmetics, and hosiery, etc. Some are undertaking new work. The women are taking out a loan of between 300,000 gs to 1,500,000 gs to buy merchandise to later sell. 1 Donatilda A. Beauty Salon 2 Graciela Larrea Sells Cosmetics 3 Gladys A. Grocery Store 4 Leónida V. Grocery Store 5 Lilian V. Sells Underwear and Hosiery 6 Carmen R. D. Sells Food 7 Ilda B. Sells Cosmetics 8 Felisa J. Grocery Store 9 Susana A. Sells Clothes 10 Tranquilina N. Sells Jewelry 11 Ninfa Bénega Sells Used Clothes 12 Catalina G. Grocery Store 13 Alejandra V. Sells Chicken 14 Magdalena Patiño Sells Clothes 15 Victorina V. Sells Cleaning Products 16 Bernarda D. Sells Clothes

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs merchandise, clothes, chicken, cleaning products, and other products like jewelry, cosmetics, and hosiery, etc.

texts.en:
Mr. Erwin B. is a 36-year-old man who has two children with the oldest 8 years old.

Erwin is into farming, growing rice crops on his land. Aside from that, he also owns a furniture shop where he keeps himself busy when farming duties do not call.

Erwin wants to grow his business so he can help improve his family’s living conditions. He applied for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to add to his working capital. He will use this loan to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

texts.fr:
-Madame Mame Dior L. est une femme âgée de 33 ans .C’est une habitante de Camberene, parente bénéficiaire, societaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2004 .Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur qu’elle a rembourse correctement. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 5 ans et s’adonne à la vente de tissus et khartoume qu’elle fait souvent confectionner. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour augmenter son stock de tissus pour bien répondre a la demande de sa clientèle et diversifier son choix de tissus a offrir. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de roulement pour mieux développer son activité.
Madame L. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Madam Mame Dior L. is a 33 year old woman. She lives in Camberene, recipient parent, member of the U-IMCEC Fund since January 2004. She has already benefitted from a previous loan which she repaid. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She 's been in the trading business for more than 5 years and is devoted to the sale of fabrics and Khartoume which she often makes. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs to increase her stock of fabrics inorder to meet the the requests of her clientele and diversify her fabrics for sale. The increase in profits will enable her raise her working capital in order to grow her business. Madam L. is a beneficiary of a protocol arrangement between U-IMCEC and the Program for the Development of the Child and Family(PDCF), Seydina Issa Laye. PDCF tries to reduce poverty within the community and to protect especially children from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these destitute families can benefit from loans on more soft terms with regard to standard loans. Since the takeoff of this protocol arrangement in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding for amounts which varies between 50, 000 and 150, 000 frs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

41-year-old Cecil J. is a married woman. She has two children and her oldest is now 22.

Rice farming is Cecil’s livelihood and she keeps herself strong to endure the work required at the farm. She enjoys farming though because it gives her income and thus helps her achieve her dream to give her children a bright future.

Cecil joined CEVI in 2008 and her previous loans were used to finance her farm. Now, she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000, which will be used to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and other items.

26-year-old Meliza is a married woman who has an 8-year-old child whom she loves taking care of.

Meliza is a rice farmer. She does her best at farming because she wants her farm to be productive. She shared that her land is now being prepared for planting and she will need seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

To help her acquire farm inputs, Meliza applied for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. With this loan, she will be able to fund her farm.

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Anarkul E. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-two years old. Anarkul, being a hardworking woman and having a good husband by her side, has been fortunate as she has easily passed all possible difficulties in her life. Together they have raised six children: the eldest daughter and son are married and live separately with their families; another son also lives separately and works in Bishkek as a driver; the rest of the children still go to school. To help their children successfully finish high school and stand on their own feet, Anarkul and her husband raise cattle. Ten years ago, Anarkul’s and her husband’s parents gave them a cow and ten sheep for breeding. Since then, animal husbandry has been their main source of income and has enabled them to achieve the marriage of their two children. Now, from selling milk and trading in cattle, Anarkul makes $115 a month. Anarkul and her husband have many plans about increasing the total population of their livestock. Now, Anarkul hopes to get this loan as it would enable her to buy two calves to raise and sell. They need to earn extra money so that they can pay for their daughter’s college education, as she is graduating from high school this academic year. Anarkul’s partners are: Venera, 38, has three children. To support her family her husband works as a taxi-driver. Besides that, Venera keeps two calves and works as a logistics manager’s assistant. Venera has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition. Gulnara, 46, has three children. Her husband works as a training officer in a vocational school and Gulnara works as a doctor at the same school. After work she sells apples and keeps two calves. Gulnara needs this loan to purchase three sheep for breeding. Anarkul, 44, is divorced and has one son, 25, who works as a builder in a resort. Anarkul keeps a calf, which she is going to sell after raising it. As to her regular job, she is a cook at the vocational school. Anarkul hopes to obtain this loan and buy a foal. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two calves to raise and sell

texts.es: El Sr. Lindon,   es un cliente nuevo que vive junto a su esposa Julia y su hija en un terreno que les  otorgaron sus suegros ubicada en la calle 4 , el señor T. trabaja como transportista propietario en la linea de trufis y esta solicitando este credito para terminar la compra de una cama elastica (juego infantil),  el destino del credito ayudara a la familia a iniciarse en el negocio de juegos para niños, ya que la familia politica de Lindon tiene un negocio de juegos inflables para niños que hasta el momento les genera buenos ingresos y es por este motivo que Lindon y Julia decidieron comprarle la cama elastica para emprender este nuevo negocio y generar mas ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Lindon is a new client. He lives with his wife, Julia, and his daughter on land that his in-laws gave them. It is located on street four. Señor T. works as the owner driver for the Trufis line. He is asking for this loan to finish buying a trampoline. The loan will help his family start in the business of toys for children. Lindon’s in-laws have a business of inflatable toys for children, and it generates good income. That is why Lindon and Julia decided to buy a trampoline to undertake this new business and generate more income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
-Madame Oumy  Magane est une femme mariée d’une trentaine d’années qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle est parente bénéficiaire, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2009. En ce qui la concerne c’est son mari qui l’a encourage dans le commerce de tissus, d’habits prêt a porter et divers autres articles .Ainsi elle l’a expérimenté pendant 2 ans et a toujours eu un résultat  satisfaisant. L ‘accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet d’une part d’augmenter progressivement son stock de marchandises et d’autre part de participer symboliquement aux petites  dépenses quotidiennes .Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs.
Madame Lo est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Madam Oumy Magane is a married woman of about thirty years of age who lives in the Camberene locality. She is a recipient parent, married and the mother of a child. She is a member of U-IMCEC Fund since November 2009. As far as she is concerned, it is her husband who encouraged her in the trade of fabrics, ready-to-wear clothing and various other products. Hence, she tried it for 2 years and had always had a satisfactory result. The increase in her pofits enable her, on one hand, to increase gradually her stock of goods and to assist symbolically with the small daily expenses. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs. Madam Lo is a benefiaciary of a protocol arrangement between U-IMCEC and the Program for Developement of Child and Family (PDCF) Seydina Issa Laye. PDCF tries to reduce poverty within the community and to protect especially children from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these destitute families can benefit from loans on more soft terms as compared to standard loans. Since the takeoff of this protocol arrangement in December 2008, 120 parents received funding for amounts which varies between 50, 000 and 150,000 frs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Shayirbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Бекбоева Шайырбубу – лидер данной группы. Шайырбубу сорок четыре года. Она живёт в маленьком г. Кант. В связи с безработицей, жители города торгуют на базаре, либо уезжают на заработки в Россию. Шайырбубу находилась дома, воспитывала детей. Муж устроился разнорабочим в одно из предприятий города. Шайырбубу постаралась извлечь материальную пользу даже из вынужденного нахождения дома. Пятнадцать лет назад, на накопленные деньги Шайырбубу купила телёнка и начала заниматься увеличением поголовья скота. Сейчас она также находится дома и воспитывает младшего сына. Старший сын уже вырос. Благодаря имеющейся живности, они вместе с мужем женили старшего сына. У Шайырбубу уже имеется кое – какая живность. Она ежедневно сдаёт десять литров молока по десять сом за литр ($0,23). Итого, за месяц ей удаётся заработать две тысячи семьсот сомов ($63), не выходя из дома. В своё время она потратила на покупку теленка всего восемь тысяч сомов ($190). После работы и муж, и старший сын помогают Шайырбубу поить, кормить и пасти скот. Да и сама Шайырбубу, в течение стольких лет стала довольно опытным скотоводом. Шайырбубу увидела непочатый край возможностей в этой сфере и решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота на откорм и перепродажу. 

У Шайырбубу четыре партнёра по группе:

Замиру пятьдесят лет. Он отец троих детей. Жена Замира работает учительницей в средней школе. Замир перевозит пассажиров на своём микроавтобусе. Замир выдал дочку замуж и женил старшего сына. Сейчас ему нужен кредит, чтобы починить мотор микроавтобуса. 

Розе пятьдесят два года. Она вдова и мать троих детей. Младшему сыну семнадцать лет. Роза нигде не работает. Она у себя дома разводит скот. Дети помогают Розе по хозяйству. Старший сын работает плотником. Дочь замужем и живёт отдельно. Роза надеется получить кредит и купить два гола МРС на откорм. 

Сайрагул тридцать девять лет. У неё пятеро детей. Старшему сыну шестнадцать, а младшей дочке всего четыре годика. Сайрагул держит коров и продаёт молоко. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить ещё одну тёлку. 

Кыял двадцать три года. Она замужем. Муж работает охранником в г. Бишкек. У Кыял маленький двухлетний сын. Она ежедневно продаёт молоко по десять литров в день. Кыял обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить дойную корову.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Shayirbubu B. is the leader of this group. Shayirbubu is forty-four years old. She lives in the small town of Kant. Because of unemployment, townsfolk trade at the market or leave to work in Russia. Shayirbubu stayed home and raised children. Her husband was employed as a handyman for the city. Shayirbubu has tried to make money even though she must keep house. Fifteen years ago, with money she saved, Shayirbubu bought a calf and started to work raising cattle. Now, she still stays home to raise her younger son. Her elder son has already grown. Thanks to her work, she and her husband have managed to marry off their older son. Shayirbubu is already making a sort of living. Daily, she sells more than ten liters of milk at ten som per liter ($.23). In total, for a month, she manages to earn two thousand, seven hundred som ($63) without leaving the house. During her career, she has spent, in total, eight thousand som ($190) for calves. After work, her husband and elder son help Shayirbubu to water, feed and graze the cattle. Shayirbubu, during during these years, has become a skilled cattleman. Shayirbubu has seen a plenty of possibilities in this sphere and has decided to apply for a loan to buy some heads of small livestock to fatten and resell. Shayirbubu has four partners in the group: Zamir is fifty years old. He is the father of three children. Zamir's wife works as a high school teacher. Zamir transports passengers on a minibus. Zamir has married off his daughter and older son. Now he must take out a loan to repair the engine on his minibus. Roza is fifty-two years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. The younger son is seventeen years old. Roza does not work outside the home. At home, she raises cattle. Her children help Roza at home. Her elder son works as a carpenter. Her daughter is married and lives separately. Roza hopes to take out a loan to buy two head of small livestock to fatten. Sayragul is thirty-nine years old. She has five children. Her oldest son is sixteen, and her youngest daughter is only four. Sayragul keeps cows and sells the milk. She has applied for a loan to buy one more calf. Kyal is twenty-three years old. She is married. Her husband works as a security guard in Bishkek. Kyal has a small, two-year-old son. Daily, she sells ten liters of milk. Kyal has applied for the credit to buy a milk cow. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a few head of cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
El Sr. Arsenio M. tiene 38 años de edad, esta en pareja, tiene 2 hijos cursando la secundaria.
El Sr. M. se dedica a la construcción de obras hace 18 años, se inicio en esta actividad por herencia, ya que sus padres y hermanos se dedicaban a este oficio desde muy joven.
Actualmente cuenta con mas personal y necesita de mas herramientas de trabajo mayor cantidad de materiales ya en esta época los trabajos de construcción aumenta considerablemente. Por ese motivo solicitó el crédito con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arsenio M. is 38, has a life partner, and has two children in high school. Mr. M. has been doing construction work for 18 years. He started in this work as an inheritance. His parents and siblings worked in construction since they were very young. He currently has more personnel, and he needs more work tools and more materials. At this time construction work increases considerably. That is why he asked for the loan to be able to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material (bricks, cement) and work tools (buckets, trowels, ladders)

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana de 48 años es una mujer  muy querida y respetada en su barrio, vive sola en su propia casa y anhela tener una mejor calidad de vida.La actividad que realiza es la compra y venta de bicicletas; en su pequeña casa arregla las bicicletas viejas que compra y las deja como nuevas, las que luego lleva a vender a una de las ferias más importantes de su ciudad, en donde es muy solicitada, ya que los arreglos que realiza son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar bicicletas, ya que se entretiene  bastante, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es el tener que realizar todo a mano, lo cual hace que se demore mucho y que su trabajo sea muy agotador. Con el tiempo, desea hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su ingresos económicos y esta dispuesta a trabajar sin parar  para lograrlo.Es el sexto préstamo de Juliana con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre se lleva bien  con las demás socias.Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más repuestos de bicicletas, para así ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Juliana, 48, is a much love and respected woman in her neighborhood. She lives alone in her own house. She longs to have a better quality of life. She buys and sells bicycles. In her small house she fixes the old bicycles that she buys and leaves them like new. Then she sells them in the most important fairs in her city. She is very popular because the repairs she makes are very good. What she likes the most about her work is fixing the bicycles because it is so engaging. She has been doing this for 15 years. The most difficult part is having to do everything by hand. That takes so much time, and her work can be very grueling. In time she would like to expand her business and improve her income. She is prepared to work without stopping in order to do so. This is Juliana’s sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is very happy in her communal bank, and she gets along well with the other members. She will use the 600 PEN she is asking for to buy more replacement parts for bicycles in order to offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for her shop

loans.name: Bazarkul's Group

texts.ru:
Дуйшекеева Базаркул – лидер данной группы. Базаркул вместе с мужем вырастили четверых детей. Мужа уже нет в живых. Старшей дочери тридцать пять лет, сыну тридцать. Затем следуют две дочери, которым по двадцать девять и двадцать лет соответственно. Все дочери замужем. Сын работает и живёт с Базаркул. Люди, достигшие возраста Базаркул, уже сидят дома и воспитывают внуков. Базаркул уже выполнила свой родительский долг перед детьми и могла бы позволить себе заслуженный отпуск и покой. Однако Базаркул находит в себе силы заниматься любимым делом. Более того, она совсем недавно начала своё дело. Дело в том, что Базаркул ещё с молодости является талантливой мастерицей по изготовлению национальных изделий. Родственники порекомендовали Базаркул попробовать смастерить несколько изделий и сдать их в магазины по продаже таких изделий. И её изделия начали покупать. Базаркул получила возможность с пользой проводить свой досуг и при этом зарабатывать неплохие деньги. Чтобы начать это дело Базаркул потребовалось вложить четыре тысячи сомов ($90). Три года как она начала заниматься шитьём, и Базаркул смогла на заработанные деньги купить мебель для дома, и машину. Её ежемесячный доход достиг десяти тысяч сомов ($235). Базаркул с большим энтузиазмом занимается этим делом. В данное время она нуждается в средствах, чтобы вложить их в покупку необходимых материалов. Она надеется получить кредит и купить материалы и войлок. Базаркул мечтает открыть магазин у себя в селе, и продавать свои изделия. 

Партнёры Базаркул по группе:

Сагынбеку двадцать три года. Жена дома, не работает. Сагынбек работает продавцом потребительских товаров на местном рынке. Сагынбек зарабатывает около десяти с половиной тысяч сомов в месяц. Он нуждается в кредите, чтобы вложить деньги в товарооборот. 

Гулбайре сорок лет. Она разведена и сама воспитывает четырнадцатилетнего сына. Гулбайра держит корову, бычка и занимается их размножением. Она обратилась за этим кредитом, чтобы купить себе стиральную машину. 

Анаркуль сорок лет. Анаркуль – вдова и мать двоих детей. Она держит двух коров и двух бычков и зарабатывает себе на жизнь тем, что продаёт молоко. Её ежемесячный доход – три тысячи сомов в месяц. Анаркуль нужен кредит, чтобы купить телёнка.

Амангул сорок пять лет. Муж – строитель. Амангул находится дома и смотрит за скотиной и продаёт молоко. Амангул надеется получить кредит и купить баранов. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Bazarkul D. is the leader of this group. Bazarkul and her husband have raised four children. Her husband has passed on. The oldest daughter is thirty-five years old, the son is thirty. Then she has two daughters, twenty-nine and twenty. All of her daughters are married. Her son lives with Bazarkul and works. People who have reached Bazarkul's age keep house and bring up their grandchildren. Bazarkul has already fulfilled her parental duty to her children and could afford her deserved holiday and rest. However Bazarkul finds strength within herself to work at her favorite pastime. Moreover, she has recently gone into business. Bazarkul, since she was very young, has been a talented, skilled worker making traditional national goods. Relatives recommended that Bazarkul try making some handicrafts and offer them for sale in shops that specialize in that kind of merchandise. They have begun to buy her wares. Bazarkul has an opportunity to spend her leisure time earning quite good money. To begin Bazarkul's business, she needed four thousand som ($90). Three years after she began her sewing business Bazarkul earned enough money to buy a car and furniture for her house. Her monthly income has reached ten thousand som ($235). Bazarkul enthusiastically works at this. Currently, she requires funds to purchase necessary supplies. She hopes to obtain a loan to purchase fabric and felt. Bazarkul dreams of opening her own shop in the village to sell her goods. Bazarkul's partners are: Sagynbek is twenty-three years old. His wife keeps house and does not work. Sagynbek works selling consumer goods at the local market. Sagynbek earns about ten and a half thousand som a month. He would like a loan to increase inventory. Gulbaira is forty years old. She is divorced and raises her fourteen-year old son. Gulbaira has a cow and bull and works breeding them. She has applied for this loan in order to buy a washing machine. Anarkul is forty years old. Anarkul is a widow and mother of two children. She has two cows and two calves and earns enough selling milk to support herself. Her monthly income is three thousand som. Anarkul would like a loan to buy a calf. Amangul is forty-five years old. Her husband is a builder. Amangul stays home, looks after the cattle, and sells milk. Amangul hopes to take out a loan to buy rams. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and felt for making traditional goods.

loans.name: Mt. Elgon Group

texts.en:
Jambo (hello) from Tanzania! Meet Evelyn M., aged 23. Evelyn is not married.

Evelyn has had her own business since August of last year where she sells clothing, bags, shoes, and "vitenge" (bright patterned fabric that is worn by many Tanzanian women as wraps or taken to tailors to be made into two-piece dresses). Evelyn's shop is open every day from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. She makes a profit of about 250,000 Tanzanian shillings (approximately $190) a month.

This is Evelyn’s first loan from Tujijenge. She hopes to use it to increase the stock of her business. In the photo, Evelyn is sitting in the middle of the front row wearing a white shirt and is pictured with the other members of her loan group.

The members of this group are receiving this loan as a "motisha" loan, which is a new loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. The members of Mt. Elgon group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing, bags, and shoes

loans.name: Dar West Group

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Protas Y., 25 years old and married with two daughters aged four years and 8 months.

Protas sells charcoal in the Tabata Mtemba area of Dar es Salaam. He has been in the "mkaa" ("charcoal" in Kiswahili) business for three years. He sells charcoal every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. making a monthly profit of about 100,000 Tanzanian shillings (approximately 75 USD).

This will be Protas' second loan from Tujijenge. The first he used to buy household items like cupboards and a radio with a CD player. He hopes to use this loan to increase his stock of charcoal.

In the photo, Protas is first on the right wearing a light blue shirt and is shown with the other members of the Dar West loan group. Five of the group members also sell charcoal, while the others run various businesses that include a cafe, a butcher shop, a tailoring shop, a clothing stand, a poultry farm, and a french-fry stand.

The members of Dar West are thankful for your support!

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan de _C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “ están en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 21  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité de Mujeres Santa María posee un ahorro gs 2.030.000.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
 Cada una realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a la facilidad que posee cada integrante así Doña Gladys trabaja en su pequeño negocio que posee en su casa, el negocio es una despensa con todos los artículos de primera necesidad para la casa y es atendida por toda la familia. Así con el apoyo de su familia la señora Gladys trabaja día a día para mantener a su familia y agradece a la fundación por el crédito concedido

texts.en:
Delia A., from the San Juan neighborhood in Ciudad del Este, took the initiative to form this group. She brought together neighbors and friends to form the group in the tax-free zone. The name of the group is “Santa María,” it has 21 members, and is in its fourth loan cycle. This group is known in the neighborhood for the members’ unity and solidarity and sense of responsibility towards each other. The members are all endowed with an enterprising spirit, as is evidenced by their efforts to raise funds for the group. The Santa María Women's Group currently has 2,030,000 guaranis (PYG) in savings. The members can take out a loan of 300,000 to 1,000,000 guaranis to purchase merchandise that they will subsequently sell. Each member engages in different activities, according to her abilities. Thus, Doña Gladyz has a small store in her own house where she sells basic household goods. It is tended by the whole family. Gladyz works daily to maintain her family, thanks to their assistance. She is very grateful to the foundation for the loans received. 1 Rosalina R. Sells Beverages 2 Blanca López Sells Electronics 3 Jacinta Salguero Sells Clothing 4 Natividad Fernández Sells Clothing 5 Nelly Sánchez Sells Groceries 6 Marta P. Sells Underwear 7 María V. Sells Underwear 19 Gladys O. Groceries 20 Lucia A. Sells Beverages 21 Celia I. Sells Empanadas

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods: flour, sugar, meat, oil and others such as: clothing, shoes, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Leonor Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes L. de 38 años de edad, vive en un sector periurbano ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento y tiene como servicios básicos agua y luz, Lourdes es soltera con 3 hijos uno de 14 años, 11 años, 3 años todos estudiando en la Escuela Fiscal.

Lourdes empezó con unas pequeñas cosas en su bazar, después se puso a estudiar belleza en una academia para tener otro ingreso, ya hace 5 años tiene su gabinete de belleza y su bazar, sus hijos atienden el bazar mientras que ella esta en el gabinete, uno de sus mayores inconvenientes es la inseguridad de su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, peluches, tarjetas, para agrandar el negocio del bazar, en el futuro quiere incrementar su bazar poniendo mas vitrinas y que así sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 38 years old and lives in the Periurbano area, located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has a concrete home with basic services, such as water and electricity. Lourdes is single with three children ages, 14, 11, and 3. All are in school. Lourdes began selling small items in her sundry shop and later studied cosmetology at a beauty academy so that she could bring in additional income. She has had her beauty and sundry shops for five years. Her children work in the sundry shop, while she works in the beauty shop. One of her big challenges is the insecurity within the sector. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy clothing, stuffed animals, and cards to sell in her sundry shop. In the future she would like to add more display cases to her sundry shop so that it will be the best in the zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cards, notebooks, and sundries for resale

texts.es:
Genaro es de la Ciudad de Guayaybi  Calle Toro Piru Mborumbi, es propietario de un taller de moto y motosierra, anexo lavadero  y gomeria,que habilito en un espacio de su casa, actualmente cuenta con una clientela muy  bien formada. 
Solicita el prestamos aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año por la gran demanda tipica de estas fechas.
texts.en:
Genaro is from the city of Guayaybi, on Toro Piru Mborumbi street. He is the owner of a motorcycle and power saw shop with a car wash and tire shop attached. They are located in an area of his home. He has a good client base. He is requesting a loan to take advantage of the end of year holidays since typically there is a great demand at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
-Madame ThiaB. B. a exerce l’activité  de vente de poissons et thioubs pendant  15 ans. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a la caisse de Camberene depuis un an et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit antérieure. Son objectif en faisant  le choix de son activité  était de subvenir a certains de ses besoins sociaux car on ne peut pas entre dépendante  a cent pour cent. Elle sollicite un crédit d e 150 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat des marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Le  crédit  lui est d’une grande utilité car il me permet de s e réapprovisionner  régulièrement  étant  donne que s es clients achètent  ses marchandises a crédit.
Madame B. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms, ThiaB. B. has sold fish and hand-dyed cloth for 15 years. She has belonged to the U-IMCEC savings group at the Camabarene savings bank for a year, and has had one previous loan. She is in business to provide for her needs -- one cannot be totally dependent on others. She wants a loan of 150,000 francs to buy merchandise for sale. Credit is really useful for her, since it permits her to replenish her inventpry, given the fact her customers buy on credit. She has benefited from an agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (The Children and Family Development Program) of Seydina Issa Laye. The purpose of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and primarily to protect children from disadvantaged families. This agreement has provided their parents with loans on more flexible terms than are available from conventional sources. Since the agreement went into effect in December, 2008, 120 parents have had loans varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia de 56 años es una mujer muy responsable y alegre, vive sola en su casa propia  y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.En un pequeño cuarto Leticia a logrado adecuar  su taller de manualidades, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan, su trabajo es muy solicitado por sus clientes, ya que las manualidades que realiza son de muy buena calidad, actualmente se encuentra trabajando para una  empresas de taxis, a las cuales les realiza los adornos por sus aniversarios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar sus manualidades en la tranquilidad de su hogar, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los pequeños detalles en los acabados de los adornos. Con el tiempo, espera aperturar una amplia  tienda por el centro de la ciudad, ya que actualmente solo trabaja a pedido.Este es su  sexto préstamo con  MFP, y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más materiales, para elaborar nuevos adornos, para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old. She is a very responsible and happy person. She lives alone in her own house and what she wants most is to improver her quality of life. In a small room, Leticia has created her craft studio. Everyday, she starts work very early to fulfill requests. Her work is very sought after by her clients, since the crafts she makes are of very good quality. Currently, she is working for a taxi business, making decorations for their anniversary. What she likes most about her work is that she can create her crafts in the peace and quiet of her home. She has been doing this work for 20 years and she considers that the most difficult part is to make the small details in finishing touches. With time, she hopes to open a large store in the center of the city, since currently, she only works through requests. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is committed to make all the payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is well liked for the happiness she shows. With the 800 nuevos soles (PEN) requested, she will buy more materials in order to make new decorations, so that her business continues to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento  VENCEDORAS es un grupo antiguo se encuentra en su 8º ciclo son responsables en sus cuotas, La presidenta del grupo es la señora Nemecia, ella es lider por su responsabilidad y dinamismo, tiene su tienda D. barrio, es casada tiene 2 hijos su esposo venD. relojes, el credito le sirve para aumentar insumos en su tienda, Como tesorera esta la socia Monica, quien es la responsable del manejo D. efectivo, ella tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a la limpieza y tambien le ayuda a su esposo a lavar autos D. esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar, el credito le ayuda a mejorar en legocio D. lavadero, Como secretaria esta la socia Bacilia, quien tiene 3 hijos, es empleada publica y su esposo es conductor en una linea D. trufis, el credito lo usa para mantenimiento y repracion D. su D. su movilidad, todo el grupo esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
VENCEDORAS is a long-standing communal bank which is in its 8th cycle; they are responsible with their payments. The group leader is Nemecia; she is charaterized by her responsibility and dynamism. She has a neighborhood grocery store, is married, and has two children. Her husband sells watches. The funding will help her increase stock. Monica is treasurer. She handles the cash. She has 5 children and is a cleaning lady. She also helps her husband to wash cars. This way, they share in taking care of household expenses. The funding will be used to improve her washing business. Bacilia is secretary. She has 3 children and is a public employee. Her husband is a trufi (minibus) driver. The funding will be used for service and repair of the vehicle. The entire group is grateful to the institution for he support provided. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario  R. tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos mayores.
El Sr. R. posee  una casilla de ventas de bebidas y minutas en su casa propia hace aproximadamente 1 año. Anteriormente era empleado de una quinta, luego se inicio con la microempresa con la compra de la casilla y así trabajar desde su hogar.
Actualmente cuenta con una clientela muy importante y desea mantenerla y proveer de mercaderías de buena calidad y variedad, sobre todo para satisfacer a sus clientes ya en esta época aumenta el consumo de las bebidas solicita el crédito para la compra de en general.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario R. is 58 years old and married, with 3 grown children. For about a year, Mr. R. has owned and run a stand in his home where he sells beverages and small, quick servings of food, including sandwiches. Previously he was employed in a farm. Later, he started his own small business with the purchase of the stand, so as to be able to work right from his home. He now has an impressive clientele. He wants to maintain that clientele and provide a wide variety of high quality products. Most of all, he wants to satisfy his clients, since this is the season when consumption of beverages increases. He is requesting this loan in order to make general purchases for his beverage stand.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages (cider, beer, soft drinks)

texts.es:
El grupo Pastorela está integrado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es Milagros L. quien  inicio hace veinte años vendiendo frutas y verduras en la carretera de Tipitapa, municipio de Managua. Actualmente ella por medio de los préstamos ha invertido en otros rubros ofertando carne y hueso.

Rosa Elena Jiménez tiene una pequeña pulpería bien surtida la cual atiende todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Además de ello los fines de semana destaza cerdo y hace sopa de mondongo.

Mientra su compañera Luisa Ernestina Uriba tiene una modesta venta en la cual oferta granos básicos, dulces y pan; María Azucena M. tiene una cominería desde hace tres años  y Eufemia J. T. hace diez años comenzó vendiendo comida a hora tiene su propio comedor.

Ellas esperan que este nuevo años sus negocios sigan progresando y tener salud que es lo principal.
texts.en:
The Pastorela group is made up of 5 hardworking and entrepreneurial women. One of those women is Milagros L., who started selling fruit and vegetables on the Tipitapa highway in Managua twenty years ago. Through the loans she has received, she has invested in other product lines, and now offers meat and bones for cooking, as well. Rosa Elena Jiménez has a small, well stocked convenience store. She tends to the store every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Additionally, on weekends she butchers pork and prepares sopa de mondongo, a traditional soup made of pork tripe. Their colleague in the Pastorela group, Luisa Ernestina Uriba, has a small stand where she offers basic grains, sweets and bread; María Azucena M. has owned a small eatery for three years and for ten years Eufemia J. T. has been selling prepared food in her own small restaurant. They hope that their businesses will continue their good progress during this new year, and that all of the group's members will remain healthy, which they consider the most important matter.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace año y medio se dedica a la reparación de motos y mototaxis en un taller que tiene instalado en la parte exterior de su vivienda, José nos comenta que siempre tuvo inquietud de conocer más de esta actividad y que aprendió observando a unos amigos que se desempeñan como mecánicos. Anteriormente se ganaba la vida como trabajador eventual, lo que le brindaba ingresos poco estables, por lo que actualmente da todo sí para sacar adelante su negocio.

La demanda por sus servicios ha ido creciendo, ya que las motos y mototaxis son muy abundantes por la zona. José se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de repuestos con los cuales ampliar su stock, ya que tiene que viajar continuamente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlos y ello supone un costo excesivo.

José es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia, las ganancias que percibe de su negocio las utiliza para otorgarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Sus aspiraciones son seguir creciendo como emperesartio y hacerse más conocido en la zona.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the Olmos district, about an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For a year and half José has been earning his living by repairing motorcycles and motorcycle taxis in a mechanic's shop he installed in the outside portion of his home. He comments that he had always wanted to know more about motorcycle repair and that he learned the business by watching friends who worked as mechanics. Previously, he earned his living as a temporary worker, which did not provide a stable income. As a result of that experience he is motivated to put everything he has into the growth of his business. Demand for his services continues to grow, since motorcycles and motorcycle taxis are plentiful in the area where José lives. He finds himself requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the first time: a loan of 500 nuevos soles (the currency of Peru) for the purchase of spare parts with which he will expand his inventory. He has to travel almost continually to the city of Chiclayo to purchase these parts in small quantities now, at considerable expense. José is a very responsible person and is very devoted to his family. He uses his earnings from the business to provide his parents with better quality of life. He aspires to continue growing as a businessman and to make himself better known in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts for motorcycle repairs.

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Diène est une nouvelle adhérant e  de la caisse de Camberene. Elle habite dans la même localité .Elle est parente bénéficiaire qui n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt dans l’institution. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est très expérimentée dans le commerce et s’adonne à la vente de draps et de pots de fleur depuis plus de 10 ans. C’est une femme d’une cinquantaine d’années mais tres dynamique. Elle se procure ses marchandises a Dakar et les vend a Saint Louis. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs L’objet de ce prêt est de renforcer son stock de marchandises.
 Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Diène is a new member of the savings bank in Cambarene, where she lives. She has not had any previous loans. She is married with five children. She is an experienced businesswoman who has sold cloth and flowerpots for more than ten years. She is in her fifties but very energetic. She buys her goods in Dakar and sells them in St Louis. She is asking for a loan of 150,000 francs to build up her inventory. Ms Diène has benefited from an agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (The Children and Family Development Program) of Seydina Issa Laye. The purpose of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and primarily to protect children from disadvantaged families. This agreement has provided their parents with loans on more flexible terms than are available from conventional sources. Since the agreement went into effect in December, 2008, 120 parents have had loans varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca P. L.  en 1979 empezó a vender comida de manera independiente ya que desde muy niña aprendió este oficio con su madre quien tenia una cominería la cual le heredo. Actualmente esta señora de 51 años desea hacer reformas al negocio para poder brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
In 1979, Juana Francisca P. L. began to sell prepared food on her own, since from the time she was small girl she had learned this business from her mother, who owned the small eatery Juana later inherited. Currently this 51 year old businesswoman wishes to make improvements to the eatery in order to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat and vegetables.

texts.es: María de 45 años es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, vive en su casa propia  junto a su esposo Raúl de 47 años , y su querida hija Natalia de 12 años, lo que más desea es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.En el mercado mas importante de su ciudad, María tiene su puesto de productos andinos, durante  todas  la mañana vende  papa, quinua, oca, entre otros productos naturales, a sus asiduos  clientes  quienes prefieren comprarle a ella porque es una vendedora muy alegre y conversadora, además que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar son sus vecinas de venta; lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que lidiar con la tierra de la papa, ya que siempre termina muy sucia y eso le disgusta. En el futuro  desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos andinos,  y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión.Es el quinto préstamo de Maria con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos andinos para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
María, who is 45 years old, is a very sincere and honest woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Raúl, 47 years old, and her beloved daughter Natalia, who is now 12 years old. What Maria most desires is to give her family better quality of life. María has a stand in the most important market of her city, from which she sells products from the Andes. Seven mornings a week she sells potatoes, quinoa, goose and other natural products to her devoted clients. Her clients prefer to buy from her because she is a very happy and talkative merchant, and even more, because she sells very high quality products. What María likes best about her work is talking with her ¨neighbors,¨ the women who run the stands alongside her own. She has been earning her living through this work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of the work having to deal with dirt that covers the potatoes when they arrive to her stand, since she always winds up very dirty, and that disgusts her. In the future she wants to have a store where she will sell her Andean products; this will improve her quality of life and provide her daughter with the opportunity to study a profession. This is Maria's fifth loan with MFP, the local organization she is working with. She is committed to making all of her payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for her Community Bank, where she is loved by the her fellow members. With the 1000 soles (the currency of Peru) she has requested, Maria will buy more Andean products in order to expand her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona M. tiene 38 años de edad, esta en pareja, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.
La Sra. Ramona posee una despensa hace mas de 9 años de antigüedad en su domicilio, se inicio comprando a créditos las mercaderías y luego con la ayuda de su cónyuge juntaron unos ahorros para su capital propio. 
La despensa es atendida por toda la familia y la clientela la forman todos los vecinos del barrio el cual es un numero importante. Ramona comenta que mediante este negocio nunca pasamos necesidades y que su deseo era ampliar y mantenerla y por ello solicita el  crédito,  para la compra de mercaderías tales como: azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona M. is 38 years old. She has a partner and 2 school-aged children. Mrs. Ramona has had a grocery store for more than 9 years in her home. She started buying the merchandise on credit. Later, with the help of her partner, they put together some savings for her own capital. The store is attended to by the whole family and the customers are all neighbors from the neighborhood which is an important number. Ramona commented that with this business, we never suffer hardships and her wish was to expand and maintain the business. For this reason, she is requesting the loan, for the purchase of merchandise like: sugar, yerba (mate), drinks in general, baked goods and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of merchandise like: sugar, yerba (mate), drinks in general, baked goods and other things

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento VALLE HERMOSO es un grupo antiguo se encuentra en su 9º ciclo,  son responsables y solidarios entre sus integrantes, como presidenta esta la señora Carmen, ella es lider D. su grupo por ser una persona dinamica y responsable, se dedica al auto tranporte, tiene 2 hijos dependientes, y su esposo trabaja en Fanexa y ambos comparten los gastos del hogar. 

Como tesorea esta La Sra.Claudia, quien es soltera no tiene hijos es muy responsable con el manejo D. efectivo y trabaja como chofer en una linea D. transportes, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.

como secretaria del grupo esta la señora Jhaneth, quien tiene 3 hijos, ella venD. ropa americana y su esposo trabaja en una linea D. transporte. El grupo valle Hermoso esta agradecio con la institucion por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: The VALLE HERMOSO communal bank is a long-standing group currently in its 9th cycle; the members are responsible and unified. Carmen is group president. She is the group leader thanks to her dynamism and responsibility. She is in public transportation, has two dependent children. Her husband works for Fanexa (National Explosives Factory). Together, they contribute to taking care of family expenses. Claudia is the group's treasurer. She is single and has no children. She is very responsible managing the group's cash and she works as a driver for a public transportation company. She will use the funds for vehicle maintenance. Jhaneth is the secretary. She has 3 children and sells second-hand American clothing. Her husband works for a transportation company. The Valle Hermoso group is grateful to the institution for the support provided. [[[Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Carlos T., vive en una zona periurbana su casa es de caña no cuenta con ningún servicio básico su vivienda esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa es ama de casa, con ella tiene 3 hijos uno de 9 años, 15 años, 16 años todos estudian en una Escuela Fiscal, el mayor de sus hijos esta aprendiendo a coser en sus ratos libres ayudando en el negocio.

Carlos comenzó hace 20 años atrás trabajando en una empresa donde aprendió el oficio de la costura de maletas, esto le ayudo para que ya hace 2 años atrás se independizara y pusiera su propio negocio de confección, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta la hora que termine todas las prendas que le piden, Carlos confecciona mochilas, bolsas, maletas, una de sus mayores complicaciones es que su casa es pequeña y de caña y tiene miedo que los ladrones de su sector le roben la maquina de coser.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, cierres, lonas para incrementar su negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar otra maquina para su esposa e hijos y así se haga un negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Carlos T. lives in the Paraíso de Guayaquil suburban zone. His house is made of cane and has no basic services. His wife is a homemaker and together they have three children, aged 9, 15, and 16. All study at a public school. The oldest son is learning to sew in his spare time, helping with the business.

Carlos began 20 years ago working in a business where he learned the trade of making suitcases. This helped him to become independent and start his own business two years ago. He works from early morning until he finishes all his orders. He makes backpacks, purses, and suitcases. One of his greatest problems is that the house is small and made of cane and he fears that thieves will steal his sewing machine.

With this loan, Carlos will buy cloth, fasteners, and canvas to enlarge his business. In the future, he would like to buy another sewing machine for his wife and children, and make it a real family business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El  Sr. Jose Dejesus S.  es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Centro, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Gladys Graciela Armoa de S. con 36 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 4 hijos todos en  edad escolar.
Posee una Clínica Dental en el centro de la ciudad, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales El  señor es muy trabajador y muy conocido en esta zona. 
Actualmente  está  construyendo  un salón de material en su propia casa para  mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Dejesus S. is from the city of San Estanislao of the Central Neighborhood. He is 48 years old and married to Mrs. Glays Graciela Armoa de S. who is 36 years old. They have four children who are all in school. He has a Dental Clinic downtown with an established clientele, good income, and good commercial and personal references. He is very hardworking and very well-known in this area. He is currently building a storage room in his own house to improve his care for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar S. est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’IMCEC a Camberene depuis Aout 2007.Il est âgé de 28 ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt dans l’institution .Monsieur S. est employé  dans la garderie du programme de développement  de l’enfance et de la famille (pdef) Seydina Issa Laye de Camberene.  Il est marie et père de deux enfants.Son salaire est insuffisant pour lui permettre de supporter ses charges familiales.C'est la raison pour laquelle il s'adonne a une activité secondaire qui est la vente de parfums.Par conséquent il emprunte 150 000 frs qui seront destines a l'achat de ce produit. 
 Ce prêt  l’aidera à diversifier la variété de parfums à proposer  à la clientèle et  a se constituer un stock assez signifiant. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’assurer la dépense quotidienne pour tout le mois et aussi de soutenir certains de ses proches parents en difficulté. 

Monsieur S. est un bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parent de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008 jusqu'en juin 2009, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui ont varie entre entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar S. has been a member of UIMCEC's credit union in Camberene since August 2007. He is 28 years old and has already had a loan from the institution. Mr. S. is employed at the childcare center of the Seydina Issa Laye Program for Child and Family Development (PDEF) in Cambrene. He is married and the father of two children, which is why he is involved in a secondary business selling perfumes. He is therefore borrowing 150,000 franks [about 350 USD] in order to purchase perfumes. This loan will help him diversify his selection of products and build up his merchandise stock. An increase in his revenue will allow him to ensure that his basic monthly expenses are covered and also to help some of his close family members who have financial difficulties. Mr. S. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Seydina Issa Laye Program for Child and Family Development. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect the children of impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can obtain loans at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela Nuñez es dueña de un comedor en la zona del mercado municipal de Limpio, la misma es oriunda de Villa Francia se estableció en la ciudad a finales de los 70 siendo una de las fundadoras de lo que es actualmente el mercado.
      
      En sus principios nos cuenta Ña Estela su comedor estaba a la entrada del mercado y su cocina tenia la dimensión de una chapa eternit. Hoy pasado casi treinta años ella se siente orgullosa de su trabajo y actualmente se encuentra ocupando dos salones comerciales en el local municipal, cuenta con casa propia fruto del ingreso generado en su negocio.

       Solicito nuestra asistencia para compra de Sidras y otras bebidas muy solicitadas en estas fechas festivas recientemente adquirió un Biccicooler nuevo y desea optimizar su uso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela Nuñez is the owner of a restaurant in the central business district of Limpio. It was originally in Villa Francia where it was established in the city at the end of the 1970’s. She is one of the founders who is still in the business. Miss Estela tells us that in the beginning her restaurant was at the entrance of the market and her cooking had the scale of an “eternal plate.” Today almost thirty years have passed and she is proud of her work. She is currently occupying two commercial rooms in the local district and she has her own house as a result of the income generated in her business. She is asking for our assistance to buy ciders and other drinks highly demanded during the holidays. She recently acquired a new Biccicooler and she wants to optimize its use.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks such as cider and wine

texts.es: Victoria de 54 años es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.Todos los días desde muy temprano Victoria apertura  su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los convence de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida, ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos que le hacen falta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes; lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Para el futuro, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio , para poder vender más productos.Este es el sexto préstamo de Victoria con  MFP, esta dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días, para lograr  pagar su crédito por completo y  en su banco comunal es muy responsable además siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre las integrantes.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de  productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Victoria, 54 years of age, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in the house of a family member and the thing she desires most is to get ahead in life.

Every day at a very early hour, Victoria opens her grocery store to serve her neighbors. She is an accomplished sales person; she knows how to treat her customers and always convinces them to buy something extra. Her shop is well-stocked as she always is careful to buy the products that are missing. The thing she likes most about her business is chatting with her customers.

Victoria has had this business for five years. The thing she finds most difficult is having to stay in the store all day and not be able to go out on the street. In the future, she would like to enlarge her store to be able to sell more products.

This is Victoria’s sixth loan with MFP. She is inclined to save every day so that she can pay off her loan. In her communal bank, she is very responsible and complies with the agreements made with her associates. With this loan of 1500 PEN, she will buy a large quantity of products to better supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión 15 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano R.Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
1.Las integrantes constituyen un grupo muy solidario y organizado,demuestran compañerismo y están formando una muy linda amistad con el Comité. 
2.Ademas las integrantes del Comité tienen interés en continuar mucho mas allá del año 2009.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
1
Ignasia S. 
Despensa
2
Paola C.
Ventas de Comidas

Ventas de Ropas

texts.en:
The Committee “Mujeres Unidas” was formed with the union of 15 neighbors in the city of Mariano R.Alonso. All of the members of the committee work in independent activities, like sales. 1. The members form a very supportive and organized group; they show companionship and they are forming a very nice friendship with the Committee. 2. In addition, the members of the Committee are interested in continuing past 2009. All of the members of the Committee are mothers who dedicate themselves to different activities with the aim of strengthening family finances. 1 Ignasia S. grocery store owner 2 Paola C. food sales 3 Raquel Corvalán Clothing sales 4 Blanca R. cosmetic sales 5 Graciela G. drink sales 6 Sandra S. grocery store owner 7Juana D. domestic worker (cleaner) 8 Cristina A. Fruit, Vegetables, natural herbal remedies sales 9 Juana G. nurse 10 Buenaventura G. International cook 11 Teresa M. fruit sales 12 Maria A. ice cream sales 13 Gabriela O. kiosk 14 Narcisa C. dress maker 15 Eustaquia C. dress maker

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the grocery store( rice, noodles, candy, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc) the purchase of clothing, the purchase of fabric for making clothes, the purchase of drinks, the purchase of ingredients to prepare food, the purchase of ice cream, the purchase of notions, the purchase of fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Hector Anibal

texts.es:
Héctor E. de 56 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana con dos servicios básicos agua y luz sin alcantarillado, su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, trabaja en el terminal de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda en su negocio, Héctor tiene tres hijos uno de 20 años otro de 18 años ellos están en la Universidad y uno de 8 años que estudia en una escuela particular. 

Héctor comenzó su negocio con la motivación de tener mas ingresos para su familia, el antes de irse a trabajar al terminal en la mañana deja comprado las cosas para la tienda en la que su esposa se encarga de la tienda ella trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 23h00, una de las mayores complicaciones que tiene es la competencia en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una vitrina, arroz, aceites, colas para incrementar su negocio, en el futuro quiere arreglar su casa para hacer un departamento para alquilarlo y tener otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor E. is 56 years old, and lives in the Periurbana zone with just two basic services, water and light, and no sewerage. His house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He works in the Guayaquil bus terminal and his wife helps out in the business. Héctor has 3 children, 2 of whom (one 20 the other 18 years of age) are in the University, while one is 8 years old and in a special primary school.

Héctor began his business motivated to have more income for his family. Before going to work in the terminal each morning, he buys things for the store which his wife is in charge of. She works from 8:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night. One of the greatest complications they have is competition in the sector.

With this loan, he wishes to buy show cases, rice, cooking oil, and colas, to increase his business. In the future, he wants to expand his house to add an apartment to rent out, providing another income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SHOW CASES, AND, ALSO, RICE, OIL, AND COLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Dionisia tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada hace varios años, su cónyuge es constructor de obras, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Dionisia es propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace 27 años, realiza el servicio tercerizado para otro taller en donde ella cobra por los servicios prestados por cada prenda, tiene 4 máquinas y da fuentes de trabajo a sus vecinas.
Se inició como ayudante de costura y luego fue comprando sus máquinas propias y así fue montando su propio taller.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de otra máquina tipo overlock de 5 hilos.
texts.en:
Miss Dionisia is 54 years old and has been married for several years. Her husband works in private construction and they have 4 children who are all grown up and independent. Miss Dionisia has been the owner of a sewing shop for 27 years. Her services are outsourced for another shop where she charges for the services requested for each garmet. She has four machines and gives work opportunities to her neighbors. She started as a sewing assistant and later bought her own machines and from there she began setting up her own shop. She is asking for a loan to buy another machine – a 5-thread overlock.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a 5-thread overlock sewing machine

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana, vive en casa propia, ella al igual de muchas clientes debe de levantarse temprano para llegar a las seis de la mañana al mercado ya que vive en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad de El Alto. es una de las pocas clientes que quedaron de las que se tenian en el Mercado Yungas durante todo el tiempo que ha trabajado con la agenia ha reflejado ser una persona dedicada y responsable no solo con su trabajo sino tambien con su familia, el empeño que le pone a su actividad se refleja en el crecimiento del mismo. La Sra. Liliana invertira el dinero del credito en la refaccion del puesto como ser el pintado de mesas y bancas y el cambio de tazas y jarros que se usan diariamente en el puesto.
texts.en:
Liliana lives in her own house. Like many other Emprender clients, she has to get up early to arrive at the market at 6AM, as she lives in a far neighborhood of El Alto. She is one of the Emprender’s few remaining long-term clients from the Yungas Market.

In all the time she has worked with the agency, she has proved herself to be dedicated and responsible, not only with her work, but also with her family. The determination that she puts into her work is reflected in the growth of her business.

Liliana will use this loan money to refurbish her food stall, including painting the tables and benches, and replacing the cups and jars that are used every day.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 36 años es una madre de familia muy amorosa y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos; Yulisa de 17, Ana de 4 y Gabriel de 2 años, a quienes desea ofrecer estudios de calidad.El puesto de Julia esta ubicado en un mercado importante de la ciudad donde vive, la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad, ya que trae las prendas desde la ciudad de Lima, y también desde Bolivia, su puesto es muy concurrido por las personas que visitan el mercado , ya que los precios que ofrece también son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la ropa que trae, ya que los fardos son muy pesados y la cansan mucho, además que las distancias son largas. Para el futuro, espera poner una amplia tienda de ropa, donde pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Es el tercer  préstamo de Julia con  MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuosa con las demás socias.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará ropas de dormir con motivos  navideños, para aprovechar la demanda que habrá en esta fiestas, y así calcula podrá obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia, 36 years old, is a very caring and responsible mother. She lives in her own home with her 3 children: Yulisa, 17, Ana, 4, and Gabriel, 2 years old. She wants to offer each of her children a quality education. Her sales stand is located in an important market in the city where she lives. She sells clothing of very high quality; she brings her products to her city from the city of Lima and also from Bolivia. Her stand is highly frequented by the people who shop in the market, since she offers very good prices. What Julia likes best about her work is talking with the women who run the neighboring stands in the market; their conversations make her long work days more pleasant. She has been doing this work for 21 years. She considers transporting her products to the market the most difficult part of the work ,since the bundles are very heavy, the distances are often long, and the work tires her. In the future she hopes to open a clothing store where she would offer her clients better service. This is Julia's third loan with MFP, the local organization working with her. She looks forward to repaying the loan on time so as not to cause problems for her Community Bank, since she is very respectful of her fellow members. With the 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) she is requesting, Julia will buy pajamas with a Christmas theme, in order to take advantage of the demand the holidays will bring and by doing so, achieve good earnings during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her clothing stand

texts.es:
Grupo Yolanda está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes desean que el próximo año sus negocios prosperen y tener salud para seguir trabajando. Juliana L. es la coordinadora del grupo y según ella los préstamos le han ayudado mucho para surtir los pedidos de cosméticos que tenia. 

Esta señora de 32 años que distribuye productos de las marcar Avon, Zermat y Aravela el próximo año desea con sus ganancias si Dios se permite mejorar su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.

Rosa Lisbett B. M. empezó haciendo manicure, pedicura, peinados y masajes a domicilio además  ofertaba ropa y zapatos. Hace tres meses ella inauguró su propio salón de belleza y al lado puso su tienda de ropa y zapatos.
