Yamileth del Socorro L. E. de 37 años fabrica bolsos de macramé, un arte que consiste en tejidos de nudos a mano ya sea de mecate, manila, hilos y plástico.
texts.en:
The Grupo Yolanda is comprised of three working women who hope that in the coming year their businesses will prosper and that they will be healthy enough to continue working. Juliana L. is the group's coordinator, and she says that the loans have been a great help in filling the orders for cosmetics that she has. This 32-year-old woman sells Avon, Zermat, and Aravela products. She hopes that next year, God willing, she will be able to renovate her home, which is in bad shape at the moment. Rosa Lisbett B. M. has begun doing in-home manicures, pedicures, hairstyles, and massages. She also sells clothing and shoes. Three years ago, she opened her own beauty salon with a clothing and shoe store next door. Yamileth del Socorro L. E., 37 years old, makes macrame bags, an art that consists of hand-tying knots out of either rope, hemp fiber, wire, or plastic.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny de 28 años es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 4 hijos Carol de 12, Yenifer de 8, Jefer de 4 y Yoselin de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. De esta manera se dedica con cariño y dedicación a la crianza de ganado vacuno, en donde empieza su día a partir de las 5 de la mañana sacando a pastear sus reses por los campos, para así mantenerlos bien alimentados y vigorosos, ya que ello depende para su comercialización.  Es así que Marleny llevó a sus reses a la feria dominical de su ciudad, logrando venderlos rápidamente y a un buen precio. Para Marleny lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es caminar por lo extensos campos, lugar que diariamente pastea a su ganado, por lo que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad, siendo lo más dificultoso, llevar sus reses a la feria para venderlos. Con el tiempo espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y promete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, siendo Marleny una persona muy responsable y ordenada, no desea perjudicar a nadie de sus compañeras con quienes forman su grupo comunal. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más forraje para sus animales y asegurar así su buena crianza.
texts.en:
Marleny, age 28, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her 4 children: Carol, 12, Yenifer, 8, Jefer, 4, and Yoselin, 3. They are the motivation behind all of her efforts. With this in mind, she raises cattle with care and dedication. Her day begins at 5 in the morning when she takes her cows out to pasture in the fields in order to keep them well-fed and strong, which is what her business depends on. Marleny takes her cattle to her city's Sunday market, where she is able to sell them quickly and at a good price. What Marleny likes the best about her job is walking among the vast fields, where she takes her cows to graze daily. She has been doing this work for 5 years. The most difficult part is getting the cows to the market to sell. She hopes that in time she will be able to increase the number of cows she has and thereby increase her income. This is her second loan through MFP, and she pledges to make her repayments on time. As Marleny is a very responsible and orderly person, she does not want anyone who is a part of her community bank to be penalized. With the 1,200 nuevos soles she is requesting, she plans to buy more fodder for her animals to ensure their good upbringing.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fodder for her cattle

texts.es: Don Roger es cliente en segunda secuencia el es esposo de un cliente antigua. La actividad que don Roger desempeña es la de consultor, en este momento el esta elaborando un ante proyecto en favor de personas con discapacidad la cual durar desde julio de este año hasta fines de marzo del 2010.  El señor vive en casa en anticretio juntamente a su esposa doña Maria del Carmen. LA SRA. se dedica a la venta de joyas a credito cuyo mercado son oficinas del centro de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a ellos viven sus dos hijos, uno de ellos se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y el otro en edad escolar.  El cliente destinara el credito en un viaje que debe realizar al interior del pais vinculado con su actividad y en algunos tramites que tuviera que requerir.
texts.en:
Roger is a second sequence client; he is the husband of a long-standing member. Roger is a consultant and he's currently developing a draft for a project for persons with disabilities that will run from July of this year until the end of March, 2010. He lives in a house under the anticretico modality (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) with his wife, Maria del Carmen. His wife sells jewelry on credit. Her customers are office workers in La Paz. Their two children live with them, one of them is a university student and the other is in elementary school. Roger will use the funds to pay for a work-related trip that he must make to the interior of the country as well as for various bureaurcratic isues that might arise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Vicente Rodolfo

texts.es:
Vicente Vélez de 40 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene dos servicios básicos como agua y luz sin alcantarillado, su esposa le ayuda en el negocio con ella tiene 5 hijos uno de 15 años, 13 años, 11 años, 9 años, 6 años todos estudiantes de una escuela fiscal. 

Vicente comenzó hace 12 años atrás con el negocio de la tienda para que su esposa y el trabajen juntos, ahora Vicente hace las compras y su esposa atiende la tienda desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h30 de lunes a domingos, venden arroz, pollo, verde, aceites etc. Una de las complicaciones son los ladrones en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar aceites, azúcar, atún, pollos para poder agrandar mas el negocio, en el futuro quiere arreglar su casa para que cada  uno de sus hijos tenga su propia habitación.
texts.en:
Vicente Vélez, age 40, lives in a suburban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. His cement house has the two basic utilities– light and water– but no sewage system. His wife helps him with his business, and together they have 5 children, ages 15, 13, 11, 9, and 6, who are all students at a public school. Vicente opened his store 12 years ago so that he and his wife could work together. Now, Vicente does the shopping, and his wife works in the store from 6:00 a.m. until 9:30 p.m. Monday through Sunday. They sell rice, chicken, fresh vegetables, oils etc. One setback are the thieves in their area. With this loan, Vicente wants to buy oil, sugar, tuna, and chicken in order to expand their business. In the future, he wants to remodel his house so that one of children can have their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, and tuna

texts.es: La profesora Raquel trabaja en la Universidad Nacional de Nicaragua (UNAN) desde hace 11 años, tiene 2 hijos, Raisa de 20 y el varon de 23 años, ambos trabajan y estudian la universidad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en la Policica Nacional y asume los gastos del hogar; esta solicitando su 6to credito para seguir mejorando su casa, y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con KIVA, pues el credito anterior fue financiado por este fondo con el cual logro ponerle la ceramica a su casa y ahora desea pintarla para que se mire mas bonita. La profesora Raquel manifiesta que se siente muy agradecida con AFODENIC ya que gracias a los creditos que le ha concedido ha logrado acondicionar su casa poco a poco, el mayor sueño de Raquel es lograr tener todas las condiciones en su casa ara que su familia disfrute de un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Professor Raquel has worked in the National University of Nicaragua (UNAN) for 11 years. She has two children, Raisa, 20 and the son, 23. They both work and attend university. She counts on the support of her husband who works for the National Police and takes on the household expenses. She is requesting her sixth loan to continue improving her house and she hopes to continue to benefit from KIVA. The last loan was financed by this fund to lay tile in the house and now she wants to paint it so that it looks prettier. Professor Raquel expresses that she feels very thankful for AFODENIC. Thanks to the loans, she has been awarded, she has been able to renovate her house little by little. Raquel’s big dream is to be able to have all the comforts in her home, so that her family can enjoy it in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Nubia Carina es soltera, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su mamá, 2 hermanos y 2 sobrinitos, trabaja como maestra de computacion en el Centro Cultural Juigalpan desde hace 5 años, ademas se dedica a vender ropa usada con el apoyo de su hermana, pues a pesar de no ser casada ni tener hijos, es muy trabajadora y le brinda su apoyo a su mamá y a su hermana que es madre soltera de 2 niños (el varon de 2 añitos y la niña de 7 años con problemas de aprendisaje),  y con este negocio obtienen ingresos adicionales que le permiten el sustento de su familia. Esta solicitando su 2do credito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada comprando  paca de ropa juvenil, de varon y ropa de cama. El mayor sueño de Nubia es estudiar una especialidad para compartir sus conocimientos con otras personas, seguir apoyando a su mamá y hermana y ademas poder tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Nubia Carina is single and lives with her family, composed of her mother, her 2 brother and her 2 young nephews. She has worked as a computer science teacher in the Juigalpan Cultural Center fo 5 years. Additionally, she and her sister sell used clothing. Despite being single without children of her own, she is very hardworking and supports her mother and her sister, who is the single mother of 2 children: a 2 year boy and a 7 year old girl with learning disabilities. Through the business they earn the additional income that allows them to sustain the family. Nubia is requesting her second loan. She will invest the loan in her used clothing business, by buying children's clothing, men's clothing and bed linens. Nubia's dream is to study a specialty in her field, so she can share her knowledge with others, continue supporting her mother and sister, and one day have her own family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: Juana María L. C. de 37 años en 1994 decidió  tener un negocio que le permitiera apoyar a sus hijas y estar con ellas es así que decide poner una pulpería. L. a segura que este negocio no es pesado ya que son muy organizadas y se distribuyen el trabajo entre ella y sus tres hijas las cuales estudian una esta es secundaria y las otras dos en la universidad.
texts.en:
In 1994, Juana María L. C., 37 years old, decided to start a business that would let her support her daughters while still taking care of them, so she opened a small grocery store. Ms. L. says that the business is not too demanding, since they are very organized and distribute the work evenly between herself and her three daughters, one of whom is in high school and the other two in college.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple grains, meat, and other products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: La profesora Fatima trabaja para el MINED en la Escuela Enrique Tierno Galvan desde hace 25 años como maestra de primaria, profesa la religion Evangelica desde hacer vaR. años, vive junto a su familia compuesta por 2 hijos,  Hector Francisco de 19 años en la universidad estudiando su 3er año de Ingenieria  Agroindustrial, y Maria Gabriela que ya es casada y tiene 2 niñas de 10 y 5 años, las cuales son muy apegadas a su abuelita Fatima. La profesora esta solicitando su 6to Credito para la construccion de un cuarto anexo en su casa para sus nietecitas, pues actualmente solo cuenta con 2 cuartos , y desea que sus 2 nietecitas tengan un lugarcito para ellas donde tener privacidad.  El mayor sueño de Fatima es lograr brindar a su familia las condiciones necesarias y que su familia tenga salud.
texts.en:
Fatima is a primary school teacher who has worked for the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education at Enrique Tierno Galvan school for 25 years. She has been an evangelical Christian for several years and lives with her family. She has two children, Hector Francisco, 19 years old and in his third year of college studying agricultural engineering, and Maria Gabriela, who is married and has two daughters, ages 5 and 10, who are very tight with their grandmother.

Fatima is requesting her sixth loan to build an additional room in her home, since the house currently has only two bedrooms and she would like her granddaughters to have their own space where they can have some some privacy.

Fatima's greatest dream is for her family to be healthy and have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Venta de medias, comida, detergente, leche, libros y atención de llanteria, son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Cruz del Sur que se reunen en el Centro Focal Santiago II, es el caso de Paulina H. de 26 años tiene su llantería hace 8 años y necesita el préstamo para comprar diferentes herramientas de trabajo que le permitan brindar una atención óptima en su taller. Otro ejemplo es Maribel A. que a sus 18 años emprendió el negocio de venta de libros en difernetes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. 
Todas estan motivadas a mejorar sus negocios con esta oportunidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Selling socks, detergent, milk, books, and a tire service are the diverse businesses the members of the “Cruz del Sur” group have. The group meets in the Centro Focal Santiago II. One member, Paulina H., is 26 years old and has her tire service business for 8 years. She needs a loan to buy different work tools that enable her business to provide excellent customer service in her shop. Another group member is Maribel A., who at 18 years old began a business selling books in different markets in El Alto city. All the members are motivated to improve their businesses with the opportunity the loan provides.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Don Vidal vive en la Comarca La mascota junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Angelica y su hijo Vidal de 12 años el que va a 1er año de secundaria, trabaja como albañil en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 7 años, esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera ser beneficiado con con el fondo Kiva para lograr construir un cuarto en su casa para su hijo Vidal, pues solo cuenta con uno y lol comparte con su hijo, y al construir este cuarto logrará tener privacidad tanto su hijo como ellos.  son una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, pues doña Angelica a pesar que no cuenta con un trabajo se encarga del cuido de su esposo y su hijo.  El mayor sueño de don Vidal es poder mejorar su casa y darle a su familia las condiciones basicas para que vivan en un ambiente comodo y agradable, ademas desea que su hijo estudie y sea un hombre de provecho.
texts.en:
Vidal lives in the La Mascota area with his wife Angelica and his 12-year-old son Vidal, who is in his first year of high school. For the last seven years, he has been a construction worker in the city of Juigalpa.

He is requesting his second loan and hopes to receive assistance from Kiva to build a room in his house for his son Vidal, since the house currently has only one, which the family shares. With another room, everyone in the family will have more privacy. They are a family of very modest means, but are very hardworking. Angelica does not have a job, so she takes care of her husband and son.

Vidal's greatest dream is to be able to make improvements to his home and to provide his family with a comfortable and pleasant living environment. He would also like his son to continue his studies and become a good man.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea de 32 años es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa  que es propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.El restaurante de Andrea es el más concurrido de su barrio, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos platillos  que prepara, es una cocinera muy buena y desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina, ya que veía a su madre como cocinaba  con dedicación. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mezclar ingredientes y obtener lo mejor, es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que visitan su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Para el futuro  espera mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y así tener más clientes.Es el cuarto préstamo de Andrea con  MFP,y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de cada una de  sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, además en su banco comunal es muy participativa.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para cocinar, ya que la demanda por su comida va  en aumento.
texts.en:
Andrea is 32 years old and is a very happy and sincere woman. She lives in her own home and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Her restaurant is the most popular in her neighborhood and every day her customers come to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares. Andrea is a very good cook, who fell in love with cooking as a young girl watching her mother's devotion to cooking. What Andrea likes most about her job is mixing ingredients to get the best results, and because of this she cooks with great care. She has had her business for five years and thinks that the most difficult thing is serving all of the customers who come to her restaurant, since she often works alone. For the future, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her business and thereby attract more customers.

This is Andrea's fourth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be on time with each of her payments, as she hopes to receive more loans in the future and her communal bank is very involved. She will invest the 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase more ingredients, as the demand for her food is increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 29 años, es una madre de familia muy cariñosa y responsable y cuyos hijos, Jhon de 8 y Joelin de 2 años, viven junto a ella en su propia casa y lo que más desea para sus hijos es darles una buena educación. Para ello, se dedica al tejido artesanal, actividad que le ha dado muchos beneficios, ya que gracias a esta labor ha podido mantener a su familia, cubriendo todas sus necesidades. Los tejidos que realiza Marleni son de muy buena calidad, ya que tienen bonitos acabados, y eso le ha favorecido mucho en la demanda de sus tejidos en la feria dominical donde los lleva a venderlos. 
Para Marleni esta actividad le da mucha satisfacción, ya que le gusta tejer y lo hace con mucha dedicación y  esmero logrando tener 6 años en este trabajo, siendo la parte más difícil en transportar sus tejidos hasta los puntos de venta. Es así que espera mas adelante alquilar un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad y vender todas las prendas que ella misma elabora. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por lo que promete ser responsable y pagar a tiempo sus cuotas y para ello ahorrará poco a poco. Además siendo un miembro de su grupo comunal es muy activa y solidaria por lo que es muy respetada por sus demás compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana, para así incrementar el número de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Marleni is 29 years old and a loving and responsible mother to two children, Jhon, age 8, and Joelin, age 2. She lives with her family in her own home and what she wants most for her children is to provide them a good education. Towards that aim, she works as a weaver, an activity that has many benefits and which has enabled her to take care of her family and provide for their needs. The items that Marleni weaves are of a very high quality, with beautiful finishing details. This has made her products very much in demand at the Sunday market where she sells them. Marleni gets much satisfaction from this activity, since she likes to weave and has done it with great dedication and care for the last six years. The most difficult part of the work is transporting the items to the market. Because of this, in the future she would like to rent a stall in her city's market to sell all of the items that she makes herself.

This is her fourth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be responsible and on-time with her payments, as she will save little by little. She knows that being a member of a communal bank requires action and she feels a great sense of responsibility to the other members of the bank. She will invest the 1,500 nuevos soles in the purchase of more wool so that she can increase the amount of items that she can produce.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool to create weavings

texts.es: La Sra. Norma tiene como actividad la venta de ropa nueva y usada en su puesto de venta en el mercado de Villa Fatima, ella ya lleva dos años con esta atividad ayudando a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, el tambien trabaja como topografo realizando trabajos de manera individual, es una pareja que solo tiene un hijo de ocho años, el destino de el credito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Norma's commercial activity consists in new and used clothing sales from a booth in the Villa Fatima market. She has been in this line of work for 2 years helping her husband meet household expenses. He works as an independent topographer. They have an 8-year-old son. The funds will be used to increase operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
Madame Dieumbe  D. est parente  bénéficiaire, sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis mars 2003.Elle est âgée  de 36 ans  mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants. Elle  est connue dans le commerce depuis 15 ans. Elle est spécialisée  dans la vente de glace, jus et crème  glacée. Elle a fait ce choix car elle a toujours voulu gagner sa vie et elle trouve toujours du plaisir dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs .L’objet de son prêt est d’acquérir  un réfrigérateur en vue de continuer son activité car le sien est en panne. Les revenus de son activité  lui permettent de compléter  la dépense quotidienne pour soutenir son  mari.
Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Dieumbe Diagene is a parent and member of U-IMCEC since March 2003. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has been known as a vendor for 15 years. She specializes in selling ice, juices and ice-cream. She has made this choice because she always wanted to be able to support herself and because she always enjoys this activity. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs [about 225 USD]. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a refrigerator in place of her broken one, and to return to selling her goods. Her revenues go towards paying everyday expenses and helping her husband. Mrs. Diagene is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs. Madame Dieumbe D. est parente bénéficiaire, sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Camberene depuis mars 2003.Elle est âgée de 36 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est connue dans le commerce depuis 15 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de glace, jus et crème glacée. Elle a fait ce choix car elle a toujours voulu gagner sa vie et elle trouve toujours du plaisir dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs .L’objet de son prêt est d’acquérir un réfrigérateur en vue de continuer son activité car le sien est en panne. Les revenus de son activité lui permettent de compléter la dépense quotidienne pour soutenir son mari. Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La Sra. Simona tiene 50 años de edad, casada habitante del Bº 380, con dos hijos un joven de 17 años y una niña de 14 años los dos estudiantes de secundaria. La Sra. A. es una mujer muy trabajadora lava y plancha a domicilio ya tiene 3 años realizando esta labor ya que se vio en la necesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos para llevar el sustento de cada día a su hogar, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Costa Rica y cuando recoge le manda dinero por medio de remesas y de esta manera le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, su sueño a sido terminar de construir su casa y poder darles una vivienda mas digna a sus hijos así como una educación superior. Solicito un préstamo con AFODENIC, para construir un muro de concreto que divida su terreno con el vecino y así poder tener más seguridad en su vivienda. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que le apoyado en sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Simona, 50, is married and lives at B° 380 with her two children. Her son is 17, and her daughter is 14. They are both in high school. Señora A. is a very hard-working woman. She washes and irons from home. She has been doing this work for three years because she saw the need to get a little more income for the everyday support of her household. Her husband works in Costa Rica. When he collects, he sends money as remittances. That way he is able to help with the household expenses. Her dream has been to finish building her house. She wants to be able to give her children a more decent house and a post high school education. She asked AFODENIC for a loan to build a concrete wall that divides her land from her neighbor’s. This way her house will have more security. She is very grateful to the institution because it has helped her with the projects in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo el atardecer está integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras que desde su infancia han trabajado arduamente ellas son Ileana Jalinas L. V. quien tiene una dulcería, Yamileth del Socorro Vanega Rodríguez  hace y vende cajetas de leche, masa, coco, piñonate entre otros y Meylin Julieth L. tiene una humilde y modesta pulpería.
texts.en:
The Atardecer group is comprised of three hard-working women. They have worked arduously since their childhood. They are Ileana Jalinas L. V., who has a bakery; Yamileth del Socorro Vanega Rodríguez, who makes and sells “cajetas” (caramels) from milk, coconut, and pine nuts, among others; and Meylin Julieth L., who has a humble and modest mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make sweets

loans.name: Asiyam's Group

texts.ru:
Айсаева Асиям – лидер группы. В данное время Асиям живёт в г. Карабалта, Кыргызстан. Ей тридцать четыре года. В это тяжёлое время, когда очень тяжело устроиться на работу и даже если устроился, зарплаты ни на что не хватает, одно из наиболее выгодных дел, которым может заняться простой житель – это выйти на рынок торговать. Но и для этого требуется иметь начальный капитал и предпринимательские качества. Главным же качеством, пожалуй, является стремление и готовность рисковать. Асиям не стала ждать перемен или помощи со стороны кого – либо, а просто решила начать своё дело. Положение обязывало Асиям не сидеть, сложа руки; мужу пришлось уехать в г. Алматы, Казахстан. Пять лет назад она обратилась в микрокредитную компанию за кредитом, закупила товар и начала торговать  одеждой на рынке. Ей было довольно легко подобрать одежду, которую бы народ покупал, и дело её пошло. Её муж до сих пор работает в г. Алматы. У Асиям трое детей: две дочери и сын. Дочерям двенадцать и десять лет соответственно, а младшему сыну всего три годика. Дочери учатся в школе и после уроков помогают маме смотреть за младшим братиком. Это изрядно облегчает положение Асиям. Асиям добилась значительных успехов в бизнесе, несмотря на упадок в торговле. Она купила кое – какую живность для домашнего хозяйства и улучшила уровень жизни своей семьи. Сейчас её месячный доход составляет около пятнадцати тысяч сомов ($350). А ведь она начинала дело всего с пяти тысяч сомов ($116). Асиям нужен кредит, чтобы закупить зимние вещи для зимнего сезона. Она также хочет накопить деньги и купить автомашину и бытовую технику для детей. 

У Асиям трое партнёров по группе:

Жылдызкан 34 года. У неё двое детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Жылдызкан воспитывает детей и находится дома. Жылдызкан обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь мужу вложить кредитные средства в автомашины.

Тилеку двадцать пять лет. Он женат и у него одна дочь. Жена работает продавщицей в магазине. Дочь воспитывает бабушка. Тилек работает водителем и предоставляет услуги по перевозке пассажиров. Тилеку нужен кредит, чтобы купить зимние шины для машины. 

Нургуль тридцать три года. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Нургуль занимается розничной торговлей мужских джинсов. У Нургуль одна дочь.  Нургуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы вложить деньги в закупку товара.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
A. Asiyam is the leader of this group. She lives in the city of Kara-balta in Kyrgyzstan. She's thirty-four years old. In these difficult times, when jobs are scarce and even if one is found, the pay is hardly satisfactory, one of the most profitable jobs available to the average person is to become a salesman on the market. But in order for this to transpire a capital and entrepreneurial skills are required. The most valuable skill is, probably, the ability to take risks. Asiyam didn't wait for any changes or for outside help, but decided to start her own business. She could not afford to sit helplessly; her husband had to leave for Almaty City. Five years ago she approached a company specializing in microcrediting; received a loan, bought goods and started to sell clothes on the market. She could easily pick out the clothes that people would later buy from her, and so her business was successful. Her husband still works in Almaty City. Asiyam has three children: two girls and a boy. Her daughters are twelve and ten and her son is just three years old. Her daughters go to school and help look after their younger brother when they come home, which is considerable help for Asiyam. Her business is very successful even considering the recent decline in trade. She has been able to buy some livestock for her household and raise her families’ quality of life. Right now her monthly income is about fifteen thousand soms ($350), whereas she had started her business with just five thousand soms ($116). Asiyam is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothes for the winter season. She also wishes to save up some money and buy a car and some household appliances for the children. Asiyam has three partners in her group: Jyldyzkan is thirty-four years old and has two children. Her husband is a businessman. Jyldyzkan takes cares of her children at home. Jyldyzkan is asking for a loan to help her husband invest their capital in automobiles. Tilek is twenty-five years old. He's married and has one daughter. His wife works as a cashier in a store. His daughter is cared for by her grandmother. Tilek works as a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan in order to buy winter tires for his vehicle. Nurgul is thirty-three years old. Her husband works in Russia. Nurgul sells men’s jeans. She has one daughter. She is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell in the winter season

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio Cesar, de 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, el mayor de 20 años estudia 4to año de derecho, la niña de 17 años va a 1er año de la universidad, la de 15 esta en 3er año de bachillerato y el menor de 14 años en primaria, pero tiene problemas de la vision. trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como ayudante de maquinaria pesada desde hace 5 años, con horario de 7am. a 5 pm. de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana lo tiene libre, ademas del salario de la Alcaldia, cuenta con una pension del INSS, su compañera de vida Miriam trabaja vendiendo productos de AVON obtenieno un ingreso mensual con el que aporta a los gastos del hogar, ademas esta estudiando la carrera de derecho. Don Julio esta solicitando su 2do credito para continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues gracias a kiva con el credito anterior logro comprar algunos materiales para mejorar la casa, aunque no logro hacer lo que tenia planificado pues los materiales estaban demasiado caros, por lo que esta solicitando este credito para cambier el techo de su casa ,y embaldosarla. El mayor sueño de Julio Cesar es poder tener una vivienda bonita y con las condiciones basicas para su familia, pues es el patrimonio que puede darles.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 42, and he has four children. The oldest is 20, and is studying his fourth year of law. His 17 year old daughter is in her first year at the university. His 15 year old daughter is in her third year of high school. The 14 year old is in elementary school, but he has vision problems. He has worked as a heavy machinery assistant in the city of Juigalpa for five years. His schedule is from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. from Monday to Friday. He is off on the week ends. In addition to his salary from the city, he has a pension from INSS (Nicaragua Social Security Institute). His life partner, Miriam, works selling Avon products. She gets a monthly income, which contributes to the household expenses. Also, she is studying for a career in law. Julio is asking for his second loan to continue improving his house. Thanks to Kiva, he used his previous loan to buy some materials to improve his house. However, he was not able to do all that he had planned because the materials were too expensive. That is why he is asking for this loan to change the roof on his house and tile it. Julio Cesar’s greatest dream is to have a nice house with the basic conditions for his family. It is the asset that he can give them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change and tile the roof of his house

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
La señora Kamila A. de 24 años vende zapatos en la calle Tihuanaku todos los días y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Verónica B. de 32 años tiene su tienda de ferretería, donde vende material de construcción como fierros, tubos, grifos y otros, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Las demás integrantetes del grupo Shalom que pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II, cuentan con diferentes negocios como la pintura, confección de polleras, venta de jugos, café, queso y pollos. 
Shalom se fundo hace 2 años aproximadamente y les gusta llevarse como hermanas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kamila A. is 24 years old and sells shoes on Tihuanaku Street every day. She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise to resell. Veronia B. is 32 years old and has a hardware store where she sells construction materials like saws, plumbing, pipes and other necessities. She needs a loan in order to buy merchandise to resell. The other members of the Shalom Group from Centro Focal Santiago each have different businesses like painting, a dress shop, a juice store, a cafe, and cheese and chicken sales. Shalom was foudned two years ago, and the group supports members as if they were sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their stores to resell

texts.fr:
Madame Amina D.  est membre de la caisse de Camberene de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2001.
Elle a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt qu’elle a rembourse correctement. Elle  est mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants .Elle a longtemps évolue  dans le commerce et spécialisée dans la vente de tissus et d’articles divers .C’est une femme ambitieuse qui veut gagner sa vie pour se procurer des revenus personnels. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par amour. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour acheter des tissus et surtout des thioubs  dans le but de diversifier ses produits. Le  crédit  me permet d’accroître mon fond de roulement  et de renouveler continuellement mes marchandises car mes clients  achètent  à crédit.

Madame D. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Ms. Amina D. has been a member of the Camberene bank of U-IMCEC since January, 2001.  She has already benefited from a loan, which she repaid properly.  She is married and the mother of four children.  For quite awhile, she has been advancing in commerce and has specialized in selling cloth and a variety of goods.  She is an ambitious woman who wants to earn her living to have her own personal income.  Her business is one that she chose out of love.  She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy some cloth and especially  thioubs (damask fabrics) with the goal of diversifying her goods.  "The loan is allowing me to increase my operating fund and to replenish my merchandise continually because my customers buy on credit."  Ms. D. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille(PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF (a development program for children and families) seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Apeli Komlanvi

texts.en:
Mr. A. works in the high-traffic Hédzranawoè market selling used clothing. He is married and has one child.

This is Mr. A.’s first loan with WAGES, which he will use to restock his supply of used clothing. In the past, he has faced a lack of capital as his main challenge. This loan will help him overcome this obstacle and further his business' success in this busy, Togolese hot spot.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.ru:
Джумалиева Нуржамал – лидер данной группы. Ей тридцать пять лет. Нуржамал вместе с семьёй живёт в г. Карабалта. Муж Нуржамал работает на стройке. В зимнее время стройка везде приостанавливается. Однако муж Нуржамал прилагает всевозможные усилия, чтобы обеспечить себя работой в это нелёгкое время. Вместе с мужем Нуржамал воспитывает троих детей. Старшему сыну четырнадцать, дочке двенадцать лет и младшему сыну три годика. Как только двое старших детей начали ходить в школу, Нуржамал стала думать о дополнительном источнике заработка. В этом ей помогли родители. Шесть лет назад они купили ей корову и Нуржамал начала заниматься животноводством и продавать молоко. С тех пор ей удалось немного увеличить поголовье с кота.  При этом, муж также несмотря на тяжёлую работу всегда помогает Нуржамал ухаживать за скотом. Нуржамал имеет стабильный ежемесячный доход от продажи молока в размере двух тысяч четырёх сот сомов ($56). Она уже стала думать о диверсификации своей деятельности. Теперь она хочет начать разводить коз. Но для этого требуются значительные средства, которых в данное время у Нуржамал нет. По этой причине она и обратилась за кредитом. Нуржамал уверена в том, что в будущем, её нынешнее занятие позволит ей купить дом.

Вместе с Нуржамал в группу входят следующие участники:

Акылай сорок лет. Она мать пятерых детей. Муж Акылай работает пастухом. Сама Акылай также занимается разведением скота. Старшие дети хоть и учатся в ВУЗах, но тоже помогают матери по хозяйству, когда приезжают домой на выходные. Акылай надеется получить кредит, чтобы купить уголь на зиму.

Жибек двадцать восемь лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж  работает пастухом. Жибек – домохозяйка. Она также дома разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Разведение скота передалось им по наследству. Жибек обратилась за кредитом с целью купить корову и продавать больше молока. 

Эркайым тридцать семь лет. Она в разводе. У Эркайым один сын. Чтобы прокормить себя и сына, Эркайым занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. Ей удаётся зарабатывать до шести тысяч сомов в месяц, к тому же родители помогают по хозяйству. Эркайым нужен кредит для покупки овец для разведения.

Мубарахан сорок семь лет. Вместе с мужем воспитывает семерых детей. Муж работает в школе охранником. Мубарахан нужен кредит чтобы купить на зиму уголь.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurjamal D. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years old. Nurjamal and her family lives in Karabalta. Nurjamal's husband works in construction. During the winter time, building everywhere stops. However, Nurjamal's husband makes every possible effort to find work during this hard time. Nurjamal and her husband are raising three children. The older son is fourteen, the daughter is twelve and the younger son is three. As soon as the two older children started to school, Nurjamal began to think of finding an additional source of income. Her parents helped her with this. Six years ago they bought a cow and Nurjamal has started to work in animal husbandry and to sell milk. Since then she has managed to increase her herd. Her husband, despite working hard, always helps Nurjamal to look after the cattle. Nurjamal has a stable monthly income from the sale of milk at a rate of two thousand four hundred som ($56). She already began to think of diversification. Now she wishes to start raising goats. In order to do this, Nurjamal needs funds that she does not currently have. Therefore, she has applied for a loan. Nurjamal is certain that in the future, her work will allow her to buy a house. Nurzhamal's group includes the following participants: Akylai is forty years old. She is the mother of five children. Akylai's husband works as a shepherd. Akylai also raises cattle. Her older children study in school, and help their mother at home when they come home on weekends. Akylai hopes to take out a loan to buy coal for the winter. Jibek is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a shepherd. Jibek is a housewife. She also raises cattle and sells milk. Cattle cultivation has been passed down to her in her family. Jibek has applied for a loan to buy a cow and to sell more milk. Erkayim is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced. Erkayim has one son. To support herself and her son, Erkayim works in animal husbandry and sells milk. She manages to earn six thousand som a month, and her parents help out with the household. Erkayim would like a loan to buy sheep to raise. Mubarahan is forty-seven years old. She and her husband are raising seven children. Her husband works at school as a security guard. Mubarahan would like to borrow money to buy coal for the winter. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a few goats for selling goats' milk

texts.fr:
Madame Khadidiatou  B. habite dans la localité de Camberene. C’est une femme mariée  de 39 ans qui n’a jamais bénéficié  de crédit  a l’U-IMCEC ou elle est sociétaire  depuis juin 2009.Elle est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle a depuis 20 ans exerce l’activité  de commerce particulièrement  la vente de tissus et prêt a porter. C’est une activité  qu’elle a aime depuis son enfance et elle lui permet aussi de gagner sa vie. Elle emprunte 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandise pour faire face a la demande croissante et diversifiée  de sa clientèle.
Madame B. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou Baro lives in Camberene [by Dakar]. She is a 39- year old married woman who has never yet received credit from U-IMCEC since joining it in June 2009. She is married and mother of three children. For twenty years, she has been engaged in commerce, particularly in selling fabrics and ready-to-wear clothes. This is an activity which she has lliked since childhood and which allows her to support herself. She is borrowing 150,000 francs [about 350 USD] in order to increase her stock of merchandise and to meet the growing and diversified demand of her clients. Mrs. B. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF)Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents in such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs. Madame Khadidiatou B. habite dans la localité de Camberene. C’est une femme mariée de 39 ans qui n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit a l’U-IMCEC ou elle est sociétaire depuis juin 2009.Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a depuis 20 ans exerce l’activité de commerce particulièrement la vente de tissus et prêt a porter. C’est une activité qu’elle a aime depuis son enfance et elle lui permet aussi de gagner sa vie. Elle emprunte 150 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandise pour faire face a la demande croissante et diversifiée de sa clientèle. Madame B. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Jilañani Group

texts.es:
Jilañani significa creceremos, es un grupo de 10 integrantes que se reúnen en el Centro Focal Santiago II, están juntas hace un año y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, insumos y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan, así se dedican a la venta ropa interior, lana, papa, chuño (papa deshidratada), atención de llamadas, mantillas, ropa, librería, calzados y tienda de barrio.
Silvia A. de 26 años vende ropa interior en la Ceja de El Alto y en la Feria 16 de Julio. Paulina C. vende para y chuño. Jacinta M. de 62 años vende lana en su domicilio.
texts.en:
. Jilañani means "we shall grow". It is a group of 10 members that meet at Santiago II Focal Center. They have been together for a year and they need funding to buy merchandise, raw materials and ingredients according to each one's line of work. They sell underwear, wool, potato, chuño (freeze-dried potato), call center, shawls, clothing, bookstore, footwear, neighborhood grocery store. Silvia A., 26, sells underwear at Ceja de El Alto and at the 16 de Julio market. Paulina C. sells potato and chuño (freeze-dried potato). Jacinta M., 62, sells wool from in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, raw materials, and ingredients.

texts.es: Balbina D. 54 años es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia  y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.En su pequeño barrio  Balbina tiene un  quiosco D. golosinas, todos los días aproximadamente a las 8 D. la mañana empieza a atender a sus clientes, quienes prefieren comprarle por la variedad D. productos que ofrece, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio progrese D. a pocos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y esto hace  más amenas sus largas jornadas D. trabajo, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto D. venta. Para el futuro tiene planeado que su negocio siga creciendo y que con el tiempo pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Es el sexto préstamo que tiene  Balbina con  MFP, promete  pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para abastecer su negocio  y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Balbina, 54 years old, is a woman who has always worked hard to stand out in life. She lives in her own house and her greatest wish is to have a calm old age. In her little neighborhood, Balbina has a sweets kiosk. Every day, from approximately 8 in the morning, she begins to tend to her customers, who prefer to buy from her because of the variety of products she offers which has maD. her business progress over others. What she likes the best about her work is chatting with her customers, and this makes her long workdays more enjoyable. She has been doing this activity for 20 years and what she thinks the hardest is having to stay all day at her selling stand. For the future, she had plans for her business to keep growing and that in time she can improve her income. This is the sixth loan Balbina has with MFP. She promises to pay it back on time and without difficulties. In her communal bank, she is highly respected because she is the most active and committed member. With the two thousand nuevos soles requested she will buy more sweets to stock her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia tiene 61 años de edad, esta casada hace varios años, su marido es jubilado, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores e independientes.
La Sra. Nimia posee una mercería hace más de 14 años, se dedica a la compra venta de artículos de ropería, mercería y lencería, tiene una clientela clasificada ya que sus prendas son de marcas exclusivas de Argentina y Brasil, tiene clientela formada por la facilidad de pago que ella ofrece. 
Se inició con la venta ambulante con unos ahorros, luego vio la necesidad de tener un puesto fijo por la educación de sus hijos y habilitó en su sala una pequeña parte de sus mercaderías y con el tiempo fue aumentando su stock de mercaderías hasta lo que es en la actualidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: remeras, vestidos, blusas, polleras, lencerías y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nimia is 61 years old, has been married for several years, and her husband is retired. She has 3 children, all adults and independent. For more than 14 years Mrs. Nimia has had a haberdasher's shop. She buys and sells clothing, haberdashery and lingerie. She has a classified clientele because her garments are of exclusive brands from Argentina and Brazil. She has a steady clientele because she offers payment options. She started as a street vendor with some savings. Then she saw the need to have a fixed locale for her children's education and she set up a a small part of her merchandise in her living room and with time she increased her merchandise stock until what it has become now. She requests a loan to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, skirts, lingerie, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy merchandise such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, skirts, lingerie, and others

loans.name: Jibek's Group

texts.ru:
Ещё со времён перестройки, по всему СССР начались преобразования, которые завершились распадом СССР.  Далее начались сокращения во многих промышленных предприятиях, заводах, цехах и фабриках, в результате чего, многие люди остались без работы. Эта судьба постигла также и нашу участницу группы, Кожомуратову Жибек - лидер группы. Будучи, оптимистом в душе и смелым по натуре человеком, Жибек вместе с подругами, очень точно прочувствовали дух времени и решили выйти торговать на рынок. На тот момент у Жибек было всего двести сомов ($10), чтобы начать дело. К тому же Жибек – вдова, и надо было растить четверых детей. Она вырастила и помогла встать на ноги своим детям. Старшему сыну двадцать девять лет. Он женат и уже живёт отдельно со своей семьёй. Одной дочери двадцать восемь лет. Она работает в Казахстане. Второй дочери двадцать пять лет. Она находится на заработках в России. Младшему сыну шестнадцать лет. Он живёт с Жибек и помогает ей на рынке. Они торгуют кондитерскими изделиями и яйцами. В течение четырнадцати лет, Жибек и её дети общими усилиями смогли купить дом и достроить его. Жибек также купила в Бишкеке одну комнату в общежитии для одной из дочерей. Жибек и её младший сын сами справлялись с торговлей и не нуждались в материальной поддержке остальных детей.  Жибек не хочет стеснять детей. Но ей требуется некоторая сумма денег, чтобы вложить их в бизнес. Она надеется, что с помощью кредита ей удастся увеличить товарооборот. В будущем Жибек хотела бы улучшить торговую точку, а также купить второй дочери квартиру. 

Партнёры Жибек по группе:

Гульмире сорок пять лет. У неё один сын. Муж Гульмиры – ветеринарный врач. Гульмира занимается оптово – розничной торговлей яйцами. Гульмира решила обратиться за этим кредитом, чтобы вложить средства в ремонт машины. 

Гульнаре сорок четыре года. Она разведена. У Гульнары четверо детей. Все дети кроме младшей дочери 
работают в г. Бишкеке. Гульнара занимается перепродажей и откормом овец. Это ежемесячно приносит ей шесть тысяч сомов. Гульнаре нужен кредит, чтобы купить корм. 

Бурме сорок шесть лет. Она – вдова. У Бурмы двое детей. Старший сын работает на стройке, а младший учится в школе. Бурма занимается продажей яиц. Бурма надеется получить кредит и вложить его в закупку большой партии яиц. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
During the time of Perestroika, the former USSR began a transformation which culminated in its disintegration. This led to reductions in many industrial enterprises, factories, shops and plants, leaving many people without work to this day. Jibek K., the group leader, well understands this fate. She is an optimist during the storm and courageous at heart. Jibek and her girlfriends felt the spirit of their time and decided to trade at the market. At that point in time, Jibek had only two hundred som ($10) to begin her business. Besides, Jibek is a widow and had to raise her four children. They have grown up and she has helped them to get on their feet. The older son is twenty-nine years old. He is married and lives separately with his family. One daughter is twenty-eight years old. She works in Kazakhstan. Her second daughter is twenty-five. She is working in Russia. The youngest son is sixteen. He lives with Jibek and helps her in the market. They sell confectionery products and eggs. Within fourteen years, Jibek and her children, by working together, were able to buy a partial house and complete it. Jibek has also bought a dorm room in Bishkek for one of daughters. Jibek and her younger son supported themselves with trade and did not require material support from her other children. Jibek does not wish to burden her children. However, she needs a bit of money to put back into the business. She hopes that a loan will increase sales. In the future, Jibek would like to improve her shop and eventually to buy her second daughter an apartment. Jibek's partners include: Gulmira is forty-five years old. She has one son. Gulmira's husband is a veterinary surgeon. Gulmira works buying and selling eggs. Gulmira needs this loan to repair her car. Gulnara is forty-four years old. She is divorced. Gulnara has four children. All of her children except the youngest daughter work in Bishkek. Gulnara works in sales and fattening sheep. Her monthly income is six thousand som. Gulnara need the loan to buy feed. Burma is forty-six years old. She is a widow. Burma has two children. Her older son works in construction, and the younger one goes to school. Burma works selling eggs. Burma hopes to get a loan to buy a large number of eggs. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for make confectionery products before the New Year's holiday

loans.name: Yerald Augusto

texts.es: Yerald Augusto L. fabrica calzado de todo tipo este oficio lo aprendió desde muy niño ya que su padre también hacia zapatos. Ahora el es independiente y sigue con la tradición que ha pasado de generación en generación en su familia y se siente muy orgulloso por ello.
texts.en:
Yerald Augusto Lopez makes shoes of all kinds. He learned this trade since he was a very young child because her father was also a shoemaker. Now he is independent and he continues with the tradition which has passed from generation to generation in his family and he feels very proud of that.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials such as leather, nails, glue, soles, etc.

texts.es:
El señor Rafael tiene 46 años de edad, está casado con la señora  Graciela Cano de 42 años, tienen un solo hijo de 18 años de edad, viven cerca del centro de la ciudad de Itá. 

Rafael posee una carpintería desde hace 10 años, donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles como roperos, sillas, mesas, placares y otros, sus clientes son particulares, ocasionales y vendedores ambulantes, además es empleado como chofer de una empresa hace 2 años. 

El hijo es quien realiza los trabajos de carpintería mientras él trabaja como chofer. 

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de madera que consiguió a buen precio ya que manifiesta que tienen una buena cantidad de pedidos para fin de año y desea cumplir con todos ellos.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael is 46 years old, is married to Mrs. Graciela Cano who is 42, and they have an only child who is 18 years old. They live close to downtown in the city of Ita. For 10 years Rafael has owned a carpenter's workshop where he creates all sorts of furniture such as dressers, chairs, tables, and others. His customers are individuals, temporary jobs, and street vendors. In addition he has worked works as a chauffeur for a company for the past 2 years. His son is who fulfills the carpentry jobs while he works as a chauffeur. The loan requested is to buy wood which he found at a good price, since he expresses that he has a good amount of orders for the end of the year and wants to fulfill all of them.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Cet homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d'alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et d'assurer l'éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Il vend des pâtes alimentaires, des tomates en boîte, du lait en poudre, de la mayonnaise et de l'eau minérale. En ce moment certains de ses produits sont en baisse, c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 bidons d'huile, 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires Spaghuetti et 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes. Il a la ferme assurance de pouvoir rembourser son crédit à temps.
texts.en:
This man’s source of income is selling groceries at the Hézdranawoé market in Lomé. This business, launched in 2002, allows him to support his wife and to send his two children to school. He sells pasta, canned tomatoes, powdered milk, mayonnaise and mineral water. At the moment, he is running out of stock on some of his goods, which is why he is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 25 canisters of oil, 10 boxes of spaghetti and 10 boxes of canned tomatoes. He is fully confident in being able to repay his loan on time. Cet homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des produits d'alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2002 et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et d'assurer l'éducation scolaire de ses 02 enfants. Il vend des pâtes alimentaires, des tomates en boîte, du lait en poudre, de la mayonnaise et de l'eau minérale. En ce moment certains de ses produits sont en baisse, c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 bidons d'huile, 10 cartons de pâtes alimentaires Spaghuetti et 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes. Il a la ferme assurance de pouvoir rembourser son crédit à temps.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
Madame Maty  M.  est une femme mariée  âgée  de 34 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene et qui est sociétaire  a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003.Elle a déjà  bénéficié de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle a 3 enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus d’habits pour enfants et de petit déjeuner .depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a juste choisi cette activité pour gagner des bénéfices  car mon mari a des revenus faibles par rapport  aux charges familiales. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs en vue  de renforcer son stock de tissus d’habits pour enfants et acquérir  des chaussures pour diversifier ses marchandises. Ainsi  elle pourra répondre  a la forte demande de veille des fêtes de sa clientèle.
Madame M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Maty M. is a married woman, 34 years of age, who lives in Camberene [by Dakar] and is a member of U-IMCEC fund since November 2003. She had already taken out 4 loans in the past. She has three children. Her business is selling fabric for children’s clothing and breakfast foods. She has been doing it for more than 20 years. She has chosen this activity in order to increase her income since her husband’s income is insufficient to support the family. She is seeking a credit of 150,000 francs [about 350 USD] in order to build up her merchandise stock: to buy more fabric for children’s clothing and also to buy some shoes to diversify her selection. This will enable her to satisfy increased customer demand in the holiday season. Mrs. M. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.
