Elle a 3 enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus d’habits pour enfants et de petit déjeuner .depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a juste choisi cette activité pour gagner des bénéfices car mon mari a des revenus faibles par rapport aux charges familiales. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs en vue de renforcer son stock de tissus d’habits pour enfants et acquérir des chaussures pour diversifier ses marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra répondre a la forte demande de veille des fêtes de sa clientèle. Madame M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

Lira, the leader of this group, comes from the city of Karabalta. She is thirty-eight years old and, together with her husband, she is raising four children. Her eldest son, 19, is serving in the army; a daughter, 13, and another son, 6, are going to school; the smallest daughter is just two years old. Nowadays, it is extremely difficult for people of Lira’s age to find a proper job. Moreover, even young people are forced to leave the city in search of better opportunities. In such conditions people choose to engage themselves in either trade or animal husbandry. Lira and her husband have chosen to raise livestock and poultry. Due to their savings they were able to buy some land and started farming. Later on, they bought cows. Now, Lira’s husband has taken over most of the duties regarding the cattle and the land while Lira has had to stay at home and take care of her daughter. However, she has found an excellent way to help her husband in supporting the family. While staying at home, Lira has started manufacturing traditional articles and handing them in to the shops to sell. Surprisingly, her articles attracted many customers and Lira started to earn decent money. Now, her monthly income is around $155. Lira wants to start raising turkeys. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase turkeys to raise. These are Lira’s partners: Domira, 48, is the mother of two children. Domira sells milk products and her husband raises livestock. Domira needs a loan to purchase coal. Istatoj, 53, is a widow and has raised four children. To make a living she is engaged in animal husbandry and selling milk. She has applied for this loan to purchase coal. Gulnara, 46, has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Gulnara helps her husband in working the land. Besides that, she keeps some cattle and sells milk. Gulnara needs this loan to purchase coal. Klara, 52, has one son. With her husband she trades in milk and turkeys. Her husband mainly looks after the turkeys. Klara hopes to obtain this loan and buy coal for the winter. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen de 45 años de edad es soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad que esta estudiando en la escuela primaria.
Doña Carmen actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio de peluqueria que se encuentra ubicado hace más de 10 años en el mercado municipal de Caaguazú. Además se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados de marcas. Le va muy bien ya que cuenta con una clienta formada gracias a la buena atencion que les ofrece a su clientela.
 Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su negocio para llegar a abrir un salón mas agradable y de primera calidad para que los clientes se sientan cómodos por el servicio que les ofrece.
La cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un lavatorio de cabellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is 45 years old, single, and has a 10-year-old daughter who is in elementary school. Mrs. Carmen currently has her own hairdressing salon which has been located for more than 10 years in the municipal market of Caaguazu. In addition, she sells brand clothing and shoes. She does very well because she counts with a set clientele thanks to the attention she offers to her customers. Her personal dream is to expand her business to open a more pleasant, first class, salon so that her customers feel comfortable with the service she offers to them. The customer requests the loan to buy a hair washbasin.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Maritza vive en la zona # 8 junto a su familia compuesta por 2 niños y su esposo, labora como docente de primaria de la zona Urbana de  Nueva Guinea desde  hace 8 años,  sus hijos actualmente estudian su primaria en la Escuela Rigoberto cabezas y su esposo trabaja como comerciante de ganado y le apoya con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, ya que son una familia bien unida y con mucho deseos de superacion. Maritza esta solicitando su 2do credito para invertirlo en  la construccion de una habitación para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda bonita y que sus dos hijos estudien y continuen en el camino de Dios para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Maritza and her family live in Zone 8. She and her husband have two children. She has worked as a primary school teacher in the urban area of Nueva Guinea for eight years. Currently their children are students at Rigoberto Cabezas Primary School. Her husband buys and sells cattle and helps her with household expenses and financial commitments as the family is close-knit and eager to get ahead. Maritza is asking for her second loan which she will use to build a house and provide her family with a more comfortable life. Her dream is to have stable work, a nice house, and two children who study hard so they can continue on the path of God so they do well in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora Irma tiene 51 años de edad, está casada, tiene 9 hijos, seis de ellos varones y  tres mujeres. Dos de sus hijos se encuentran en España y la ayudan con  la manutención del hogar mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de leche que le producen sus 3 vacas lecheras. 

Sus clientes son dueños de despensas de la zona y particulares, el préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de una vaca holanda el cual le producirá mayor cantidad de leche, con eso la señora busca aumentar sus ingresos y lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

La señora Irma es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.008, demostrando ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas en el crédito anterior cancelado.
texts.en:
51-year old Señora Irma is married and has nine children, six boys and three girls. Two of them now live in Spain and help her financially with household expenses. Irma sells milk which she gets from her three cows. Her customers are owners of local corner stores or private individuals. The loan she is asking for is to buy a Holland cow which produces the greatest quantity of milk. In this way Irma is looking to increase her income so she can improve her own and her family’s lives. Irma has been a client of the Paraguay Foundation since 2008, and she demonstrated responsibility in the repayment of her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El Sr. Catalino O. de 56 años de edad, esta casado hace 27 años con la Sra. Eva Nuñez de 53 años de edad. 
El matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales los dos mayores ya están casado y los restantes de 22,20, 17 y 13 están viviendo con su padre y solo la menor de todos sigue estudiando actualmente termino su 6to. 
Grado y el resto ya culminó su secundaria, todos están trabajando con su padre en la carpintería, la señora es empleada del Instituto de Previsión Social, y están viendo la forma de hacer estudiar el año próximo a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
El Sr. Catalino tiene este negocio de carpinteria y aserradero hace 25 años, prepara diferentes tipo de muebles y que luego comercializa con las mueblerias y también realiza cortes de maderas en su aserradero. 
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas, clavos, pegamentos y con eso poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
56-year old Sr. Catalino O. has been married for 27 years to his wife Sra. Eva Nuñez who is 53 years old. They have six children, the two oldest are already married, and the remaining ones are 22, 20, 17, and 13 and live at home. Only the youngest daughter is still in school and has finished 6th grade. The others completed high school and are now working with their father in his carpentry business. His wife works at the Ministry of Social Services. They are hoping to find a way for their children to go to university next year. Sr. Catalino has had his carpentry and sawmill business for 25 years. He makes different kinds of furniture and then sells it to furniture shops. He also cuts wood in his sawmill. He is asking for a loan to buy wood, plywood, nails, and adhesive so that he can complete all the orders that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Don Marcial es casado, , labora desde hace 15 años como docente de Educación primaria en la Escuela Arlenis Davila Davila en la zona urbana, tiene 3 niños varones el mayor de 10 añitos de edad y el otro niño de 4 cuatro añito y un bebe de cinco meses de nacido, su esposa trabaja como docente de secundaria en una escuela de secundaria, ambos comparten con los gastos familares del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, Marcial esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 5to crédito para construcciòn de una habitacion en su casa, pues desea brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia,  se caracteriza por ser profesor  de buena conducta moral, responsable , honesto, muy trabajador y con muchos deseos de superaciòn este cliente a inicio de este año se recibio de master en politicas educacativas, su sueño es seguir estudiando, ir mejorando su vivienda con cada crédito otorgado por AFODENIC, salud para su familia y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Don Marcial is married, and he's been working for 15 years as a teacher in primary Education at the Arlenis Davila Davila School, in the urban district. He has three male children, the oldest is ten years old, and the other is four years old, and a baby of five months. His wife works as a secondary school teacher. Both share family expenses for the household. With their current loans, Marcial is requesting a refinance of his fifth loan for building a bedroom on his house. He's hoping to provide the maximum comfort for his family. He is described as being a reputable professor, of good moral conduct, who is responsible, honest and hardworking with dreams of improving his life. This year, the client received a master's degree in political education. His dream is to continue studying, improving his life and the health of his family and their economic stability with each loan originated by AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 43 años es una mujer muy sencilla y luchadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.Auque es la propietaria de la combi (auto algo amplio de transporte público con capacidad para transportar varias personas), Gladys no tiene ningún problema en desempeñarse como cobradora, ha puesto a trabajar su auto  en una empresa de transportes, que brinda servicio urbano por las calles de la ciudad donde vive, su carisma y alegría han hecho que sea una de las cobradoras más conocidas de la empresa, lo cual le a ayudado a tener más pasajeros que el resto de vehículos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al tener su propia combi aprovecha para conducirla, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día parada al costado de la puerta soportando el frío que entra de la calle. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una combi nueva, y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Es el cuarto préstamo de Gladys con  MFP y al igual como lo hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades; en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida.Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, mandará arreglar el techo de su combi en un taller de mecánica, ya que actualmente el vehiculo tiene el techo  muy bajo y no le permite recoger muchos pasajeros.
texts.en:
Gladys, 43, is a hard-working, unassuming woman who lives in a relative's house; what she most wants is to stand out in life. Although she's the owner of a combi (van-like vehicle used in public transportation of passengers) she doesn't shrink back from working as fare collector. She has placed her combi with a transportation company which provides urban transportation along the streets where she lives. Her charisma and pleasant disposition has made her one of the company's most recognized fare collectors which, in turn, has caused her to have more passengers than any other vehicle. What she likes best about her work is that, owning her own combi, she can sometimes actually drive it herself. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of it having to stand alongside the door all day in the cold draft that comes in from the street. For the future, Gladys hopes to save enough money to buy a new combi thereby improving her income. This is her fourth loan with MFP and, as she did with her former loans, she aims to repay this one on time and without any difficulties. She is highly respected in her communal bank because she is the most active and committed member. With the 2500 new soles requested, she will have the roof on her combi repaired because it is currently too low to allow for many passengers to ride.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her vehicle in order to offer better service.

loans.name: Violeta Iduvina

texts.es:
Violeta es una madre de familia de 58 años de edad y tiene 7 hijos, vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 30 años que tiene necesidades especiales en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva más de un año a cargo de un restaurante que funciona en un grifo ubicado en la carretera Panamericana (la principal carretera del país que atraviesa la localidad), allí ella ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y cenas a los transportistas, policías y diversos pobladores de la zona que frecuentan el lugar. Violeta nos comenta que antes trabajaba en restaurantes y que su sueño fue tener uno propio, gracias a su esfuerzo su negocio poco a poco, está saliendo adelante.

Violeta desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de bebidas e insumos para elaboración de comida con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio, pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para realizar esta acción, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Violeta aspira a seguir creciendo como empresaria y utilizar sus futuras ganancias en hacer mejoras en su casa. Ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable, es muy conocida por la zona en donde vive, sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer activa y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Violeta, 58, is the mother of 7 children. She lives with her husband and a 30-year-old daughter, who has special needs, in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last year she has run a restaurant located in a gas station alongside the Panamerican Highway (country's main highway that goes through the location). She offers breakfast, lunch and dinner to truck drivers, police officers, and various residents of the area that frequent the place. Violeta tells us that she used to work in restaurants and she's always dreamed of having her own. Thanks to her work effort, she has been getting ahead little by little. Violeta would like to enlarge her business buying beverages and ingredients needed to prepare her meals. However, she lacks the capital to do so. Therefore, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles. Violeta aspires to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to use her future profits to do some home improvements. She is a hard-working, very responsible mother who's well known in her area. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be an active woman who is always willing to help others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio, es un señor muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, tiene 36 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de Itá y vive en la Compañía Ca´aguazu, de la misma ciudad, está casado con la Sra. Lorenza de 34 años de edad, con quien tiene 4 hijos, Hugo de 8 años, Miguel de 16, María Luisa de 12 y Elizabeth de 14 años de edad. 

El señor Eulalio hace 10 años que se encuentra trabajando con la electricidad del automóvil, gracias a la cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos. 

Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y puedan ser personas de bien. 

Hace mas de tres años que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya, y se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad y la confianza brindada en su persona.
texts.en:
Eulalio, is a very hardworking man who is very dedicated to his family. He is 36 years old, was born in the city of Itá, and lives in the the Compañía Ca´aguazu area of the same city. He is married to Lorenza, 34 years old, and has four children, Hugo, 8, Miguel, 16, María Luisa, 12, and Elizabeth, 14.

Ten years ago Eulalio began working as an automobile mechanic, and thanks to this he can pay for his family's living expenses and for his children's education.

His greatest desire is that his children will grow up to be good people who have professional jobs.

He has been working with Fundación Paraguaya for more than three years and he is very grateful for the the opportunity that they provide and for the confidence they have shown in him.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for his business

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba  Laye G. est une parente bénéficiaire  de 28 ans  soucieuse d’exercer une activité  génératrice  de revenu. Ainsi  elle s’est orientée  vers la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis 3 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. Les  bénéfices  réalises  lui permettent d’assurer pour une partie du temps la dépense  quotidienne Elle  est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2007Elle habite dans la localité  de Camberene. Elle  sollicite sollicite  un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour accroitre son stock de produits cosmétiques .
Madame G. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba Laye G., aged 28, is a recipient parent who wanted to operate an income-generating business.  And so she turned toward selling cosmetics three years ago. She is married and the mother of two children.  The profits realized are enabling her for part of the time to cover everyday expenses.  She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since October 2007.  She lives in the town of Camberene.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her inventory of cosmetic products.  Ms. G. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Seydina Issa Laye PDEF (Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille), a development program for children and families. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nery B. de 26 años de edad, vive en la zona periurbana de Paraíso de Guayaquil, vive en la casa de su ex suegra la cual es de cemento con dos servicios básicos agua y luz sin alcantarillado, Nery es soltera pero tiene 1 hijo que tiene 6 años de edad y estudia en una escuela particular.

Nery comenzó con una pequeña tienda en su casa para pasar más tiempo con su hijo, ahora ella atiende la tienda desde las 06h30 hasta las 22h30, vende aceites, arroz, fideos, una de sus mayores dificultades es el peligro que hay en su sector por los ladrones.

Con el préstamo Nery quiere comprar arroz, dulces, fideos, aceites, para agrandar mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y así tener capital para comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nery B. is 26 years old, she lives in the area surrounding Paraíso de Guayaquil. She lives in her ex-mother-in-law’s house, which is a cement house with the basics: water and electricity without a sewer system. Nery is single but she has one son who is 6 years old and attends a private school.

Nery started out with a small store in her in order to spend more time with her son. Now she works in the store from 6:30am to 22:30pm, selling oils, rice, noodles. One of her greatest difficulties is the danger that there are thieves in the area.

With the loan, Nery wants to buy rice, sweets, noodles, oils in order to expand her business more. In the future, she wants to expand her business and then have the finances to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El señor Blas tiene 54 años de edad, está casado con la señora Celestina quien tiene 47 años de edad, ambos  nacidos en la ciudad de Itá, distante a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad capital. 

Tienen 2 hijos que ya son independientes, viven en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá donde posee una carpintería hace más de 18 años, allí fabrica y vende todo tipo de muebles como sillas, roperos, placares, mesas y otros, sus clientes en su mayoría son macateros (Revendedores de todo tipo de artículos) de la zona y particulares. 

El señor Blas opera con la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años demostrando buen pago en sus préstamos cancelados. En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera, ya que tienen varios pedidos de ropero y necesita para capital operativo.
texts.en:
Blas, 54, is married to Celestina, 47. Both were born in he city of Itá, which is a few kilometers away from the capital They have two adult sons. They live in a neighborhood that's very close to dowtown Itá where he has had a carpentry shop for over 18 years. He manufactures all kinds of furniture like: chairs, wardrobes, built-ins, tables, etc. His customers are, for the most part, "macateros" (people who resell all kinds of articles) from the area and private individuals. Blas has worked with Fundación Paraguaya for 3 years now and has always paid back his loans punctually. On this occasion, he is asking for funds to buy lumber since he has several wardrobes on order and he needs working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Monica Antonia

texts.es: Mónica tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Mónica tiene amplia experiencia en el negocio de estilista (Salon de Belleza). Viene laborando ya más de 15 años en distintos lugares, luego adquirió un local en el mercado Santo Domingo en donde labora cada día. Mónica ofrece sus servicios en su local en donde les brinda un buen servicio y a bajo costo. A la vez aprovecha cada cliente nuevo que llega a su negocio brindándole un buen servicio, por eso es que cada vez llegan más clientes a su negocio. Mónica sueña con seguir construyendo su casa y que sus  hijos concluyan sus estudios universitarios. Mónica solicita el crédito para invertir en mejoras de su local.
texts.en:
Monica is 43 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children. Monica has extensive experience in the business of being a stylist (beauty parlor). She has worked for more than 15 years in different places. Later she acquired a place in the Santo Domingo market where she works every day. Monica offers her services in her place of business where she provides a good service at low cost. She makes the most of each client, providing him or her a good service. This is why more clients are always coming to her business. Monica dreams of continuing with the construction of her home and for her children to finish their university studies. Monica is asking for the loan to invest in improvements in her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her place of business

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz, the leader of this group, is thirty-one years old. She has a husband and a seven-year-old daughter. To provide for the family, her husband works as a security guard. Her husband’s intention has always been to let Jyldyz stay at home and be a housewife, so that she could give best possible upbringing for their daughter, who has already started to go to school. When their daughter was little, Jyldyz obediently sat at home and looked after the child. After their daughter grew a little older, Jyldyz started to grow and sell strawberries. She thriftily saved her earnings and bought a cow for three hundred and ninety five dollars. Due to these contributions of hers, they have been able to build a home. Now, Jyldyz is still a housewife, but she manages to make money selling milk as well. Her monthly income from selling milk only constitutes seventy dollars. She sees great opportunities in animal husbandry and is resolute about continuing to breed and increase her total population of livestock. Therefore, Jyldyz has applied for this loan to buy a calf to raise and coal for the winter season. She is planning to build temporary buildings and sheds for her cattle behind the house. Jyldyz’s partners are: Joldoshbek, 56, is a stock breeder. He is the father of five children: four sons and one daughter. All his sons work and live separately. His wife works in a hospital as a medical assistant. Joldoshbek hopes to obtain a loan to purchase several sheep to raise. Elmira, 40, is the mother of seven children. Her eldest daughter is twenty four and her little daughter is three. Her husband has a tractor and provides ploughing services for villagers. Elmira needs a loan to buy a calf. Saule, 40, has three children and her eldest daughter goes to college. Her husband trades in meat at a local market. Saule is a housewife and also looks after cattle and sells milk. Selling milk brings her $24 a month. Saule needs a loan to purchase sheep to raise. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a calf to raise and coal for the winter season

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda de 37 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.En una  gasolinera  se encuentra el puesto de golosinas de Hermelinda; todos los días aprovecha que los buses interprovinciales se detienen para cargar de combustibles, es entonces cuando ella ofrece sus productos a los pasajeros, quienes no pierden la oportunidad de comprarse algo para el largo camino.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo libre para dedicarse a las labores de su hogar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender rápido sus golosinas, ya que los buses no le dan mucho tiempo. Para el futuro tiene planeado seguir trabajando duro y así con mucho esfuerzo mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Es el primer préstamo de Hermelinda con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo además  esta dispuesta a ahorrar para cancelarlo ,es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por la demás socias.Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 37 years old and is a very hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in a house with one of her relatives and her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. Herminda runs a sweets stand at a gas station. Every day she takes advantage of the interprovincial buses that stop there to refuel. This is when she offers her products to passengers who don't lose the opportunity to buy something for the long journey. What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to dedicate herself to household tasks. She has worked at this job for 10 years, and thinks that the most difficult part is to have to sell her sweets quickly, as the buses don't give her much time. She plans to keep working hard in the future; with hard work she will be able to increase her income. This is Hermelinda's first loan with MFP and she knows she will have to pay it back on time. Furthermore, she is prepared to save money in order to pay it back. She is a very happy member of her communal bank and is loved by the other members. With the 700 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more sweets to better stock her stand and gain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to stock her business

texts.es: Jared no tiene hijos, actualmente vive con sus padres a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja como maestro de ingles en en una escuela de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitación, y asi tener mayor privacidad,  esta estudiando tercer año en la licenciatura en Ingles en la Universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea ya este joven tiene munchos deseos de superación profesional y personal,  en el colegio donde el  labora es muy querido por sus alumnos, padres de familia y docentes por ser un joven muy humilde pero bien responsable con sus deberes,  Su sueño es  tener una vivienda digna como todo cuidadano desea, tener salud  y trabajo para ayudar a su familia ya son de escasos recursos economico.
texts.en:
Jared does not have children. He lives with his parents, whom he helps with household expenses. He works as an English teacher at Nueva Guinea school. He is requesting his third loan to invest in the construction of a bedroom so that he can have more privacy. He is in his third year of studies towards a degree in English from URACCAN University's Nueva Guinea campus.

Jared is a young man who has many dreams to get ahead personally and professionally. He is very well-liked by the students, parents, and staff of the school where he works since he is a very humble but responsible man. His dream is to have a nice home, good health, and employment so that he can help his family, who have scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Tomasa Haydee

texts.es: Doña Tomasa vive en la zona urbana de  Nueva Guinea, trabaja como docente desde hace 20 años,  tiene  cuatro hijos mayores de edad  todos trabajan, su esposo es pastor de la Iglesia Centroamericana y asume los gastos familiares de sus padres ya que son de escasos recursos economicos. Tomasa está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para terminar de repellar la cosina y hecharle el piso, se caracteriza por ser una  señora  responsable, honesta,  trabajadora  y muy querida en su comunidad,  es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que le encanta trabajar con niños .Ella se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tomasa lives in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea and has been a teacher for 20 years. She has 4 grown children, all of whom work. Her husband is a pastor of the Central American Church and covers family expenses for his parents, due to their scarce financial resources.

Tomasa is soliciting financing for her 3rd loan and wants to finish the walls and floor of her kitchen. She is characterized in her community as a responsible, honest, hard-working and much loved woman. She is a teacher who loves her work and, especially, working with children.

She is very grateful for the Institution of AFODENIC. With previous loans she bought electrical appliances and improved the house where she lives. Her dream is to have a lovely home and to work hard to advance her children, and to help her mother with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO FINISH HER KITCHEN AND INSTALL A FLOOR

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 26 años de edad, vive en concubinato con la Sra. Sandra Miranda, no tienen hijos, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá. 

 En el centro de la ciudad alquila un salón donde comercializa teléfonos celulares, carcasas, estuches y realiza servicios de reparación, además vende auto radios, parlantes, Twister, cornetas, cajas y realiza equipamiento de vehículos hace 3 años.  

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mas artículos para equipamiento de vehículos y celulares, en esta ocasión desea realizar sus compras de Ciudad del Este ya que allí estos artículos tienen un costo muy bajo lo cual le generará mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ramón, 26, lives with Sandra Miranda. They do not have children. They live in a well known neighborhood in the city of Itá. He rents a space in the center of the city where he sells cell phones, covers, and cases; and he provides repair services. He also sells car radios, speakers, horns, and gearboxes. He has been equipping vehicles for three years. The loan he is asking for is to buy more items to equip vehicles and cell phones. This time he wants to make his purchases in the Ciudad del Este because these items are much cheaper there. That will generate a greater margin of earnings in his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones and equipment for radios

texts.es: Flor tiene 58 años de edad, es soltera  vive con su hija y su yerno. Ella antes del terremoto poseía una bodega, posterior al desastre perdió su vivienda y toda su mercadería, luego de esto ya no tuvo capital para volver a iniciar su negocio, al no tener su negocio se dedico a la venta de postres y refrescos en su vivienda. Flor ya tiene 2 años en esta actividad siendo conocido su negocio. En los años que lleva trabajando Flor ya es muy conocida por muchísimas personas que acuden a su casa en donde les brinda  buen trato. Flor tiene el anhelo de construir su casa por eso es que el poco dinero que le queda lo invierte en la compra de materiales de construcción. Por este motivo es que Flor solicita el crédito para la compra de una congeladora y así poder vender cerveza,y tener capital para implemetar su negocio y construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Flor is 58 and single. She lives with her daughter and son-in-law. Before the earthquake she had a mini market. After the disaster she lost her house and all of her merchandise. After that she did not have the money to start her business again. Not having her business, she devoted herself to selling desserts and soft drinks where she lives. She has been doing this for two years, and her business is well known. In the years that she has been working, Flor has become well known by the many people who come to her home, where she treats them well. Flor wishes to build her house. With the little money she has left she buys construction material. This is the reason Flor is asking for a loan to buy a freezer. That way she would be able to sell beer and have the money to set up her business and build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Doña Nellys vive  en la zona# 4 de Nueva Guinea junto a sus dos hijos:  la niña mayor tiene 14 añitos estudia su segundo año de secundaria y el niño menor tiene 9 añitos estudia su tercer grado de primaria, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus colectivo, ella trabaja como adminsitradora  en la casa Materna desde hace 9 años,  está solicitando su cuarto credito   para la Construccion de una cocina, y asi tener mejor comodidad  y mirar su cocina mas bonita. Nellys  es una mujer emprendedora que ha ayudado a muchas mujeres campesinas que llegan a dar luz a sus bebe,  por medio de gestiones realizadas por la responsable de la Casa Materna se les da albergues,  su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nellys lives in zone #4 of Nueva Guinea with her two children: the eldest daughter is 14 years old and studies her second year of secondary school, and the younger boy is 9 years old and is in 3rd grade. Her husband works as a bus driver. She has been working as an administrator in the Casa Materna for the past 9 years. She is requesting her fourth loan to build a kitchen so they be more comfortable and look at a prettier kicthen. Nellys is an entrepreneuring woman who has helped many women who come from the country to give birth to their babies. She offers them shelter through negotiations made by the one responsible in the Casa Materna. Her dream is to have a house in better conditions and work stability so she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Kattia Milagros

texts.es:
Kattia tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año tiene instalado en su hogar un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para niños y calzado. Ella pudo crear este negocio gracias a algunos ahorros con los que contaba y al apoyo que le brindaron sus padres. Esta actividad es su única fuente de sustento económico, por lo que día a día da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante.

El negocio ha tenido buena acogida entre los pobladores de la zona, por lo que Kattya está pensando en ampliarlo, pero ya no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir sacando adelante su negocio para brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le asegure un futuro prometedor. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Kattia is a 21 year old single mother who lives with her parents and son in the Olmos Distrit, about 1 hour and 45 minuts from Chiclayo. She started a business out of her house a year ago, selling children clothes and shoes. She was able to start this business thanks to some savings she had and the help of her parents. This is her only source of income and she works hard every day to improve her business, which has had good reception in the community. Kattia is looking forward to making her business bigger but she doesn't have enough money to invest in it and for this reason she's asking Edpyme Alternativa for a $350 loan. Her biggest dream is to be able to provide her son with quality education so he can have a better future. She's a very hard working entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Children's Clothes and Shoes

texts.es: Justina de 45 años es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 43 años y sus 4 hijos ; Florentina de 10, Fredy de 9 , Candy de 8 y Erika de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Los años que Justina viene realizando la crianza de ganado, le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, realiza esta actividad desde que tenia 13 años y actualmente se a convertido en una de las ganaderas más solicitadas, debido a las grandes reses que lleva a vender a su ciudad.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar su ganado, ya que sabe que mientras mejor los cuide, mejores pagos le darán por sus reses, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las reses hasta el lugar de la venta, puesto que es una actividad que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Para más adelante, desea aperturar  una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar otros ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es el segundo préstamo de Justina con  MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que imparte en  las reuniones.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más forraje para sus animales, ya que desea tenerlos bien alimentados para venderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Justina, 45, is a responsible, hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, Luis, 43, and their 4 children, Florentina, 10, Fredy, 9, Candy, 8 and Erika, 7, in their own house. Her children are the motivating force in her life. For several years, Florentina has raised cattle. This has allowed the family to have a worthy life. She has been in this line of work since she was 13 years old and she is now one of the most sought-after cattlewomen thanks to the big steers she brings into the city to sell. What she likes most about her work is raising the cattle because she knows that, the better she cares for them, the better prices her steers will command. She has been in this line of work for 25 years and she feels that the most difficult aspect of it is transporting the steers to the sales points because this activity is very labor intensive. For later in the future, she would like to open a grocery store to generate extra income and, thus, improve her family's quality of life. This is Justina's second loan with MFP and she feels obliged to repay on time because she doesn't want any problems with her fellow members where she is very well-liked because of the joy she brings to the meetings. With the 1000 new soles requested she will buy fodder for her animals because she wants them to be well fed in order to sell them at the best price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Cesar S. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de torno elaborando todo tipo de piezas metalicas las que son trabajadas por él mismo en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por sus clientes a diario.
Actualmente, el señor Cesar S. atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de que le sea otorgado un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra ya que su casa requiere de un mejoramiento para así brindarle a sus tres hijos en edad escolar las condiciones necesarias de vida para que estos se desarrollen y lleguen a tener un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar makes a great effort to make metal products on his lathe in his home in the town of Somotillo in the department of Chinandega. His customers visit him there daily. Cesar needs to improve the conditions in his home, so he has approached Ceprodel, hoping that he would be able to obtain a loan so that he can buy building materials so that he can improve his home and give his three school-aged children all that they need and so that they have a good roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Manuel tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad.  El adquirió la mototaxi con ahorros obtenidos fruto de las ganacias de cada dia,tiene más de 5 años dedicados a esta actividad del transporte. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio que brinda, ya que a diario vive distintas experiencias. Manuel y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia ya que el terremoto les destruyo su vivienda, ahora están comenzando nuevamente y gracias al apoyo de su suegra están avanzando, Manuel por ese motivo es que se encuentra viviendo en casa de la madre de su esposa, Manuel destina todos los ingresos para la educación de su hijo, el cual se encuentra en edad escolar. Manuel sueña  ver su casa construida y también que su menor hijo pueda estudiar y así poder brindarle seguridad y bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old and has been married for the past seven years. He has a six year old son. He got the “mototaxi” (a motorized taxi cycle) with the money he earned daily. He has been transporting people for the past five years. He has a lot of experience and gathers more each day. Manuel and his life’s partner dream of having their own home, after the earthquake destroyed their old home. Now they are starting over and making progress, thanks to his mother-in-law’s help. Manuel is currently living at his wife’s mother’s home. Manuel uses his earnings toward his son’s education. Manuel dreams of seeing his home built, being able to provide for his young son’s security and well-being, and seeing that he is able to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Elda R. se ha dedicado a laborar arduamente en un instituto de estudios obteniendo los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación la cual está compusta por sus tres pequeños hijos en edades escolares.
Con mucho ahínco, ella ha decidido iniciar a reconstruir su vivienda y para ello ha decidido mejorar por completo las condiciones de su vivienda porque está comprometida con sus hijos en brindarles un techo digno donde vivir. Es por esta razón que ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta forma dar lugar a la continuación de la reconstrucción de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Elda R. has worked very diligently at a study institute in the city of Somotillo, Chinandega department, in order to bring daily sustenance to her household, which is made up of her three, small, school-age children. With much dedication she has decided to start to rebuild her house, completely improving its conditions, because she is committed to providing her children with a decent place to live. She is requesting funding to buy building materials in order to continue with her home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Willian tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres. Willian se encuentra realizando practicas en la Universidad San Luís Gonzaga de Ica. El inició su negocio hace 3 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, Willian con los ingresos que tiene en su bodega se ha costeado sus estudios en dicha universidad. El le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo como practicante y a los clientes que concurren a su negocio les brinda una buena atención tanto el como su mama y hermana que le ayudan en la atención del negocio, ahorra al máximo el dinero que obtiene de las ventas de su bodega el cual lo vuelve a invertir. El sueño a futuro de Willian es llegar a superarse como profesional y así poder ayudar a que su hermana menor pueda estudia una profesión, y ayudar a su madre. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería, las cuales venderá en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Willian, 22, is single and lives with his parents. He is enrolled in workshops at the San Luís Gonzaga University in Ica. He began his business 3 years ago with a small capital investment that came from his savings. Little by little his business has grown. Willian has paid for his courses at the university with profits from his store. He puts a lot of effort into his work and he, along with his mother and sister, who help him at work, gives very good service to his customers. He saves the most he's able and he reinvests it into his store. Willian's dream for the future is to excel as a professional in order to help his youngest sister study a profession and to help his mother. He requests funding to buy stock items to sell during the Chistmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Fatima R. ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que por muchos años había estado en malas condiciones a raíz de los fenómenos naturales. Es por este motivo que ella ha decidido muy firmemente reconstruir su vivienda porque así le será de mucho provecho a ella y a sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella y están estudiando.
Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque logrará su meta de tener una casa que preste las condiciones para vivir y por esta razón se apoya en Ceprodel solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así continuar mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
At the town of Somotillo in Chinandega, Nicaragua, Mrs. Fatima R. is working to improve the conditions of her house, which has been in deterioration for many years due to natural phenomena. For this reason she has decided to rebuild her house, so she and her children (who are her dependents and go to school) can live with more comfort. She feels very glad for having the chance to have a better house and is asking for a $300 loan in order to buy construction supplies and rebuild it.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Natividad tiene 56 años, es viuda, vive con sus hijos en su vivienda. Ella inicio el negocio de venta de comida hace aproximadamente 3 años, así mismo acaba de iniciarse en la venta de golosinas. Natividad atiende su negocio de manera muy acogedora por este motivo es que los clientes que en la mayoría son estudiantes universitarios  los que concurren a su negocio. Natividad requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería y así poder implementar un poco más su negocio, y así poder reconstruir su vivienda ya que se vio afectada por el terremoto.
texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old, a widow, and lives with her children in her own home. She began a business selling food approximately 3 years ago. And, now, she has begun to sell sweets. Natividad attends her business in a very welcoming way. For this reason, her customers, who are in the majority university students, come to her business. Natividad needs a loan to buy merchandise and, thus, be able to expand her business. And then she can rebuild her house, which was damaged by the earthquake.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Como todo padre responsable, el señor Henry R. ha llevado el bienestar a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos que dependen de él. Es importante señalar que a diario trabaja con el fin de velar por el bien de su familia y ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda llevando a cabo una reconstrucción para que sus hijos tengan un mejor lugar donde vivir.
Para continuar con esta obra, el señora Henry requiere el capital económico y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda para que tanto su cónyuge como sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con esta obra.
texts.en:
Like any responsible father, Henry R. has provided for the well-being of his family, composed of his wife and two dependent children. It is important to point out that he works every day with the goal in mind to watch over his family and he has begun to improve their home with a reconstruction project designed to give his children a better place to live. To continue with the project, Henry needs capital. He has called upon Ceprodel to request a timely loan to buy building materials to improve the condition of his home so that his wife and children will feel satisfied with the work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es:
Con mucha dedicación, el señor José Ramón T.  se dedica a trabajar como conductor en una empresa del municipio de Somotillo donde él vive y tiene a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en edades escolares.
Como todo padre responsable, ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda porque esto ha sido muy necesario por la razón que su vivienda ha tenido dificultades por lo que es de necesidad la reconstrucción. 
Con esta finalidad es que solicitó el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción y que su cónyuge e hijos se sientan satisfechos de tener un padre que se preocupa por ellos y que les brinda un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
. José Ramón T. is a driver for one of Somotillo's municipal departments. He lives in Somotillo with his wife and two school-age children. Like any responsible father, he has begun to improve his home because his house has needed repairs for some time. With this end in mind, he has requested funding to buy building materials so that his wife and children will feel happy to have a father who worries about them and provides a worthy home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Emapalado Ari de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, la Sra. Rogelia M.  participaba en  un grupo de mujeres como comision vecinal, las mismas se acercarón a la Fundación Paraguaya ya que se enterarón que otorgaba pequeños préstamos para mujeres, así con mucho entusiasmo decidierón participar del programa  son 20 (veinte) mujeres trabajadoras que quieren seguir progresando.
 El préstamo lo  invertirán en sus trabajos diarios que les sera de gran ayuda; ellas poseen  trabajos propios  como vendedoras de ropas,venta de zapatos, bijouteris, frutas y verduras, etc. y las mismas recibirán  un monto de 800.000, otras 500.000 y otras 300.000 gs. Para la compra de azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosinas, vaqueros, remeras, polleras, camisas, lenceria, queso, gallinas las mismas desean un progreso personal y de toda su  familia.
Cada una se dedica a una actividad diferente asi la señora es vendedora de verduras, ella tine 6 hijos y su marido no posee empleo fijo y se dedica a realizar trabajos por jornales de modo a que no poseen un ingreso fijo. 
La señora vende sus productos en las despensas del barrio y desea mantener su clientela y para ello debe ofrecer buenos productos.
