Las demas integrantes se dedican a:
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the city of Caaguazú’s Emapalado Ari neighborhood. Rogelia M. participated in a women’s neighborhood association. They called upon Fundación Paraguaya when they learned that it gave small loans to women. With much enthusiasm they decided to participate in the program. They are 20, hard-working women that want to continue to make progress. They will use the funds in their different lines of work; it will be of great utility to them. Each has her own commercial activity, such as: the sale of clothing, shoes, jewelry, fruits and vegetables, etc. They will receive a total of 800.000; some 500.000 and others, 300.000 gs to buy sugar, meat, flour, eggs, pasta, sweets, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, lingerie, cheese, chickens. They all want to achieve both personal and family progress. Each member has her own type of work. Thus, Rogelia sells fruits. She has 6 children. Her husband is a day laborer without steady work so they don’t have a fixed income. She sells her products to neighborhood stores and she wants to keep her regular customers, therefore she must offer good products. The other members are involved thus: 1. Lorenza González de Franco, fruit and vegetable sales; 2. María Antonia E., Chipera (sells typical bread of the region); 3. Rogelia M., fruit and vegetable sales; 4. Claudia E. Galeano, clothing sales; 5. Lucinda M. de Farias, clothing sales; 6. Saturnina Nuñez de Galeano, fruit and vegetable sales; 7. Antonia C. de Barreto, clothing sales; 8. Máxima C., grocery store; 9. Justina Colmán, fruit and vegetable sales; 10. Maura Andresa Martínez, clothing sales; 11. Marizza Concepción R., fruit and vegetable sales; 12. Sonia Elizabeth O., clothing sales; 13. Cristina O. Beitez, sweets sales; 14. Circuncición F. de González, clothing sales; 15. Eugenia A. de Ayala, underwear sales; 16. Julia M., beauty shop; 17. Liduvina L., store; 18. Ignacia E., store; 19. Maria Marlene R., fruit and vegetable sales; 20. Elisa T., vegetable sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, lingerie, shirts, goods, flour, pasta, sweets, meat, fruit, vegetables, fabric, milk, chicken, shoes, plastic cutlery, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Julisa Marisell

texts.es:
La señora Julisa M. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que a diario atiende su pulpería ofreciendo los productos comestibles tales como huevos, leche, salsas de tomate, golosinas, avenas, entre otros. También vende productos varios como jabones, pastas de diente, cepillos de dientes, papel higienico, entre otros.
Ella es madre de un hijo al que debe de apoyarle brindándole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo intelectual. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de los materiales de los productos comestibles y los productos varios para continuar brindándolos en su pulpería y así obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Miss Julisa M. has stood out as being a very hardworking woman who tends to her small shop daily selling edible products such as eggs, milk, tomato sauce, candy, and oats, among others. She also sells various products such as soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and toilet paper, among others. She is the mother of one son whom she supports, providing him with necessary conditions for his intellectual development. The loan she is asking for is for the purchase of materials for her edible products and the other various products so that she can continue supplying them in her small shop and therefore obtain income for development.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for her shop

loans.name: Divina Misercordia Group

texts.es:
Divina Misericordia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Capiatá en fecha 23 de setiembre de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Julia B., quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas caseras y posee una despensa, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 

Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 23 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.


El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de 569.500 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa(arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.),venta de ropas ,venta de lencerías, venta de gallinas caseras, venta de carbón, venta de ropas artesanales, etc.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Divine Mercy calls itself an excellent group of women and was formed in the city of Capiatá on September 23, 2008. This happened thanks to the General Director Miss Julia B., who sells home-grown chickens and has a larder. She contacted an adviser in a weekly meeting in the area find out about the work of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.

The adviser of the program was able to bring together 23 women who are working very happily, already in their 4th loan cycle, both together and individually within the program. The average loan for each member is 569.500 Gs., which goes toward various activities such as: selling food, selling merchandise, selling merchandise for the pantry, (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy, bread, herbs, etc.), selling clothing, selling lingerie, selling home-grown chickens, selling charcoal, selling artisan clothing, etc.

All of the women do these activities to collect funds. They help each other mutually to accomplish the common goals of everyone within the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the pantry (rice, sugar, herbs, dairy, bread, sodas, etc.), purchase of ingredients for making food, purchase of merchandise, purchase of clothing, purchase of plastic products, purchase of lingerie, purchase of fruit, vegetables, and natural medicine, purchase of raw materials for making bread, purchase of thread for making artisan clothing, purchase of charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Marling Araceli

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, la dama Marling P. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de cyber café donde presta el servicio de alquiler de computadoras con acceso a internet atendiendo a diario desde la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Ella está comprometida con el mejoramiento de su negocuio y para ello quiere ampliar el local para brindar un mejor servicio. Es por esta razón que solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar los materiales de construcción para ampliar el cyber café y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que a diario le visitan y estos puedan estar satisfechos con la atención que se les brinda en el cybercafe.
texts.en:
In the municipal of Somotillo, Miss Marling P. tends to her own cyber café business where she rents out computers with access to the internet. She tends to her business daily from the morning until dusk. She is committed to improving her business and for this reason she wants to increase its size to offer a better service. It’s for this reason that she is asking for a loan with the purpose of buying construction materials to increase the size of the cyber café and therefore provide a better service to her customers who visit daily. Then they can be satisfied with the attention that is given to them in the cyber café.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to increase the size of her cyber cafe

loans.name: Jumash's Group

texts.ru:
Теишова Жумаш – лидер данной группы. Жумаш пятьдесят один год. Жумаш в разводе. Сыновья уже выросли и сами себе зарабатывают на жизнь. Это именно заслуга Жумаш в том, что они выросли, получив бесценные качества, как например трудолюбие, упорство и стойкость, которые так нужны в нашей жизни, чтобы не нуждаться ни в ком. Трудолюбие упорство Жумаш, сыновья увидели в её работе. Жумаш торгует женскими, мужскими и детскими вещами на рынке. На рынке большая конкуренция и в условиях кризиса отстоять рентабельность бизнеса не из лёгких задач даже для бывалых торговцев. Стойкость Жумаш проявила после развода. Жумаш даже начала работать упорнее. Старший сын работает на кирпичном заводе. Младший сын решил помогать ей в торговле. Жумаш смело обращается за кредитами. Она хорошо знает, что в бизнесе, только не боясь рисковать можно смело двигаться вперёд. Сейчас у неё в обороте пятьдесят тысяч сомов. Торговать Жумаш начала давно. Начала она с овощей. Удачная торговля заставила её призадуматься о том, чтобы переходить на другие виды товаров. Она перешла на одежду. Её первоначальный капитал составлял три тысячи сомов ($70). Сейчас её ежемесячный доход равен десяти тысяч сомов ($230). Она решила не терять времени на накопление собственных денег, а сразу обратиться за кредитом, чтобы вложить средства в товарооборот и тем самым сэкономить себе время. 

У Жумаш четыре партнёра по группе:

Жаныл двадцать девять лет. Муж Жаныл работает строителем. У них трое детей. Жаныл торгует мужской одеждой на базаре. Жаныл нужен кредит, чтобы закупить новый товар.

Бактыбубу сорок девять лет. Она держит коров и продаёт молоко. Также она торгует мелкими товарами возле дома. Её муж работает в МЧС. У них трое детей. Двое из них работают, а младший сын ходит в школу. Бактыбубу нужен кредит, чтобы закупить товар.

Замирбеку двадцать девять лет. Он уже отец троих детей. Замирбек работает в кирпичном заводе, а жена Замирбека находится дома и присматривает за скотом. Замирбеку нужен кредит для того, чтобы купить два ковра для дома, и кое какие вещи по мелочам. 

Насип пятьдесят семь лет. Муж Насип уже не работает, так как находится в пенсионном возрасте. Однако вместе с Насип они занялись разведением скота. Сейчас Насип нужен кредит, чтобы приобрести две коровы.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Jumash T. is the leader of this group. Jumash is fifty-one years old and divorced. Her sons are already grown and make their own living. The fact that they grew up with priceless qualities, such as hard work, persistence and strength, is a credit to Jumash. These qualities are absolutely necessary in our life in order not to rely on anyone else. Her sons saw Jumash’s hard work and persistence in her business. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing at a market. The competition is strong at the market, and, especially now given the conditions of the crisis, it is not an easy task even for seasoned retailers to maintain business sustainability. Jumash showed strength after her divorce. She started working even more persistently. Her oldest son works at a brick factory. Her youngest son decided to help her with the sales. Jumash bravely requests loans. She knows well that in business, one cannot advance without taking risks. Her business turnover is now fifty thousand som. Jumash started selling a long time ago. She started with vegetables. Then successful sales made her think hard about transitioning to other types of merchandise. She transitioned to clothing. Her first capital was three thousand som ($70). Now her monthly income is nine thousand som ($230). Jumash decided not to lose any time on saving her own money and requested a loan right away, in order to invest it into her goods turnover and save herself time.

Jumash has four partners in the group:

Janyl is twenty-nine years old. Her husband is a construction worker. They have three children. Janyl sells men’s clothing at a market. She needs a loan in order to acquire new merchandise.

Baktybubu is forty-nine years old. She keeps cows and sells milk. She also sells small merchandise near her house. Her husband works at “MJS”. They have three children. Two of them work, and the youngest goes to school. Baktybubu needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise.

Zamirbek is twenty-nine years old. He is already a father of three children. Zamirbek works at a brick factory, and his wife stays at home and takes care of livestock. Zamirbek needs a loan in order to purchase two rugs for home and some small items.

Nasip is fifty-seven years old. Her husband no longer works because he is retired. However, Nasip and her husband got involved in animal husbandry. Now Nasip needs a loan in order to purchase two cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothing variety in order to support customer demand

texts.es:
La señora Maura M. se dedica a trabajar arduamente en una organización en el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega con la finalidad de obtener los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y beneficiar a sus hijos.
Actualmente ella tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y es por esto que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción porque sus sueños son tener un techo digno donde vivir y donde sus hijos se puedan desarrollar. Espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así mejorará sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura M. dedicates herself to working hard in an organization, in the municipality of Somotillo, in the department of Chinandega, with the goal of earning an income for a means of support for her household and to benefit her children. Currently, she needs to improve her household and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials. Her dreams are to have a decent home and to live where her children can thrive. She really hopes that her loan will be granted and then she will be able to improve her circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul B., the leader of the group comes from Tokmok. Tokmok used to be the industrial capital of Kyrgyzstan in the Soviet period. However, after the collapse, all the factories closed and many people were left unemployed. In a short time, the once prospering city turned into a ‘ghost’ city. Mairamkul and her husband are among the few people who managed to provide themselves with work and a source of income. Mairamkul is forty seven years old. Her husband now works as a finisher at a construction site. They have a twenty-five year old son and a daughter. Their son is married and lives separately. Mairamkul did not want to stay at home as she felt a need to find herself some kind of occupation so that she would be able to help her husband support the family. Mairamkul found herself that occupation. Now she trades in apples at a local market. Her daughter helps her sell the apples. It was Mairamkul’s own idea to start selling apples. She invested seventy dollars in starting this business. Now Mairamkul makes $186 a month. Mairamkul’s earnings have allowed her to buy new furniture for the house. Mairamkul needs a loan to invest  in purchasing apples and increasing the turnover. 

Mairamkul’s partners are: 

Gulnas, 29, has two children. Her husband works as an operator of a school boiler. Gulnas and her husband also trade in cattle. Due to their small business they have been able to build a house. Gulnas needs a loan to invest in raising cattle. 

Nurkul, 44, has one four year old child. Her husband works in Kazakhstan as a loader. Nurkul trades in fruits at a local market. Nurkul decided to apply for this loan in order to invest money in purchasing apples. She hopes to increase the turnover.

Chynara, 41, is married, but does not have children. Her husband works at a construction site doing odd jobs. Chynara makes her living by selling apples at a local market. Chynara needs a loan to purchase more apples. 


Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase 300 kg of different apples for sale

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo M. se ha destacado como un alegre comerciante de frutas y verduras las que son ofrecidas en el municipio de Somotillo en su propio establecimiento donde oferta los productos a sus clientes que le visitan con el fin de comprar las frutas y las verduras.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las frutas y las verduras y de esta manera obtener los ingresos para llevarlos hasta su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia.
Espera que su crédito le sea entregado satisfactoriamente  para continuar con este trabajo y así  mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo M. stands out as a happy fruit and vegetable vendor. He sells his fruits and vegetables out of his own establishment in the municipality of Somotillo, where his clients visit him regularly to buy the products he offers.

He is currently requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables that will provide him with earnings to take home to support his family.

He hopes to be approved for this loan so he can continue in his current line of work and thus improve both his and his family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La Sra. gloria tiene como actividad la comercializacion de ajies, ella  viaja al Desaguadero para traer mercaderia, esta actividad la realiza con su Mamá, quien a la ves trae mercaderia de temporada.
Cuenta tambien en su casa con una pequeña tienda de barrio, en la cual vende distintos produtos de la canasta familiar,  ella vive en casa de su mamá la Sra Antonia a quien le ayuda en el mantenimiento de su hogar que esta compuesta por ella y sus tres hijas que son pequeñas, encontrandose actualmente separda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Senora Gloria earns a living selling chili peppers. She travels to Desaguadero to bring her merchandise, and this activity was begun by her mother, who at the time brought seasonal produce. She also has a small store in her neighborhood in which she sells different products for weekly shopping needs. She liveds en a house with her mother, Senora Antonia, who she helps by keeping house/ She shares the house also with her three little daughters, which she had to do when she separated from her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Togjan's Group

texts.en:
Togjan B. is the leader of this group. She comes from the city of Tokmok.  Togjan is forty years old. She and her husband have raised two sweet daughters. Both of them go to school. To provide for the family, Togjan’s husband works as a carpenter. Everyday he has to get up bit early, as he has to travel to neighboring village outside the city. Togjan stays at home to look after the household. Many years ago, Togjan used to work. She started saving money back then, as if she felt then, that some day she would need this money. She and her husband bought a cow. Since then Togjan has stayed at home. Besides, in those days, there were little available regarding job opportunities and children were too little. Togjan gets up quite early to milk the cows. Her customers are her neighbors. They buy milk from Togjan and Togjan manages to earn up to $70 a month. During these years Togjan and her husband have managed to buy a house and a calf. Togjan wants to try raising sheep. She needs a loan to purchase sheep for feeding and resale. After selling the sheep she is planning to buy wedding dresses for her daughters. 

Togjan’s partners: 

Kubanychbek, 44, is a farmer. His wife is a schoolteacher. They have three children. Kubanychbek needs a loan to buy a milk cow.

Galina, 46, is engaged in raising poultry. She has geese, hens and sells their eggs.
Galina’s husband is a builder. She has one son. Galina hopes to obtain this loan to purchase more poultry for breeding.

Tatina, 51, has one son. Her son is twenty. He works in a wool producing factory. For her living Tatina keeps a cow and sells milk. She makes seventy dollars a month. Tatina needs a loan to buy one more cow.

Bedimat, 57, works as a cook the dining room of a high school. Bedimat has two children. They are grown ups and live separately. She has applied for this loan to invest the money in purchasing sheep. 



Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep for feeding and resale

texts.es:
Venta de medias, peluches, pantalones, alimento seco, refrescos, chamarras, ropa de bebe y comida, son las actividades económicas a las cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Nueva Siembra que se reúnen en el Centro Focal Santiago II. Dirigidas por su mesa directiva elaboran su reglamento interno.
Leonor M. es integrante de este grupo y vende ropa de bebe en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, Gregorio C. es comerciante de chamarras y viaja a Villazon y Potosí.
Todas necesitan del préstamo para mejorar e invertir en sus negocios, específicamente en esta época del año donde la demanda se incrementa.
texts.en:
The Nueva Siembra (New Planting) group meets at the Santiago II Focal Center. They are drawing up their by-laws, guided by their governing board. Their commercial activities include: sale of hosiery, stuffed toys, pants, dried food, beverages, jackets, baby clothing and food. Leonor M. is a group member and sells infant wear at the 16 de julio market in El Alto. Greogrio C. sells jackets and travels to Villazon and Potosí. All need funding to invest in and improve their businesses, specifically during this season of the year when demand increases.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
PRIMICIA es un grupo de 9 integrantes que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo ya que todas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de ropa de bebe, cosméticos, costura de ropa y venta de juguetes. Sobre todo en esta época del año necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios ya que la demanda ha subido. Además ellas desean participar de los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, como es la capacitación y la tención en el consultorio, llevando a sus hijos para el control de peso, talla,  fluorización y otros.
Ellas se reúnen en el Centro Focal Santiago II.
texts.en:
PRIMICIA is a group of 9 members that came together recently to request funding. Each has her own line of work, such as: baby clothing sales, cosmetics, seamstress, toy sales. Especially at this time of the year, funding is needed to invest in their businesses since demand has increased. Besides, they want to participate in the other services that Pro Mujer offers, like the training and the health services, taking their children in for weight and height monitoring, fluoridation, etc. They gather at the Santiago II Focal Center.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El cliente tiene la actividad de guia de turistas actividad que desarrolla  realizando viajes a distintos lugares  de nuestro departamento como el lago titicaca que se caracteriza por ser el lago mas alto del mundo y por tener mucha historia,Las ruinas de la cultura Tiahuanacota, El Nevado del Illimani, etc ya que nuestro Pais tiene distintos lugares turisticos.

El Sr. Julio vive en casa de sus padres es por esta razon que parte del credito sera para ayudar a su mamá en el equipamiento de su peluqueria, el  nucleo familiar esta compuesta por el y sus tres hijos 						
							
Para tener mayor informacion sobre el Lago TITICACA visita la siguiente pagina http://www.caminandosinrumbo.com/bolivia/titicaca/index.htm						
						
Para tener mayor informacion sobre la cultura tiahuanacotas visita la siguiente pagina:  http://www.gabrielbernat.es/peru/preinca/cultpreincaicas/dregionales/TIAHUANACO/tiahuanaco.html						
						
Para tener mayor informacion sobre el nevado del illimani visita la siguiente pagina: http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illimani
texts.en:
The client is a Tourist Guide who creates trips to various places in our state like Lake Titicaca, which is the highest lake in the world and has a lot of history, the ruins of the Tiahuanacota culture, Illimani mountain, etc. as our country has many tourist destinations. Julio lives in his parent’s home and part of the loan will be used to help his mom equip her hair salon. His family consists of himself and his three children. For more information about Lake Titicaca visit the following page: http://www.caminandosinrumbo.com/bolivia/titicaca/index.htm For more information about the Tiahuanacotas culture visit the following page: http://www.gabrielbernat.es/peru/preinca/cultpreincaicas/dregionales/TIAHUANACO/tiahuanaco.html For more information about Illimani mountain visit the following page: http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Illimani

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy camping equipment for tourism business

texts.es:
“Khantati” es un grupo de 8 señoras que pertenecen al Centro Focal Collpani, así, Victoria Q. es la Presidenta, como Tesorera está Roxana A. y como Secretaria de Actas es  Mercedes Y., las tres organizan a sus compañeras para llevar adelante su reunión, guiados por un orden del día.
Todas tienen diferentes negocios de comercialización, es decir, compara y venta de productos, producción y servicio y necesitan el crédito para invertir en sus negocios y generar ingresos para sus familias, además a ellas les gusta el consultorio porque tienen la oportunidad de cuidar su salud y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Khantati is a group of eight women who belong to the Collpani Community Center. Victoria Q. is the president, Roxana A. is the treasurer, and Mercedes Y. is the secretary. The three of them organize their colleagues in order to move the meeting along and guide them through the agenda of the day. All of them have different businesses. That is to say, they buy and sell products, produce goods, and provide services. They need the loan to invest in their businesses to generate income for their families. Also, they like the clinic because they have the opportunity to take care of their health and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela tiene como actividad la venta de pollos broaster en su tienda que esta ubicada en la av. america de la zona de Villa Fatima, ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, Vive con su esposo quien trabaja como chofer asalariado de minibus, es una pareja joven solo tiene una hija de tres años, el destino de el credito es para comprar una maquina para pollos al spiedo ya que piensa en ampliar su snack.
texts.en:
Daniela has a business selling roasted chickens in her store, which is located on America Avenue in the Villa Fatima area. She helps her husband with the household expenses. She lives with her husband, who works as a salaried driver of a minibus. They are a young couple. They only have a three year old daughter. The loan is to buy a rotisserie because she plans to expand her snack bar.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, muy alegremente la señora Carla G. se dedica a elaborar alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes siendo este el negocio que le genera ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Antes de trabajar en la elaboración de los alimentos, ella se dedicaba solamente como ama de casa pero ahora combina las dos actividades ya que su meta es beneficiar a su hijo en edad escolar y por ende debe trabajar para alcanzar esto.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la materia prima como los plátanos, la carne, el arroz, los frijoles, el queso, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Carla G. happily prepares food for her clients in the department of Masaya. This food preparation business generates enough income for her to support her family.

Prior to working in the food preparation industry she was merely a housewife, but now she can combine both of those activities since her goal is to provide for her school-age child. Therefore, she is working towards this end.

She is requesting this loan to buy raw ingredients such as plantains, meat, rice, beans, cheese, among others. She hopes this loan will be approved for the benefit of her son and family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make prepared foods

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad, la joven Danelia M. ha sido emprendedora porque ha desarrollado su negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el departamento de Masaya donde ofrece ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y a la vez ofrece productos varios como aretes, pulseras, perfumes y pinturas de uñas.

El crédito que actualmente está solicitando lo utilizará para la compra de los productos como lo es la ropa variada con el propósito de ofrecerla y de esta manera generar los ingresos para el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.

Espera continuar desarrollándose en este negocio y llegar a ser una gran comerciante y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Danelia M., 25, despite her young age, has developed into an entrepreneur with her clothing sales business located in Masaya department. She offers women's, men's, and children's clothing as well as earrings, bracelets, perfumes, and nail polish. The current financing she is requesting will be used to buy stock items in order to generate income to improve her quality of life. She hopes to continue to develop in this business and to become a big merchant meeting her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora Guadalupe L. se ha dedicado desde hace 21 largos años a su negocio de venta de frutas tales como manzanas y uvas siendo comercializados en su propio establecimiento donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sus ventas del negocio.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella es soltera y no tiene hijos pero debe de cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Es por este motivo que ella solicita el crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de comprar las manzanas para venderlas en su establecimiento ya que en la temporada de Navidad, estas frutas son vendidas más rápidamente y por esto debe de tener suficientes productos.
texts.en:
Guadalup L. has been working at her business for 21 long years in the Masaya department. She sells fruit like apples and grapes in her own establishment. She starts her business sales very early in the morning everyday. It is very important to point out that she is single and has no children. But, she needs to cover the household expenses. That is why she is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy apples. She will sell them in her establishment because these fruits are sold very rapidly during the Christmas season. Therefore, she needs to have sufficient products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora Melania M. en el departamento de Masaya siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de comida y en esta ocasión en el mes de Diciembre se está dedicando legalmente aprobada por las autoridades a la venta de pólvora vendida exclusivamente a personas adultas y con mucha responsabilidad ya que en este mes muchas personas celebran la Navidad y el fin de Año y para esto muchos hacen uso de la pólvora entre las que se encuentran candelas de colores, volcanes, luces de colores, entre otros.

El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de la pólvora para surtir su establecimiento y así obtener los ingresos para llevarlos a su hogar ya que ella es viuda y tiene un hijo a su cargo al que debe de brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Melania M. has always sold food in the Masaya department. On this occasion in the month of December, she has been legally approved by the authorities to sell fireworks. She sells them exclusively to very responsible adults. Many people celebrate Christmas and New Year’s this month. Many use fireworks such as colored candles, volcanoes, and colored lights, among others. The loan she is asking for is to buy fireworks to stock her establishment. This way she will get earnings to take to her household. She is a widow, and she is raising one child. She needs to provide him with the necessary conditions for his development.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la dama Fabiola H. trabaja a diario con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación donde tiene el deber de mantener a sus dos hijos en edades escolares supliendo sus gastos de estudio y brindándoles buenas condiciones de vida.
El crédito lo está solicitando porque necesita invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción porque le urge reconstruir su casa de habitación que ha estado en malas condiciones pero confía que con el crédito otorgado logrará continuar mejorando sus condiciones ya que comprará los materiales de construcción y también comprará una puerta para continuar con la reconstrucción.
texts.en:
Fabiola H. works everyday in the San Rafael del Sur municipality in Managua. She works in order to bring home the daily bread. She needs to support her two school age children. She needs to pay their educational expenses and provide them with good living conditions. She is asking for a loan because she needs to buy construction material. She urgently needs to rebuild her house, which is in bad condition. She is confident that with the loan she will be able to continue improving the house’s condition. She will buy construction materials, and she will also buy a door to continue with the reconstruction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material and a door

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen M.’s previous loan recently ended. She was so thankful for the lenders that through KIVA she was able to obtain the loan she was requesting. Because of that loan, she was able to help her niece and her niece’s child which she considers her family to have their own source of income. Aside from them, Carmen also considers her co members in ASHI as her extended family. Despite of the time she is required to attend the weekly center meeting, she enjoys exchanging ideas about running a business with them. Now, she wants to request another loan she will be using to finance the fishing business of her niece’s 18-year-old son who preferred not to go to school anymore and earn money instead. She wishes to use it in purchasing another fishing boat to be managed by her relative and some will be used to finance her hog fattening business. Carmen and her 53-year-old niece, Susan shares the responsibility of selling fish directly to people around the community and at times of good catch, they sell in other neighboring municipalities. When fish is off season, Carmen retails vinegar in addition to her previous business which is selling of soft drinks, and raises hogs in their backyard as an alternative source of income. Hogs she will fatten will either be slaughtered and will be directly sold to people in their village per kilo or will be sold as a whole to a meat vendor. Through her business Carmen hopes to have savings in preparation for her needs as she grows older.

loans.use: To purchase another fishing boat and to finance her hog fattening business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda T. is a 48-year-old single parent of three children whose ages range from ten to 22 years old. After having her own children to raise, Erlinda believes that dreaming is not just kids but for someone like her also. After her husband left her and her children, that striving to achieve that dream became so intense. For all her life as a mother, she didn’t want anything more to happen but for her children to experience life not being poor and for their future to be secured financially. Without her husband, her eldest 22-year-old son took the responsibility of helping her earn money being a laborer. Her son is also helping her in raising her two remaining children whose age range is from ten to 13 years old. Despite the many sacrifices and trials Erlinda has been through in her life, she found strength within herself and a vision to achieve. In order to take a step in reaching her goal she joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), KIVA field partner in the Philippines to be able to have an access to loan which she will going to use in starting a food and soft drinks selling business. Foods such as hotdogs and other frozen goods as well as soft drinks will be sold in her own house. With this kind of business, she can earn while staying at home and attending to her two children. Once she can make this business successful and will fully pay her loan, she wished to request for a bigger amount to enhance further her business.

loans.use: To finance her food selling business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: A 57-year-old Lourdes T. is a quiet type of person yet a very responsible wife, mother, and business woman. Despite her many insecurities brought about by poverty, she remained strong and determined in changing her family’s way of living. Even though she failed to achieve her dream of graduating her two eldest children from college, she doesn’t see it as a reason not to dream anymore. As a matter of fact, she joined ASHI just recently requesting for a loan wanting to start up a “sari-sari” (variety store) business which will be managed by her to support her youngest the education in college of daughter whose age is 20 years.  The said store will be located in her own house and her customers will be people around their small village. Her husband who is a farmer understood where Lourdes’s aspiration of having her own business came from. Being a farm laborer, income is sporadic and very small. Therefore, he is giving all his support to Lourdes and like Lourdes, he wishes that the business will become successful.

loans.use: To finance starting starting a "sari-sari" (variety) store business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is a resident of the municipality of Laua-an in the province of Antique. 

At times, she is a reserved type of person, but most of the time she loves talking to people in her community, especially to her colleagues in ASHI. She feels that, through ASHI, she has found friends and someone to confide in when problems beset her. Through her membership, she realized that many mothers have the same problem as hers: poverty. From them, she gained strength and she is determined to work hard to improve her standard of living. She wants her four children, ages 7 to 19 years old, to finish their studies until college. 

With the support of her husband, Mercy took the risk of requesting a loan through ASHI to expand her small dressmaking business and to start a duck-raising business. By raising ducks in their backyard, she will put the wide space surrounded their rice field to its best use, and augment the income she earns from her dressmaking business.

As a woman, having her own business and source of income is more important than depending on her husband’s income.

loans.use: To buy materials for her dressmaking business and to buy ducklings for a new duck-raising business.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa M., age 68, is a loving mother to her two children. Even though her children are now 33 and 25 years old, she still wants to support them financially, because they are day-laborers (not salaried) and their small income is sporadic. Ninfa wishes that, some day, her children’s lives will be stable and they will have their own families. 

When Ninfa learned about ASHI, a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, she thought that it would be a good source of capital to start her own business and  to achieve her dreams for herself and children. After she was recognized as a member of ASHI, she requested a loan and started a small “sari-sari" (variety) store. However, when she finished repaying her loan, she changed her business to rice farming. Since it was the season for planting rice, she though it would be best to invest her money there, because the profit is as much larger than the profit from her sari-sari store. Her eldest son is her partner in managing her rice farm. 

However, Ninfa wanted to restart her sari-sari store to bring the convenience of a small grocery store to people in her village. Her village is very far from the main town and is almost inaccessible, because it lacks transportation and other public facilities. Ninfa is now requesting a loan to restart her sari-sari store. She hopes that her sari-sari business will succeed.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
Novel Morillo, age 50, is an industrious woman and a responsible mother. Her five children range in age from eight to 24 years old. Her husband is a laborer and an alcoholic. The money he gives to Novel from his small income is not enough for a family budget because he spends some of his money on alcohol and friends. 

Because of the hardship and her husband’s irresponsibility, Novel has been searching for ways to augment her husband's income. Just recently, she learned about ASHI, a KIVA field partner in the Philippines, and joined. Since then, she has felt hopeful that, some day, she will achieve her dream of sending her remaining four younger children to college until they graduate. 

Novel will use her loan to start a hog-raising business. Her profits double as capital after the hogs are sold. She will earn income either by slaughtering the hogs, or by raising the animals for four months, and then selling them alive to people in her village.

By having her own business to provide food and other basic needs for her family, Novel hopes that her husband will realize that poverty is not a reason to surrender. Through ASHI’s partnership with Kiva, people around world are willing help to them to change their lives.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her hog-raising business

texts.en:
Redem L., age 46, is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur.  He works from early morning until sunset to insure that the farm is free from weeds and birds. Currently, he tills a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm, which he hopes will provide him income to buy food, clothing and other basic needs. 

He would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, he will be able to grow his harvest and increase his income.

Rosemarie E. is 23 years old. She owns a small rice field in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She needs additional capital to run her rice farm, especially when farm supplies are expensive.  Her family relies on the income she makes from the farm. She uses the harvest to feed her family and sells the remaining rice to rice traders for additional income for her family.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and better support her family.

Armeda M. is a 38-year-old CEVI client from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is tills a small rice field that she inherited from her parents. She also has two children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is only two years old. She started her business in 2000. Until now, she has maintained her crop to provide her family with adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She would like to borrow Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and her income.

Gloria E. has five children. Her eldest child is 14 years old and is currently studying in high school.  She has a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. She maintains a small rice field to to support her family and help them pay for their daily needs. Before the loan, she worried about where she would find money to fund her business. 

She is applying a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay the laborers who helped till the farm and to buy farm supplies.

Welfredo M., age 28, has two children. His eldest child is five years old. He is working very hard to be the best father to his children. He is a farmer and manages a small rice field in their village. He started to till in 2008. The income he makes from the farm has helped them to support the daily needs of his family.

He would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his harvest and increase his income.

Emma C. is a 49-year-old is a rice farmer from Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has three children, the eldest of whom is only seven years old.  She started her business when she married her husband. Until now, she has been tilling her farm, hoping that she will be able to have an abundant harvest. When she started farming, she said that it was really difficult, especially because the farm needed capital to grow rice. She was happy that she joined CEVI and was able to get access to small loans.

Now she would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her crops.

Remelyn P., age 29, owns and manages a small rice farm in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has three children. Her eldest child is 9 years old and is currently studying in elementary school. She wants to expand her business so that she will have enough income to pay for all of her family's needs.

She is hoping for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

Carmelyn L., age 27, grows rice and sells her harvest to earn additional income for her family. She has two children, ages 7 and 2. She uses the proceeds from her harvest to buy food and necessities for her famly. The farm is very important to her, especially because it is the only source of income for her family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy the farm supplies that she needs to grow her rice well. The loan will help, not just to improve her harvest, but to increase her family income as well.

Victoria A., age 31, manages a small rice field in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has two children, the eldest of whom is only one year old. To continue to work on the farm, she really needs additional capital. Farming is not easy; you need hard work and money to achieve your desired harvest. 

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest. When her business is well established, she dreams of buying more land to help her relatives.

Releiza Joy M., age 27, lives in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has a farm where she grows rice. She works from morning until sunset to ensure that she will have a very abundant harvest. She wants to earn more income to help her family buy food, clothing, and other basic needs. Releiza Joy has three children, the eldest of whom is only 9 years old.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to double the size of her harvest.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S., age 58, is a farmer from South Cotabato. She tills a 2-hectare (~ 5-acre) rice field to feed her family. She is married to Loreto and has 6 children. She lacks capital to buy necessary supplies for her farm, so she has sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to meet the needs of her business. 

Magdalena has requested a loan of 15,000 Php to buy fertilizer and farm supplies. With the low interest rate on this loan, it is advantageous for her to take the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is 23 years old and she owns a hog-raising business. She has 3 children, the eldest of whom is 4 years old. She wants her children to have a bright future, so she's working hard in her business to save for her children's future.

Rezyl has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. since June 2008. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for her business. She would like to buy more pigs and pig food.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C., age 52, has been raising hogs since 1984. She also manages a 3-hectare (~7.5-acre) rice field in South Cotabato. She is currently supporting 4 children in her family. 

Remedios has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to use as additional capital for her businesses. This loan is very helpful, since it has a low interest rate. The amount will be enough to buy additional pigs and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy pigs and farm supplies

texts.en: Rochelle raises hogs and grows rice. She is 40 years old and has 2 children. Her business is located in South Cotabato. Because she has limited capital, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000. This will be enough to purchase fertilizer and raise more pigs. She manages 1-3/4-hectare (~4.4-acre) rice field. She wants to improve her standard of living and provide for the needs of her family.

Being 53 years old, Cerina keeps herself strong to perform her farming duties. She is married and has six children.

Cerina said that she learned farming through her parents and started farming way back in 1987. She works hard at the farm to achieve an abundant harvest. She also wants to have better income so she could provide for her family’s growing needs.

Cerina is a member of CEVI and is grateful for the financial services she gained access to. She is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 which she will use to finance her farm. This loan will help Cerina ensure healthy crops and a good harvest.

Leah Linda V., 22  years old, is a farmer in Sta, Josefa Agusan Del Sur and mother of a one-year-old one child.  Her parents taught her everything she knows about planting rice and reaping a good quality harvest. Her farm is earning very well but she needs additional capitalization to grow her business.  A member of the loan program of Community Economic Ventures Inc., she is requesting a loan of Php 6,000.to buy farm inputs and supplies. Leah believes she will thereby be able to obtain greater harvests and income for the family.

Michelle T. is 25 years old. She has two children. Her eldest is only four years old. 

Michelle learned to farm from her parents. She has a farm and she makes sure that her crops are healthy and well taken cared of. She said that if she only had resources she would buy more farms to plant more rice. Now, she just focuses on what she has at present. 

Michelle would like to request a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her harvest and income as well.

Julie U. is a farmer in Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur.  She has one child who is only three years old. She and her husband work from morning until sunset to ensure that they will have an abundant rice harvest because they take seriously the growing of their crop. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In this way, she will be able to improve the size of her harvest and income as well.

Analiza A. is 27 years old. She has two children. Her eldest child is six years old and is studying in grade one next year.  She has a farm.  Her main crop is rice because people in their village are constantly buying rice for food. She wants her children to graduate from college so that when they are older, they will land a better job. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying farm supplies to grow her harvest and income.

Sheryl S. is 29 years old and works in a farm. She grows rice to be able to provide her family an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs. She has two children. Her eldest child is 6 years old now. She dreams to save money to pay for the tuition and books of her eldest who will study in grade one next year.

Now, she is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan is truly helpful in buying farm supplies to grow the harvest.

Gloria C. 40 years old. She owns and manages a small farm. She grows rice and vegetables to be able to adequately provide her family with food, clothing, and other basic needs. She has three children; the eldest is 15 years old.  The income she makes from the farm is very helpful in paying the daily cost in their home. Because of her farm, she is able to send her three children to school.

She needs additional capital in her business. She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to grow her harvest and help her family more in paying the daily expenses.

Dionisia P. 54 years old and is a rice farmer.  She owns a small rice field which she hopes will provide her family an adequate supply of food, clothing, and other basic needs. Her rice farm is doing well now.  She wishes that it will continue to yield an abundant harvest so that she will be able to continually support the needs of her family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The purpose of availing a loan is to buy farm supplies to grow her rice crop well.

Florenda T. is 44 years old and manages a small rice field in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur.  She has one child who is 26 years old who also helps her run her farm. She has been tilling the farm for 15 years now.  

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to ensure the quality growth of her crop. She hopes that with her loan she will obtain maximum harvest in her farm.

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en:
Bahadur H. is applying for his second loan from Kiva. Previously he made window grilles, but now he makes fire furnaces, which work with gas and wood. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for making the furnace and improving his business. 

"HAPPY CHRISTMAS!"

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for making furnaces

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is 33 years old. She's from Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. She has a farm, and rice is her main crop. She started tilling when she married a farmer.  Until now, she continually farms because it is her only source of livelihood. She has one child who is 8 years old.

She is applying for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In this way, she will be sure that her plants are taken care of well. She also hopes that the loan will bring her a better harvest and more income.

Pricilla T. is from the village of Mohon. She is 58 years old. Pricilla is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Pricilla owns & operates a hog raising business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale in the local community. Pricilla has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Pricilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pricilla is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pricilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Lucille T. is from the village of Butuay. She is 40 years old. Lucille is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lucille owns & operates a health & medical business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Lucille has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lucille joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucille has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lucille is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for their house renovation. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lucille from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the village of Clarin Settlement. She is 31 years old. Irene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a "sari-sari" store/general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Irene is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn G. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 40 years old. Arlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a business buying and selling coconuts. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconuts in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Arlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. is from the village of Butuay. She is 58 years old. Helen is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell & for house renovation. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell & for house renovation

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
With skills in watch and cellular phone repair is our featured entrepreneur. He is Mr. Jerry D., 33 years of age, single, and a resident of P5 Maquilao, Tangub City. He has one minor dependent.

Jerry started his watch and cellphone repair business six years ago during the time he was in Manila City and for two years he has established his own repair shop in this city. He is earning an average net income of 11,000 PHP a month at this time and is also receiving a daily income of 150 PHP from his for-hire motor-cab.

Jerry joined Paglaum MPC just this year because he is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award, 2006.

As a new member under the regular loan program, Jerry is given the privilege of obtaining 50,000 PHP to add to his capital for purchasing cellphone and watch accessories and spare parts. He is also adding to his cellphone repair equipment.

Jerry’s future plan is to establish another repair outlet. He is also planning to settle down for marriage next year.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for purchasing cellphone accessories and watch spare parts

texts.en:
"Hi, dear lenders, with your help I plan to improve my auto repair business. I have increased the number of my clients."

As you can see from the picture Damet has not changed his business. As you know, before he repaired cars and still today he continues this business. Damet M. is applying to Kiva for his second loan. His business is auto repairs. The number of his clients has increased, and now he needs additional spare parts; that is why he applies for a loan of 2000 AZN.

Asya S. was born in 1964. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region.  Now, she has settled in the Fuzuli region, Qayidish settlement.  Asya is married and has 2 children. She has a cattle breeding business. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves for improving her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
K. Halima is 26-year old woman, married with two children. The diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Halima. After trying her luck at a variety of occupations, she decided to work in the area of livestock. She started this business 5 years ago with the support of her husband. Now that Halima has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge regarding this activity. She would like to expand her activity by purchasing more cattle so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life. Halima is requesting a loan of $1500 US Dollars. She appeals to your good hearts in her request to make her dream a reality.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle for breeding and selling

loans.name: Dodaroy

texts.en:
M. Dodaroy is 51 years old. Together with her husband, who is the entrepreneur, Dodaroy raised four children. She is running a drug store already for 13 years. She is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town which allows her to have many clients and customers. Dodaroy is the client of IMON for more than two years. Now she requests 5000 Somoni. Being a very accurate person by her nature, Dodaroy is sure and would like to ensure the lenders that she is will repay the loan without any violations. This amount would help her accomplish their goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing medicaments for expanding the business

loans.name: Todjiddin

texts.en:
M. Todjiddin is 25 years old. He is married but has no children yet. He has been running his own business for 4 years. He sells perfume for women and men, air fresheners, tooth pastes and brushes. Todjiddin is the client of IMON since June 2007 and has neither violations nor delinquencies in payment of the loans. Today Todjiddin requests 12200 Somoni as he is planning to expand his business and increase his capital, and after receiving this large income, he would like to thank all those supporting him, and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is 34 years old, married and has one child. The family has had difficult moments because her husband didn't earn enough and in order to obtain the necessary resources to support her family, Nasiba decided to start her own business selling clothes. She started her business 8 years ago. She started her business with a small investment in merchandise. However, due to high competition, she has been acquiring greater amounts of clothing which has helped increase her earnings, albeit very slowly. Fortunately, sales and orders from clients have increased. In order to meet the demand for her products, Nasiba needs a loan in the amount of $1200 USD. You can improve the conditions of this family's life. They are grateful for your generosity and support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Winter clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling

texts.en:
Shodiyaoi is a widow and the loving grandmother of two grandchildren. Shodiyaoi owns a successful clothing sales business at the market in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about ten years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Shodiyaoi tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. Shodiyaoi has requested a loan of $1,200 USD to increase her product inventory. By purchasing additional inventory, Shodiyaoi will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
