texts.es:
Carlos es una persona muy tranquila y responsable, tiene 45 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, junto a su esposa Carmen de 45 años, a quien desea dar una mejor vida.
Su puesto de venta de bicicletas está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Con muchos ánimos de progresar en la vida comienza sus días, ya que es muy optimista, él es un vendedor muy hábil y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle una bicicleta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio y ser su propio jefe, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, ya que esto lo cansa mucho. 
Para el futuro, espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender bicicletas totalmente nuevas, ya que actualmente se dedica a vender las bicicletas que arregla.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Carlos con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bicicletas para arreglarlas y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very calm and responsible person. He is 45 years old, and lives in the house inherited from his parents together with his wife Carmen, who is 45 years old, and to whom he wishes to give a better life. His bicycle sales store is located in the Explanada Laguna Temporal (marketplace in the city of Juliaca). Since he is an optimist, he begins his days with a lot of desire to progress in life. He is a very skilled salesman and always convinces his customers to buy a bicycle.

What he likes most about his work is the freedom that he has to deal with his own business and to be his own boss. He has been doing this work for six years and what he considers the most difficult is to have to remain all day under the harsh sun, since it makes him very tired. In the future, he hopes to be able to have a shop where he can sell completely new bicycles, since currently he is selling bicycles that he fixes.

This is Carlos's sixth loan with MFP, and he hopes to have the same punctuality that he had in the first two loans. He is a very responsible and supportive member of his community bank. With the 1500 soles requested, he will buy more bicycles to fix and increase the quantity that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es:
Consuela, de 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 3 hijas: Martha de 12, Maritza de 9 y Yudith de 5, a quienes desea dar un buen futuro.

Junto a su inseparable triciclo trabaja todas las mañanas desde muy temprano vendiendo deliciosas frutas por la calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que la fruta que vende es muy fresca y sabrosa.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así hacer más amena la venta, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol.
Para más adelante, desea juntar el dinero necesario para alquilar un pequeño puesto donde pueda vender sus frutas con mayor comodidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Consuela con MFP y se siente muy confiada de poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causar problemas en su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, ya que es la socia más joven y alegre. Con los mil seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fruta para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Consuela is 30 years old and is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She lives in one of her relatives along with her three daughters: Martha, age 12; Maritza age 9; and Yudith age 5; all of whom she wishes to give a good future. Along with her inseparable tricycle she works from the early morning hours selling delicious fruit on the Juliaca city streets. She has many customers as the fruit she sells is very fresh and flavorful. What she likes about her work is conversing with her customers and in this way increasing her sales. She has been selling fruit for 6 years and the most difficult thing about her work is having to walk all day beneath the inclement sun. This is Consuela’s fourth loan with MFP and she feels very confident in being able to pay her payments on time, as she doesn’t want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she very loved, as she is the youngest member and happy. With 1600 soles she seeks she will buy more fruit to better stock her cart.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit for her fruit cart

texts.es:
Feliciana, D. 46 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y cariñosa, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 hijos; Isabel D. 27 y Marleny D. 14 años.

Su negocio es la venta D. golosinas, su puesto es uno D. los más concurridos, ya que está bien surtido y las personas saben que ahí encontrara el dulce, chupete, galleta, refresco o chocolate, que están buscando. Esto ha hecho que su negocio sea muy rentable y que se dedique D. lleno a él.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas D. trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto D. venta sin descuidarlo. 
Con el tiempo, anhela alquilar una tienda en la misma zona, donD. pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo al que acceD. Feliciana con MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para que no tenga problemas a su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 46 years old, and is a very hardworking and loving mother. She lives in a rented house together with her two children: Isabel who is 27 and Marleny who is 14 years old. Her business is selling candies, and her place is one of the busiest, since it is well-stocked and the people know that they will find what they are looking for there: sweets, lollipops, cookies, sodas, and chocolate. This has maD. her business be very profitable and full.

What she likes most about her job is to converse with her neighboring saleswomen, since it makes their long work schedules more pleasant. She has been doing this job for four years and what she considers the most difficult is to have to remain all day in her sales location without leaving it. With time, she longs to rent a store in the same region, where she can offer better service to her customers.

This is the sixth loan that Feliciana has had access to with MFP. She knows that this money will help her improve her future, but also she has to bear in mind that she has to pay it on time so that she doesn't have problems with her community bank. With the 1000 soles requested, she will buy more candies in order to improve her salesplace.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Florencia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa como cuidante junto a sus 5 hijos: Antonia de 14, Karina de 12, Adolfo de 10, Samuel de 8 y Giomara de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ovejas. Todos los fines de semana Florencia viaja rumbo al pueblo de Acora (Distrito de la provincia de Puno) a comprar ovejas de sus proveedores, las cuales alimenta y cuida por unos meses, para luego llevarlas a vender a la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, ya que lo hace muy hábilmente, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar las ovejas, ya que es una tarea muy difícil y cansada, la cual le toma mucho tiempo. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio siga creciendo, ya que así poco a poco su vida ira mejorando.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Florencia con MFP, espera cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo y así no perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ovejas para aumentare la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
50 year old Florencia is a hard-working simple woman who lives in a home as a caretaker along with her 5 children: Antonia age 14, Karina age 12, Adolfo age 10, Samuel age 8, Giomara age 7; who are the focus of all her efforts. Florencia buys and sells sheep. Every weekend Florencia travels to the twon of Acora (in the district and province of Puno) to buy sheep from her suppliers, which she then feeds and takes care of for a few months, then taking them to sell in the Sunday market in Juliaca city. What she most likes about her job is selling, as she does it easily, having sold for 10 years now. She considers transporting the sheep the most difficult, as it is a difficult and tiring chore which takes a lot of time. In the future she hopes her business will continue to grow, in this way improving her life little by little. This is Florencia’s second loan with MFP; she hopes to be able to make her payments on time and not disappoint the members of her communal bank, where she is very respected because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 1500 soles she seeks she will buy more sheep to increase the quantity she normally sells.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Frida, de 40 años, es una madre muy amorosa y tierna con sus 4 hijos; Alex de 19, Yovana de 17, Claudia de 15 y Libertad de 3 años. Vive en su casa propia, con ellos, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para Frida el tejido artesanal es un pasa tiempo más que una actividad económica. Durante su vida trabajó en diversos oficios, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que los tejidos le daban los ingresos económicos que necesitaba. Fe así que decidió dedicarse a ello por entero, pues este negocio le es muy rentable debido a que la mayoría de sus clientes prefieren comprarle a ella por los novedosos modelos que tiene.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que al mismo tiempo que cuida su negocio puede realizar sus tareas domesticas, ahorrándole tiempo para hacer otras actividades, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para acabar los pedidos que le solicitan. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener su propio puesto donde pueda vender sus tejidos ella misma, ya que actualmente sólo distribuye a otros comerciantes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Frida con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Frida is 40 years old. She is a loving and tender-hearted mother who lives in her own home with her four children: Alex (age 19), Yovana (age 17), Claudia (age 15), and Libertad (age 3). What she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Frida passes the time making woven handicrafts as a means of earning an income. During her life she has worked in various trades, but eventually realized that weaving provided the income she needed. Frida decided to pursue this activity full-time since it is very profitable. The majority of her customers buy from her because she offers unique novelty items.

What she likes most about her work is that she can run her business and take care of her household chores at the same time. This frees up time for her to pursue other activities. Frida has been in this business for six years and believes the hardest part is getting up at dawn to finish the orders her customers have requested. She hopes to have her own store in the future where she can sell her handicrafts. At the moment, she sells her products to other traders.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She expects to make her payments on time so as to not cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. Frida is highly respected because she able to keep the group organized. With her loan of 2500 soles, she plans to buy more wool for making her hand woven articles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Hermelinda, de 20 años, es una joven madre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
En la mina La Rinconada tiene un pequeño puesto de tejidos artesanales, ella lleva hasta esta zona minera las prendas que ha tejido en el taller que tiene en su habitación, de igual manera también lleva prendas que compra a otras tejedoras, lo cual hace que su negocio tenga una mayor variedad de tejidos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la mina, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en la zona.
Con el tiempo, espera poder tener una tienda donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Hermelinda con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 20 years old. She is a young mother who lives at home with her parents and wants very much to succeed in life. In the mining town of La Rinconada, she has small vending post where she sells handmade fabrics. She also has a workshop in her home where she produces woven garments. Hermelinda spends as much time buying clothes made by other people as she does producing her own. Therefore, she is able to stock her business with a wider variety of items.

What she enjoys most about her work is being able to chat with her neighbors while making sales. This enables her to keep up with events that are happening around the mines. Hermelinda has been in this business for two years and she thinks the hardest part is dealing with the extremely cold weather in the area. Over time, she hopes to open a store where she can serve her customers with greater convenience.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Hermelinda has been very punctual with her previous loans and she is expected to do the same with this one. She is very active in her Communal Bank and admired by the rest of the members. With her loan of 500 soles, she will buy more wool for producing new handmade garments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Justina, de 38 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nicolás, de 29 años, y sus 3 hijos: Yesica de 18, Carmen de 16 y Michael de 8 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días, llegada las 9 de la mañana, Justina arma su puesto en las puertas del cementerio de su zona, donde diariamente vende flores. Ella tiene muchos clientes, sobre todo los días domingos, que es el día que más gente va al cementerio, ya que las flores que vende son muy bonitas y frescas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus hijos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer toda la mañana en las puertas del cementerio soportando el intenso sol. 
Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando muy duro, ya que sabe que de ella depende el futuro bienestar de sus hijos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Justina con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar un poco todos los días para lograrlo. Ella es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más flores para venderlas en estas fiestas de año nuevo.
texts.en:
Justina is 38 years old. She is a loving and hardworking mother who lives in her own home with her husband Nicolás, who is 29, and her three children: Yesica (age 18), Carmen (age 16), and Michael (age 8). Her children are the reason behind all of her efforts.

Every day at 9am, Justina begins stocking her vending post near the gates of the local cemetery where she sells flowers. She has many customers, especially on Sundays, which is the day most people visit the cemetery. The flowers she sells are always fresh and very beautiful. What she likes most about her job is that it gives her time to spend with her children. Justina has been in this business for four years and says the hardest part is spending all morning at the cemetery gates under the intense sun. She wants to keep working hard well into the future because she knows the welfare of her children depends on her.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Justina knows she has to make her payments on time, so she is willing to save a little bit every day in order to make that happen. She is the most cheerful member of her Communal Bank and is admired greatly by the rest of the group. With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy more flowers to sell for the New Year’s festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Mirian, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en una habitación alquilada y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.
La actividad que realiza diariamente es la venta de habas saladas, gracias a este negocio a podido darle a su familia el sustento económico que necesitan para vivir. Ella vende sus habas de manera ambulatoria por la calles de Juliaca, su producto es muy delicioso por eso es vendido rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir en que momentos trabajar y en que momentos dedicarse a sus otras actividades, lleva 5 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es caminar todo el día por las calles, puesto que el clima no siempre es el más favorable. 
Para más adelante anhela comprar una carretilla donde pueda vender sus habas saladas y otros productos más como maní, papas fritas, etc.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mirian con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos. En su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones que toman entre todas las socia. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus habas saladas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mirian, age 35, is a very sincere and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented room and works very hard to improve her quality of life. She sells salted beans every day. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for her family's daily needs. She sells the beans on foot in the streets of Juliaca. Her product is very delicious and sells quickly. What she likes best about the work is that she can decide when to work, allowing her to do other things as well. She has been doing this work for 5 years and thinks the most difficult part is walking all day in the streets, because the weather isn't always favorable. In the future, she wishes to buy a wheelbarrow so she can sell salted beans and other snacks like peanuts, french fries, etc. This is Mirian's first loan from MFP and she is eager to make her repayments on time without fail, so that she can continue to receive loans. She is very content in her community bank, because she always participates in the decisions the members make. With the 600 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare salted beans and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nady, de 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa como cuidante junto a su esposo Henry de 34 años, y sus dos hijos: James de 2 y Yady de 6 meses, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

La compra y venta de ovejas es la actividad a la que se dedica Nady. Todos los fines de semana viaja al pueblo de Acora (Distrito de la Provincia de Puno) a comprar sus animalitos, los cuales cuida y alimenta con mucho esmero, para luego llevarlos a vender a la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus ovejitas, ya que sabe que del buen cuidado que les brinde dependerá el pago que le den por ellas. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar las ovejas, ya que el viaje es muy cansado y tiene que estar pendiente de que no les pase nada. 
Para más adelante, espera incrementar el número de ovejas que vende normalmente, para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Nady con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar más ovejas, ya que para estas fiestas tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Nady is a simple, hardworking, 33-year-old woman who lives in a house as a caretaker, along with her 34-year-old husband, Henry, and her two children: James who is two and Yady who is six months old. Her greatest wish is to improve their quality of life. Nady's job is buying and selling sheep. Every weekend she travels to the small town of Acora (a district of Puno Province) to buy the young animals that she painstakingly cares for and feeds, so that she can then take them to the Sunday market in the town of Juliaca and sell them. The thing she enjoys most in this work is looking after the young sheep, as she knows that the money she is paid for them depends on her taking good care of them, She has been doing this work for two years and she finds the most difficult part is transporting the animals, as the journey is very tiring and she has to make sure they come to no harm. In the future, Nady hopes to sell more sheep on a regular basis in order to increase her income. This is the first loan that Nady has received from Kiva Field Partner, Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP), and she is prepared to make her repayments punctually, as she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank, in which she is an active participant. She will invest the requested 800 nuevos soles in buying more sheep, as the demand is high during the holiday period.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nieves, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más concurridas de su barrio, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que siempre es la primera en abrirse.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. 
Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su barrio.

Este el segundo préstamo de Nieves con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Nieves, aged 19, is a hardworking and cheerful young lady. She lives with her parents and wants to help them with their family expenses.

Her grocery store is one of the most frequented stores in her neighborhood. Her great charisma and kindness have made her the preferred storekeeper of her neighbors, who do not hesitate to shop already very early in the morning, as they know that Nieves is always the first to open her store. What she likes best about her work is to talk with her customers about things that happen in the neighborhood. She has been in this business for two years. According to her, the hardest part in her activity is to stay the whole day in her store, unless she could cope with lower sales. For the future she hopes that her business grows and becomes the primary store in her neighborhood.

This is Nieves' second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is aware that if she repays on schedule, she can access further loans easier and without difficulty from her community bank, where she is much liked by her fellow members. She will use her 1000 nuevos soles to buy more supplies for her grocery store and thus increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Rocío, de 27 años, es una joven muy responsable y tranquila, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.
Todos los días, llegadas las 8 de la mañana, abre las puertas de sus cabinas de Internet para atender a sus clientes, su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que sus computadoras son de última generación  y sus muebles muy cómodos. Este negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que siempre para muy lleno.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que tiene el Internet a la mano para realizar sus trabajos de la universidad, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad, considera que lo más difícil es tener que estar pendiente de que los malos clientes no se lleven ningún accesorio de la computadora. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de sus cabinas de Internet para colocar más computadoras.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Rocío con MFP, ella siempre ahorra dinero para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos accesorios para sus computadoras, para reemplazar los que por el paso del tiempo se han malogrado.
texts.en:
Rocío, 27 years old, is a very responsible and quite young woman. She lives with her parents and her greatest desire is to get ahead in her life. Every day at eight o'clock in the morning she opens the doors of her internet cafe and waits for her customers. Her place is very popular, since she offers computers of the last generation and the furniture is very confortable. She is doing very well with her business, since her internet cafe is always crowded. The advantage in this job is that she can use the net any time for her college homeworks. She has been in this business for the past three years and in her opinion the most difficult aspect of the job is to make sure that some customer does not steal anything. For the future she wishes to have more internet cabins in order to install more computers. This is Rocio's second loan with MFP and she is always saving so that she is able to pay back on schedule. She is a lovely person and she works hard to support her commune bank. With the 1000 PEN she requested she will buy new accessories for her computers, in order to replace the old ones, that are used up.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 25 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sencilla, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
La crianza de ganado es una actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeña de sus padres, quienes siempre trabajaron muy duro para darle una buena vida. Actualmente tiene su propio ganado, los cuales cuida y alimenta muy bien, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza de sus animales, depende los ingresos económicos que tendrá su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar su ganado hasta la feria dominical de Juliaca, que es donde vende sus reses. 
Para más adelante, espera poder incrementar el número de animales que tiene y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Yolanda con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que ahorrar poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por las demás socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que desea tenerlos bien alimentados.
texts.en:
Yolanda, aged 25, is a hardworking and modest woman. She lives in her own house and her greatest wish is to progress.

Rearing cattle is a skill that she learned at a very young age from her parents, who always worked very hard to provide her with a good life. Today she has her own cattle, which she cares for and feeds very well, since she knows that the income for her family depends on her successful cattle breeding. What Yolanda likes best about this job is to feed her animals. She has been in this activity for four years and says that the hardest task is to move her animals to the Sunday fair in Juliaca, where she sells her cattle. Later on, she expects to increase the number of animals and thus raise her earnings.

This is Yolanda's third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is committed to repaying on schedule, even if she needs to save little by little. She is a very active and supportive member in her community bank, which is why her fellow members have great esteem for her. Yolanda will use the 1500 nuevos soles from her loan to buy more fodder (grass) for her animals, since she wants them well fed.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cattle

texts.es:
Ysabel de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa; vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a su esposo Félix de 43 años y sus 3 hijos: Maribel de 13, Luis de 11 y Edwar de 7 años, y lo que más desea es brindarle un vida digna a su familia.

Su puesto de artesanías está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), la cual es muy concurrida por sus clientes, debido a que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, que siempre les brinda una atención muy cordial. Los modelos que vende son muy novedosos, ya que trata de diferenciarse de las demás tejedoras.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y que pueda incrementar la cantidad de artesanías que produce, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Ysabel con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros crédito desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que sino meterá en problemas a su banco comunal en donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará materiales nuevos para fabricar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Ysabel, aged 38, is a mother who deeply loves her family. She lives in a house of relatives of hers, with her husband Félix, aged 43, and their three children: Maribel is 13, Luis 11 and Edwar 7 years old. She wants most of all to provide her family with a decent life.

The store, in which she sells handicrafts, is temporarily located at the Explanada Laguna, where the trade fairs are held in Juliaca. Her store attracts a lot of customers, since she is a very cheerful and charismatic businesswoman who gives her full cordial attention to her customers. Her models on sale are very new, because she wants to differentiate herself from other knitters. What she likes best about her job is to talk with her customers and learn about things happening at the market. She has been in this business for 11 years. According to her, the hardest part in her activity is to stay the whole day in her store without having a chance to leave and go about other activities. For the future she hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to produce more handicrafts and thus raise her income.

This is Ysabel's sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and, just as she did with her previous loans, she is committed to repaying it on schedule, since she is aware that otherwise she would run into trouble in her community bank, where she is well regarded for her reliability. She will use her 2000 nuevos soles to buy new materials to produce more handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Maria Aida

texts.en:
Maria Aida G. is from the village of Sibula Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Maria Aida is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Aida owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, candies,sugar, and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Aida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Aida successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maria Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the needs of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

texts.es:
La señora Patricia, es la presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento 28 D. JULIO quien tiene como actividad principal la Venta D. Viveres a pedido que reparte desD. su domicilio, la Sra. Vianca,es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa por mayor y D. ropa deportiva y el señor Luis, se dedica al bordado D. mantas D. las cholas paceñas y costura D. las mismas,el es secretario  D. actas.

Estas tres personas son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por dieiseís  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas, ya que tienen la experiencia D. conocerce y no fallarse como Banco. 

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 10% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio y lo acomodan en clientes fijos que ellos tienen,todo el grupo esta conformado por personas trabajadoras, esta actividad es el unico ingreso con el que cuentan y D. esta manera colaboran con los gastos del hogar, son  responsables con su credito ahora se encuentran el el cuarto credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema. Se conocen muy bien y se colaboran entre ellos.
texts.en:
Patricia is the president of the 28 D. JULIO enterprising bank and her business is to sell food to take away; Vianca is the tresurer and her business is wholesale and sport clothing; and Luis, who sews and embroiders mantels for the traditional bolivian chola clothing, is the secretary. This three people are the leaders of the enterprising bank, that is maD. up of 16 members, who assure the payments among them and know and trust each other as a community bank. Most of the members have a own business place, while 10 % of them sells merchandise from their home to regular customers. All the members are hard working people and their business is their only source of income, which is essential for them to support their families. They are now requesting their fourth loan with this institution and they have always been very responsible and on schedule. They support and know each other very well.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El señor Edwin Martínez vive en mizque, una localidad de Cochabamba a unas 4 horas de  distancia. el trabaja hace muchos años confeccionando ropa, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos hacen salir adelante su pequeño taller  de confección de ropa.

El señor Edwin tuvo problemas de salud, hace poco lo operaron de su apéndice, quedando unos días en cama, ya que si no se operaba corría el riesgo de morir, ahora su esposa y sus hijos son los que llevan las riendas del negocio hasta que Edwin se recupere y pueda seguir trabajando en lo que le apasiona, crear prendas de vestir. Con el crédito el espera incrementar mas maquinas a su taller, para poder producir más prendas, y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y su esposa, con el tiempo espera  sacar un segundo crédito  con el cual espera construir un cuarto y agrandar su casita.
texts.en:
Edwin Martínez lives in Mizque, a town four hours from Cochabamba. He has worked for many years making clothes. Edwin and his wife and three children want to improve their small workshop where they make clothes. Edwin had health problems, and just a short time ago, he had his appendix operated on. He spent a few days in bed, and if they had not operated on him, he ran the risk of dying. Now, his wife and children have taken control of the business until Edwin recuperates and can continue working on what he is passionate about, making articles of clothing. With this loan, Edwin hopes to increase the number of machines in his workshop so that he will be able to produce more garments and give his wife and children a better future. With time, he hopes to receive a second loan with which he will construct a room and expand his little home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento VIRGEN D. FATIMA esta conformado por la señora Gladys, quien tiene como actividad una zapateria donD. realiza y venD. calzados ubicado en su domicilio, doña Maria, es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. dulces y una cabina telefonica  y la señora Silvia, es la secretaria D. actas cuya actividad es promotora D. calzados batta por catalogo.  Estas tres señoras son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por once personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas y se conocen por mucho tiempo. Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 20% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio ambulando y no cuenta con domicilio propio son madres D. familia  muy trabajadoras donD. el negocio es el unico ingreso con el que cuentan para colaborar con los gastos del hogar, son  responsables en sus actividades y estan segura D. demostrar cumplimiento y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The executive team of the community bank, "Virgen D. Fatima", is comprised of three women: Gladys, Maria, and Silvia. Gladys' business is a shoe store located in her home where she makes and sells footwear. Maria is the treasurer and dedicates herself to selling sweets and has a telephone booth. Silvia is the secretary, and her job is to promote Bata footwear through a catalogue. These three women are the heads of the community bank, which is comprised of eleven members who are accountable to each other and have known each other for a long time. The majority have their own business, and the other 20 percent sell merchandise as peddlers and do not have their own homes. These women are hardworking mothers whose business is their only source of income with which to contribute to paying household expenses. They are responsible for their businesses, and they are sure that they will fulfill their obligations and demonstrate responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La mesa directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento esta conformado por la señora Francisca Sofia, quien tiene como actividad la venta D. chocolates al por mayor ubicado en su domicilio, la señora Teresa, es la tesorera quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa en general y la señora Glorieta, es la secretaria D. actas cuya actividad es el servicio D. cabinas telefónicas.  Estas tres señoras son la cabeza del banco D. emprendimiento conformado por Diez  personas quienes se garantizan entre ellas.

Una gran mayoria cuenta con negocio propio fijo el otro 20% trabajan con mercaderia en su domicilio ambulando y no cuenta con domicilio propio son madres D. familia  muy trabajadoras que el negocio es el unico ingreso con el cual mantienen su hogar, son responsables con su credito ya que ahora se encuentran en el segundo credito con nuestra institucion sin ningun problema.
texts.en:
The board of directors of the communal bank is comprised of Francisca Sofia, who sells chocolates wholesale in her home. Teresa, the treasurer, sells clothes. Glorieta, the secretary, has a telephone booth business. These three women are the head of the communal bank comprised of ten people who guarantee each other. Most of them have their own fixed business. The other 20% work with merchandise going door to door. They do not have their own homes. They are very hard-working mothers, and their businesses are their only source of income to support their households. They are responsible with their loan. They are in their second cycle with our institution, and there have been no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Hortencia Trinidad

texts.es: La Señora Hortencia es originaria del municipio de Totonicapán con residencia en la zona uno del mismo municipio, ella inicio su propio negocio en la elaboracion y venta de pan hace mas de quince años ya que es el trabajo de su esposo que se decia a otra actividad profesional ella no quiso que el negocio desapareciera ella necesita de un capital para incrementar su produccion en la compra de arina, levadura, huevos su principal punto de venta todos los dias de la semana en el parque central de Totonicapan desde las seis de la mañana con los ingresos obtenidos ha podido darle educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a native of the town of Totonicapán and resides in Zone 1 of the town. She began her own business of making and selling bread over fifteen years ago. Since this is the work of her husband who now dedicates himself to a different profession and she does not want the business to disappear, Hortencia needs funds to purchase flour, yeast, and eggs in order to increase her production. She sells her bread every day of the week in the central park of Totonicapán starting at six in the morning. With the income she has raised, she has been able to provide for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, and eggs to expand her business

texts.es: La señorita Rosaura es originaria del municipio de Totonicapan con residencia en la zona cuatro del mismo municipio su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboracion y venta de pan en casa en casa dicho oficio lo aprendio de su querido padres desde cuando hera una ñina con los ingreso que obtiene ha colaborado economicamente en los gastos de la familia hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR en un credito para incrementar su capital para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosaura is from the Totonicapán municipality, and she lives in Zone four in the same municipality. Her primary source of income is making and selling bread from house to house. She learned this job from her dear parents when she was a girl. She has used the income she gets to help with the family expenses. She now needs help from the ASDIR Institution. She needs a loan to increase her capital to be able to satisfy her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El sr. Nestor tiene su taller de chapería en su misma casa, trabaja ya mucho tiempo en esta actividad, es muy conocido por la zona ya que toda su familia se dedica a este rubro, vive con su esposa y su hija que está estudiando, su esposa trabaja con la  venta de víveres cuando tiene pedido con esta actividad colabora con los gastos de la casa  y cuando no trabaja se dedica a labores de la casa. Don Nestor con el anterior crédito adquirió un terreno, el cual por órdenes de la subalcaldía y junta de vecinos tiene que hacer amurallar, y el crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar los materiales de construcción; es un cliente antiguo y muy puntual.
texts.en:
Nestor has his metal workshop in his own house. He already has a lot of experience in this activity. He is well known in his area since his whole family is dedicated to this job. He lives with his wife and his daughter who is a student. His wife works in the sale of food. When she has orders with this activity, she helps with the bills and when she isn't working, she is dedicated to housework. Nestor acquiried a piece of land with his last loan, which by order of the neighborhood council and deputy mayor he has to wall off. The loan that he is requesting now is to buy the construction materials. He is an old customer and is very punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

Juan A. has been selling vegetables in the Mayoreo Market in Managua for eight years. He sells a wide variety of vegetables including peppers, beets, ginger, potatos and more. He would like a loan to increase his inventory by purchasing yucca (a starchy root vegetable) and quequisque (another typical root vegetable). 

Juan has been working with CEPRODEL for about two years and has had about 10 small loans.  He says that the loans have helped him increase his inventory and improve his business.  His stall is less than a block from CEPRODEL’s office in the market. The stall consists of large baskets full of his products and a cloth overhead that provides shade. 

Juan, 41, and his partner have four children in their care, three are still in school.  Before working in the market, Juan was a driver.

texts.es:
Alcira tiene 42 años, vive junto a su esposo Teobaldo, de 46 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Henry de 15, Analí de 13 y Maick de 5 años. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en un paraje alejado de la ciudad, su vivienda es de adobe (tierra adoquinada) y tejado, donde el fuerte frío de la sierra no ingresa con facilidad.

Desde hace 10 años Alcira se dedica a la venta de carne con la ayuda de su esposo; ambos caminan largas horas hacia otros pueblos para comprar ganado que después sacrifican para vender la carne en el mercado de la ciudad. Esta actividad es muy rentable, ya que les permite dar una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos; además con el dinero que obtienen, paralelamente, siembran papa y olluco (productos comestibles oriundos de la sierra) que también comercializan al mercado de su ciudad por temporadas. 
Es por ello que Alcira desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne para obtener mayores ganancias, más ahora que el número de sus clientes se ha incrementado por la demanda y calidad  de este producto.

Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está feliz porque con su trabajo podrá sacar adelante a su familia, además cuenta que en su banco comunal, donde es muy entusiasta porque aprende mucho. Con el dinero que obtendrá comprará más cabezas de ganado para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, así como varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Alcira is 42. She lives with her husband Teobaldo, 46, and with their 3 children: Henry 15, Analí 13 and Maick 5. They have their own home and it is located in a spot far from the city. Their house is made of adobe (paved floor) and a tiled roof, so the severe cold of the mountains does not easily get in. For 10 years Alcira has been selling meat with the help of her husband. Both walk long hours to other villlages to buy livestock that they then slaughter to sell meat in the city market. This business is very profitable, since it allows them to give their children a suitable quality of life. In addition with the money they get they plant potato and olluco (edible products native to the mountains) that they also sell at their city market on and off. It is for this reason that Alcira wants to increase her meat selling business to make bigger profits, more now that the number of her customers has increased through the demand and quality of this product. This is the seventh time that she has had a loan with MFP and she is happy because with her work she will be able to help her family get ahead. Also she says that she is a fan of her communal bank because she learns a lot. With the money that she gets she will buy more livestock to cover her customers' demands, as well as various sacks of manure and fertilizers to support their next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo Noe, de 29 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Zaraí de 8 y Jesús de 3 años. Su casa está a medio construir y se ubica en un apacible pueblo de la sierra peruana algo alejado de la ciudad. 

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la  siembra de papa, con la ayuda de su padre, quien le enseñó a cultivar la tierra y todo lo necesario de la actividad agrícola. Con las ganancias de la comercialización de su producto logró construir la mitad de su vivienda, por lo que espera que esta próxima cosecha sea más productiva para ganar lo suficiente y concluir con la otra mitad, para poder darles un hogar adecuado a sus hijos, quienes son el motivo que la impulsa para salir adelante en su sacrificada labor.
Betty, en el futuro desea sembrar en mayor cantidad e independizarse, además tiene planeado aperturar una tienda de abarrotes que le ayude a obtener más ingresos económicos, y así ahorrar algo de dinero que invertirá en la educación de sus hijos y también le permitirá sembrar papa de mejor calidad.               

Ella asegura que en su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser muy responsable, por ello paga puntualmente sus cuotas, como lo hará en esta séptima oportunidad en que accede a un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita lo usará para comprar varios sacos de fertilizantes y litros de insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos y así asegurar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Noe, who is 29, and their two children: Zaraí (age 8) and Jesús (age 3). Her house is halfway built and located in a quiet village in the Peruvian mountains situated away from the city.

Betty has been growing potatoes for four years with the help of her father, who taught her how to cultivate the land and other necessary farming skills. With the profits from the sale of her crops, she has been able to pay for the construction costs of her house thus far. Betty expects to be more productive with her next harvest and earn enough money to finish the other half of her house. This will provide a proper home for her children, who are the reason behind the sacrifices she makes in order to succeed.

In the future, Betty wants to plant potatoes in greater quantity and become independent. She also plans to open a grocery store to help generate more income. This will help her save some money for her children’s education and allow her to plant potatoes of better quality.

Betty says that being part of her Communal Bank has taught her how to be very responsible and make her payments on time. This is the seventh time she has accessed a loan from MFP. The money she requested will be used to buy sacks of fertilizers and liters of insecticides to spray on her crops to ensure a crop that is of high quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer trabajadora de 36 años, vive con su esposo Manuel, de también 36 años, y con sus 3 hijos; Guillermo de 14, Ángela de 10 y Ariana de 9 años, en su acogedora vivienda que es propia.

Cada mañana, desde muy temprano, prepara el desayuno para mandar a sus hijos al colegio; así comienza su agitado día, luego se dirige presurosa hacia el cafetín de un centro educativo de su ciudad, donde vende panes con pollo, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros productos comestibles, ya que con su carisma es capaz de convencer hasta el más reacio de sus clientes. Celia trabaja con una socia que está a punto de dejarle todo el negocio, y ella espera ansiosa que esto suceda.
Adicionalmente, vende diferentes productos por campaña, como en el mes de octubre, que le fue muy bien con la venta de turrones (dulces hechos a base de galleta y miel), tradicionales en esta época. 
En la actualidad, con motivo de las fiestas navideñas vende panetones (queque con pasas y frutas), pues desde que lo comentó entre sus conocidos, ya tiene pedidos y está segura que las ventas serán todo un éxito.
Además, ya tiene pensado ahorrar dinero para que en el futuro pueda implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Esta es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, además dentro de su banco comunal es muy respetada porque le gusta participar activamente en las reuniones. Con el dinero que solicita comprará panetones al por mayor, los cuales prácticamente ya los tiene vendidos entre sus familiares y amigos, así busca seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking, 36-year old woman. She lives in a cozy house with her husband Manuel, also age 36, and her 3 children Guillermo, age 14, Ángela, age 10, and Ariana, age 9. Early each morning, she begins her busy day by preparing breakfast for her children before they go to school. Later, she quickly makes her way to the food court in the city's educational center, where she sells chicken sandwiches, sweets, and sodas, among other food items. With her charisma, she is able to convince even the most reluctant of customers to buy from her stand. Celia works with another member of her community bank, who is ready to leave her with the business, and Celia is waiting eagerly for this to happen. In addition, she sells different seasonal products. For example, the month of October went very well due to sales of turrones (a nougat candy made with a base of cookies and honey), which are traditionally eaten during this season. Currently, she anticipates selling panetones (cake with raisins and fruit) during the Christmas season. She has mentioned this to her customers and already has orders, so she is sure her sales will be strong. She plans to save money to open a grocery store in her house, as well. This is the tenth loan she will receive from MFP and she is sure to be punctual in paying each one of her loan payments. In addition, she is well respected within her community bank because she likes to actively participate in the meetings. With the money she is requesting she will buy panetones at wholesale prices to fill the orders her relatives and friends have already placed. In this way, she will continue to make progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa Lidia, que tiene 52 años, y con sus dos últimos hijos que son gemelos; Juber y Jhonny, ambos de 16 años. El resto de sus 6 hijos varones ya están casados y han formado sus propias familias.

Este jovial hombre se podría decir que es “multifuncional”, ya que tiene varios oficios, los cuales desempeña con mucha dedicación. Primero empezó con la agricultura, trabajo en el que hasta hoy ocupa gran parte de su tiempo, siembra papa, cebada y alverja, con las que obtiene buenas ganancias. Para estas labores le apoyan sus hijos gemelos, pero sólo cuando tienen tiempo porque ellos aun no terminan sus estudios. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y cuyes y paralelamente realiza todo tipo de artesanías, entre alfombras, telares, chompas, etc. En esta actividad también ocupa bastante tiempo, porque le gusta y aprendió desde muy joven.
Desde entonces, esta actividad también le genera buenas ganancias y le gusta mucho, ya que hace hermosos telares de distintos colores y texturas.
Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad y migrar de la zona donde vive para probar suerte en otras tierras donde tiene familiares, pero continuar con la agricultura.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago porque quiere pedir otros créditos para seguir adelante con todos sus sueños. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para dar el tratamiento adecuado a sus tierras, y también adquirirá más carneros y cuyes para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 54 years old and lives with his wife Lidia, age 52, and their youngest two sons, who are twins: Juber and Jhonny, both age 16. The rest of their sons are married and have their own families. This cheerful man can be described as "multi-functional", as he currently works in various trades and is very dedicated to each. He began in farming, which still occupies a large part of his time today, growing potatoes, barley, and peas, which turn a good profit. His twin sons help him with the farming, but only when they have time, since they are still in school. Fortunato also raises and sells rams and guinea pigs, and produces different types of textiles including carpets, weavings, sweaters, etc. This work also occupies a lot of his time, because he learned to create woven products when he was very young and likes the work. Since then, this work has also generated good income and he really enjoys making beautiful weavings that have distinctive colors and textures. In the future he plans to plant greater quantities and move away from where he currently lives to try his luck farming in a different region where he has relatives. This is his first loan from MFP and Fortunato is sure he will make each payment because he wants to qualify for future loans to continue progress toward his dreams. The money he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to properly cultivate his crops. He will also acquire more rams and guinea pigs to continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 34 años, vive con su pequeño hijo, Bryan de sólo 3 años. Ella ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le han presentado a lo largo del  camino. Vive en una casa alquilada y persigue el sueño de seguir adelante como hasta el día de hoy lo ha hecho.

Se levanta desde muy temprano para alistar a su tranquilo y juguetón niño para que asista a su centro educativo, luego todo debe quedar listo para que empiece con su negocio de venta de comida en su restaurante que está ubicado en una céntrica calle de la ciudad.
Desde las 7 de la mañana empieza con la venta de desayunos a sus asiduos comensales que quedan más que satisfechos con las delicias que Nancy prepara; luego al mediodía, los almuerzos, y cuando ya tiene todo vendido, al atardecer empieza con la venta de cenas para las personas que llegan cansadas de trabajar en busca de un platillo que sacie el hambre.
Así transcurren los días de esta trabajadora mujer; entre diversos platillos, ansiosos comensales, aun así se da un tiempo entre su agitada vida para atender a su pequeño hijo que la ayuda portándose bien y aprendiendo todo lo que le enseñan en el colegio.

Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura que cumplirá en cada pago, porque ella es responsable y así lo demuestra en cada acción de su vida. Nancy tiene muchas metas por alcanzar y sabe que las llegará a hacer realidad porque confía en su buena voluntad, es así que planea invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en ampliar y mejorar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and lives with her young son Bryan, who is only 3 years old. She knows how to get ahead despite challenges which have come up over the years. Nancy lives in a rented house and always pursues her dream of a better life. She gets up very early to get her peaceful and playful son ready to attend the educational center, and to prepare everything for her restaurant business on a centrally located street in the city. Beginning at 7:00 a.m. she sells breakfast to her devoted diners who leave more than satisfied with the delicious food that Nancy prepares. Later at noon she offers lunch, and when she has finished selling lunch at dusk she begins to prepare dinner for people who arrive, tired after work and in search of a meal to satisfy their hunger. Thus pass the days for this hardworking woman. Between various meals and eager diners, Nancy sets aside time in her busy life to attend to her young son, who helps her by behaving well and learning everything he is taught in school. This is the sixth loan she has received from MFP and she will be sure to make each payment because she is responsible and demonstrates this in every decision in her life. Nancy has many goals and knows that she will achieve them because of her good willpower. She plans to invest the money she is requesting to expand and improve her business to offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nerida tiene 24 años, vive con su pequeño hijo Wilder de tan sólo 3 años, en su tranquila y acogedora casa, la cual es alquilada y habitan en ella desde hace un año.

Cada día es una lucha constante, debe levantarse muy temprano porque tiene que alistar a su hijo para dejarlo en una cuna jardín donde pasa la mayor parte del día. Luego se dirige al mercado de su ciudad para abrir su puesto de venta de carne que tiene desde hace un año, del cual dependen sus  ganancias económicas. 
Nerida trabaja y cría sola a su hijo, porque el amor de una madre no tiene límites y aunque la vida le ha puesto duras pruebas ella las ha sabido afrontar sola a base de esfuerzo.
Le gusta su negocio porque es rentable, lo hace sola, sin problemas y ya se ha consolidado en este rubro, pues conoce a quienes comprarles carne al por mayor, además el tiempo que trabaja en el mercado le ha permitido hacerse conocida y tener clientes fijos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo porque no quiere quedar mal con su banco comunal, pues sabe que la confianza depositada en ella merece ser devuelta con mucho respeto. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la implementación de su puesto de carne, empezará por comprar una cortadora y una pequeña vitrina.
texts.en:
Nerida is 24 year old and lives with her young son Wilder, only 3 years old, in a peaceful and cozy rented house that they have lived in for 1 year. Each day is a struggle; she must get up very early to bring her son to daycare, where he spends most of the day. Later, she makes her way to the city market to open her stall, where she sells meat. She has had this stall for 1 year, and depends on it for income. Nerida works and cares only for her son, because a mother's love has no limit. Although life has put her through difficult tests, she has faced them with strength. She likes her business because it is profitable and she is able to run it by herself without difficulty, making progress in the trade as she meets people who sell meat wholesale and also becomes more well known in the market, allowing her to build a customer base. This is her third loan from MFP, and she is inclined to make all her payments on time because she doesn't want to be on bad terms with her community bank; she knows the trust they have placed in her deserves to be returned with respect. She plans to invest the money she has requested to improve her meat stall, beginning with the purchase of a meat cutter and a small display case.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo Pedro, de 59 años, y con sus 2 hijos; Jhon de 36 y Mariela de 14 años. Ellos habitan en su acogedora casa que es propia.

Desde hace 30 años se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, a pesar de su juventud no dudó en trabajar y luego que se casó continuó con este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo, y después de un tiempo también con el apoyo de su hijo mayor. En la actualidad, cada día se despierta  desde muy temprano y se dirige a comprar verduras en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad para  venderlas al por menor, Reyna obtiene ganancias liquidas, ya que el negocio le es muy rentable y no tiene mucha competencia, además ya tiene clientes regulares.
Para el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y hacerlo más productivo para obtener mayores ganancias, ya que algún día sueña convertirse en una gran mayorista de verduras.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser puntual, como siempre lo ha sido, en cada uno de sus pagos, ya que quiere seguir trabajando con su banco comunal compuesto por personas muy organizadas y trabajadoras. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de verduras, para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Reyna is 50 years old and lives with her husband Pedro, age 59, and their two children Jhon, age 36, and Mariela, age 14. They live in their cozy house, which they own. For 30 years she has sold vegetables. Despite her young age at the time, Reyna never hesitated to work and, after marrying, continued her business with the help of her husband and later her son. Currently, she wakes up early every day to buy vegetables at the city's wholesale market to sell retail. Reyna earns good income, since the business is profitable and she doesn't have much competition. She also has regular customers. In the future she hopes to expand her business and productivity in order to obtain better profit. Her dream is to someday be a vegetable wholesaler. This is her seventh loan from MFP and she will be punctual, as she always has been, in making each one of her payments. She wants to keep working in her community bank, comprised of very organized and hardworking people. Reyna plans to invest the money in the purchase of vegetables, to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 38 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Jesús, de tiene 39 años, y con su joven hija Pierina de 15 años Juntos y muy felices viven en su cómoda casa que es propia.
Desde hace 7 años emprendió un negocio donde pudiera ser su jefa y pudiera desarrollarlo en su vivienda, es así que se animó por la venta de productos comestibles. Posteriormente, analizando las necesidades de la zona donde vive, se dio cuenta que no había una fotocopiadora y decidió comprar una máquina que colocó en su tienda y se instruyó para ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiado. 
Sin embargo, como Ruth es una mujer emprendedora, hace poco tiempo decidió comprar algunas computadoras para brindar el servicio de internet y tiene bastante demanda porque en su barrio no hay otras cabinas de internet cerca.
Y como si fuera poco, esta incansable mujer que también vende comida a algunos trabajadores de una entidad estatal que funciona al costado de su casa.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser responsable en cada uno de los pagos para así seguir progresando en la vida. Tiene pensado destinar el dinero que solicita en la implementación de sus cabinas de internet, con la compra de una computadora, audífonos y una impresora, para así continuar con todos los proyectos que tiene en mente.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, lives with her husband Jesús who is 39 years old, and with their young daughter Pierina who is 15 years old. They live very happily in their comfortable house which they own. Seven years ago she started a business where she could be her own boss and which she could develop from her house. That is how she got excited about selling food products. Later, analyzing the needs in the zone where she lives, se realized there were no photocopying services, and she decided to buy a photocopying machine and place it in her store and learn who to offer photocopying services. However, given that she is an enterpreneuring woman, not long ago Ruth decided to buy some computers to offer internet service and she has high demand because there aren't any other internet booths near her neighborhood. If that wasn't enough, this tireless woman also sells food to the workers of a state agency that is located by her house. This is the first loan she has with MFP and she is sure she will be responsible in each of her payments so that she can continue to make progress in life. She has decided to use the money she is requesting to implement her internet booths, buying a computer, headphones and a printer to continue with all the projects she was in mind.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Liny I. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Liny owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling viand (meat) in the local community. Liny has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Liny joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Liny is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Liny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Retchil

texts.en:
Retchil R. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 22 years-old and unmarried. Retchil owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snack foods, canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste in the local community. Retchil has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Retchil joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Retchil is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: June Rey

texts.en:
June Rey B. is from the village of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 20 years-old and umarried. TJune Rey owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods and candies, shampo and, toothpaste in the local community. June Rey has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, June Rey joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. June Rey is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

texts.en:
Arlen E. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Arlen owns and operates a business making and selling viand (food dishes) in the local community. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlen joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arlen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
