Nilo D. is from the village of Mohon Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years-old and married with seven adult children. Nilo owns and operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing furniture rental services to local community. Nilo has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nilo joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor José Núñez, tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Marlene Medina, con quien tiene dos hijos menores.
El Señor José se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es una masa preparada a base de harina de maíz y almidón, cocinada en un horno calentado a leña. Esta venta la realiza en forma ambulante en una bicicleta, con el cual recorre toda la ciudad vendiendo su producto.
Nos cuenta José que para empezar con esta actividad, desde muy joven trabajaba con una Sra. que realizaba este producto y él lo vendía por la ciudad, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio producto, con la ayuda de su esposa, quien realizaba la preparación y el horneado del mismo.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y gracias al mismo logró hacer estudiar a su esposa la profesión de docente, que ya ejerce y está ingresando un dinero más a la familia.
El préstamo solicitado es para la ampliación del horno.
La intención de José es la de lograr producir una mayor cantidad de chipas para un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
José Núñez, 41, is married to Marlene Medina and they have two minor children. José sells chipas, a traditional bakery product, prepared in a wood fired oven with maize flour and starch. He sells his chipas in the street, riding a bicycle around the city. José tells us that he started this business when he was very young and worked for a lady. Later he became independent and started his own production, with the help of his wife, who was in charge of preparation and baking. He has been in this business for the past 15 years and thanks to this income his wife could study and become a teacher and through this job could make additional income to support the family. This loan will be used to enlarge the bakery. José hopes to increase the production of chipas and achieve higher profit.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to enlarge the bakery

texts.es:
La Señora Victorina M., cuenta con 30 años de edad, está casada con el Señor Mario Britez y tienen una hija aún pequeña.
Se dedica a la actividad de alquiler de sillas, mesas, vajillas y arreglos para eventos, como ser cumpleaños, bodas, fiestas infantiles, eventos sociales, fiestas privadas y actos culturales. 
 Victorina para poder dar inicio a este negocio, comenzó trabajando, con su marido, en un negocio similar, pero como dependientes, luego fueron independizándose con el correr del tiempo, hasta llegar a montar su propio negocio. 
Actualmente es uno del negocio más importante en este rubro, ya que cuentan con todas las comodidades y con la mayor variedad en cuanto al servicio que presta. 
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de más sillas, que está necesitando ya que en esta temporada aumenta la demanda del servicio. 
El deseo de Victorina es adquirir un local en el cual se puedan realizar los eventos y así prestar un servicio más completo.
texts.en:
Señora Victorina M. is 30-years-old and is married to señor Mario Britez. They have a daughter who is still small. She makes a living by renting chairs, tables, dishes and arrangements for events like birthdays, weddings, chidren's parties, social events, private parties, and cultural events. To start her business, Victorina started working with her husband in a similar business, but as employees for someone else. They later decided to become independent and started their own business. Currently theirs is one of the most important businesses in this area because they have all of the conveniences and the biggest variety in terms of the services they offer. She will use the requested loan to buy more chairs that she needs since her demand is higher this time of year. Victorina's wish is to acquire a location where she can carry out events and therefore offer a more complete service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca H.  tiene 63 años de edad,  con tres hijos,  que ya son mayores de edad  todos casados, hace 6 meses falleció su marido, pero de igual manera queda acargo de su negocio por lo que  tiene que solventar los gastos familiares ella sola. 
Ella  cuenta que la casa donde viven actualmente, le había regalado su tía , comentó también que   hace 16 años atrás  se dedica a la venta de ropas, cosméticos y otros. 
En la comunidad, era la única tienda que se encontraba en aquella época. 
Desde su inicio el negocio sigue ubicada en el mismo lugar, se ha convertido en el centro más importante de compras de prendas de todo tipo, por el buen precio, la buena ubicación del negocio y la excelente atención de la propia dueña. 
Según nos manifiesta  gracias al primer crédito que se le otorgo de la Fundación Pya  pudo agrandar su negocio y asi seguir adelante. 
El crédito solicitado consistirá en compra de cosméticos y prenda de la temporada (: cremas faciales, desodorantes, maquillajes, bronceadores, entre otros) para poder brindar una buena atención a su clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca H. is 63-years-old and has 3 children who are all adults and married. Her husband passed away 6 months ago, but she is still running her business because she now has to pay for their home's expenses alone. She owns the house where she currently lives. Her aunt gave it to her. She has sold clothing, cosmetics, and other items for 16 years. Hers was the only store of this kind that was available back then. Her business has been located in the same place since she started. It has become an important place for shopping for all types of clothing at a good price, in a good location, with excellent service from the owner. She is thankful for the first loan that Fundación Paraguaya offered her so she could grow her business. She will use the requested credit to purchase cosmetics and seasonal clothing (facial cream, deodorant, makeup, bronzers, etc) to be able to offer complete service to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing (facial cream, perfume, deodorant, makeup, t-shirts, pants, etc.)

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris A., 35 years old, comes from Talim Island, Binangonan, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 4 children. She is a member of Malacaban center in Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), Rizal South Branch. She is a persevering woman because even at her younger age, she is still working hard for the betterment of her businesses.

In 1996, she joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She has utilized her loans in her fishing business. Since she became a member of ASHI, she has been able to maintain very good performance. She is now requesting a loan of Php 35,000.00 pesos to use as additional capital for her business. Specifically the loan fund will be use to buy fish net, bamboo, and rope, and as payment for labor.

She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and of saving for her family's future. She is positive that with the capital accessed through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of sending her children to a university will also be achieved. She wants to thank ASHI and Kiva for the greatest opportunity which has enabled her to start reaching for her goal. Maricris and her husband feel very happy with the loan that changed their lives to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fish net, bamboo, and rope, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a 40-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to four young children. She lives on Talim Island, Binangonan, in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. She is married to Eliezer, a fisherman.

She joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap Inc.), a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, and the organization she have grown to love since 1995. ASHI helped her to start a business that helps her husband to pay for their daily expenditures. She and her husband had been in the fishing business for more than ten  years. 

For her eighth loan, she is requesting Php 28,000.00 to continue her fishing business with the support of her husband. She will purchase assorted supplies for her fishing business, such as fishnet, rope, steel, bamboo, threads, and a fishing boat.

She dreams that, some day soon, she will have a larger space to store her fishing materials, a bigger fishing cage, and a stall in the market to sell her fish. She dreams also that she will be able to send her children to school and see them finish their studies. Gloria wants to thank ASHI for all its initiatives for the poor and thank the Kiva lenders who fund this loan. 

Like most families here in the Philippines, they want the best in life and a happy family. Now, she enjoys seeing how her ASHI loan changes their lives and gives them more opportunities to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is a native of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is a 50-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. At her age, Jessie is seen as strong and determined to uplift her standard of living.

Jessie is engaged in a computer shop business and tends a variety store at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. These businesses are a big help for her family in enabling them to cover their expenses and to set aside savings for the future. Jessie is requesting a loan of PhP 15,000 as additional capital for her variety store.

Jessie dreams that someday her variety store will become a grocery store. She also dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find stable jobs.

Jessie wants to thank ASHI for giving her initial capital for her business and for micro-insurance, training and compulsory savings that ASHI has innovated for its members.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her general store

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que logró educar a sus 2 hijos; Oswaldo de 22 y Nicol de 20 años, con mucho esfuerzo; a los cuales adora. Juntos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace dos años que sus hijos ya tienen trabajo y son más independientes, es por ello que ella decidió dedicarse a una actividad que le de la libertad de escoger sus horarios de trabajo, y la venta de productos de belleza fue lo indicado. Todas las mañana realiza las labores del hogar y el resto del día se encarga de repartir y ofrecer los productos que tiene en stock y los que le van llegando a lo largo del mes. Carmen está muy contenta y ha hecho muy buenas amigas en sus visitas, ya que esta actividad le permite conocer a mucha gente, pero no sólo sale a ofrecer sus productos, sino que también las clientas vienen hasta su domicilio para pedir y probar algunas muestras que tiene y así elegir cuál producto comprar. 
Carmen quiere seguir trabajando en este negocio y lograr implementar algo más estable, como un bazar, pero sabe que aún necesita mucho trabajo y tiempo, y está dispuesta a avanzar poco a poco.

Con este, es el dieciochoavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, teniendo un historial muy bueno, ya que siempre fue muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos cosméticos, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, is a hardworking woman who, with much effort, has achieved providing an education for her children, Oswaldo, 22, and Nicol, 20. She adores them both, and lives with them in her own house. Two years ago, as her children were working and were more independent, Carmen decided to pursue a business that allowed her to set her own hours. She decided on beauty product sales. Every day, after doing her household chores, she devotes the rest of the day to delivering and selling the products she has in stock and those that will arrive later that month. Carmen is happy that she has made good friends in her visits, as this work allows her to meet many people. In addition to sales calls, clients also come to her house to order and to try sample products to decide which to buy. Carmen wants to continue in this business and develop something more stable, like a bazaar, but she knows she has much work ahead of her and is happy to progress little by little. This is Carmen’s 18th loan with MFP and she has a good history, always punctual in her payments. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of cosmetic products, as she has many orders for this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Elsy tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo Basilio, quien viaja constantemente, y con sus 2 hijos: Larry (17) y Sara (8), todos ellos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace 7 años ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en la tienda - bazar que posee en su propio domicilio. Esta actividad  le permite brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no se dan abasto para todos los gastos. Elsy empieza su jornada diaria a las 7 de la mañana y se prolonga hasta promediarse las 8 de la noche; la venta es muy buena, ya que Elsy es muy carismática y siempre atiende muy bien a sus clientes, es por ello que se ha hecho de muy buenos amigos en su vecindario.
Gracias a los préstamos que anteriormente solicitó en MFP ha logrado implementar en una parte de su tienda un mini bazar donde ofrece productos de belleza y algunos artículos de decoración y uso personal. 

Elsy quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que recurre a otro préstamo con MFP, siendo este su 18avo crédito, y en todos estos años (8), siempre ha demostrado mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para su bazar, ya que sabe habrá mucha demanda por fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Elsy, 40, lives with her husband Basilio, who travels constantly, and their two children, Larry, 17, and Sara, 8. They all live together and have their own house. Seven years ago, Elsy started a business selling food products in the shop she has in her house. This allowed her to provide a better future for her children, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their expenses. Elsy begins her work each day at 7AM and usually works until about 8PM. Sales are good, as Elsy is very charismatic and is attentive to the needs of her customers. Because of this, she has many friends in the community. Thanks to previous loans with MFP, she has converted part of her house into a mini-store where she offers beauty products and a few decorative articles and personal accessories. Elsy wants to keep expanding her business, so she is asking for her this, her 18th loan with MFP. Over these eight years, she has been very responsible in her payments. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise for her store, as she knows there is much demand for the New Year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer muy amable, tiene la edad de 57 años, vive con sus hijos menores: Ken (19) y Erick (17) en su casa propia, ya que sus hijos mayores; Julio (36) y Liz (31) ya tienen sus propias familias y son independientes.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales como: “extracto de sábila” para la piel, “jugo de Noni”, que es muy bueno para la salud, la “uña de gato” para el colesterol, etc. Julia está logrando salir adelante, ya que hace algunos años el puesto que tenía en uno de los mercados de su localidad se incendió y perdió toda su mercadería, pero eso no la amilanó, todo lo contrario la motivó a no dejarse vencer y salir adelante por sus hijos que aun dependen de ella. 
Hoy está muy contenta, ya que desde hace 10 años se dedica a esta labor y cada vez aprende más acerca de las bondades de las plantas, con lo cual puede aconsejar a muchos de sus clientes quienes recurren a esta forma de medicina natural para calmar sus males.

Ella es una clienta antigua de Microfinanzas PRISMA, este es su 18avo préstamo, y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales se acaban en corto tiempo debido a la demanda de sus clientes, gracias a ello obtendrá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia is a very likeable 57 year old woman. She lives with her younger children in her own house. Ken is 19, and Erick is 17. Her older children; Julio, 36, and Liz, 31; have their own families and are independent. She sells natural products like aloe extract for the skin; noni juice, which is very good for health; and cat’s claw for cholesterol, etc. Julia is getting ahead. A few years ago a stall that she had in one of the markets in her area burned, and she lost all of her merchandise. But, this did not daunt her. To the contrary, it motivated her to not give up. She wanted to get ahead for her children who are still dependent upon her. She is now very happy because she has been doing this work for ten years. Each time she learns more about the benefits of the plants. She uses this to be able to advise a lot of her customers who look to this form of natural medicine to treat their problems. She is a long time client of Microfinanzas PRISMA. This is her 18th loan, and she has always been punctual with her payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy a greater quantity of products. They run out in a short time because of her customers’ demands. Thanks to that, she will get more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Dawo. She is 40 years old. Edna is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edna raises and sells pigs. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP average per month from these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to purchase construction materials to repair her house. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Edna's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to have a little bit more comfortable house for her family to live. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy material to repair her house

loans.name: Rosebel

texts.en:
Rosebel S. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 32 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosebel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosebel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP on average per month for these activities.  She also engages in selling snacks in the local community.

In 2007, Rosebel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosebel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan that she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Eleoteria

texts.en:
Eleoteria B. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Eleoteria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionary products in the local community. Eleoteria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eleoteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Eleoteria is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eleoteria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand products offered for sale

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose R. A. C., tiene la edad de 80 años, es casado, y tiene 1 hijo que tiene 23 años. El se ha dedicado siempre a la produccion de cafe y en estos momentos tiene 9 hectarías. Tambien siembra granos basicos.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de asistencia de cafe, mas que todo en abono, pago de podas y limpias. Este prestamo le ayudará en que tenga mas produccion en las proximas cosechas. Es la primera vez don Jose se financea con FUDECOSUR y el piense que va a ayudarle con la cosecha. El desea que pueda ofrecerles un mayor futuro a los hijos. 
 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jose R. A. C. is 80 years old, married, and has a 23-year old son. He has always worked growing coffee and today has 9 hectares. He also grows basic grains. He wants a loan to help grow coffee, above all for fertilizer, pruning and cleaning. This loan will help him have a greater production in future harvests. This is the first time Jose is seeking a loan with FUDECOSUR and he thinks that it is going to help him with his harvests. He wishes to be able to offer a better future for his children. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and pruning for his coffee crop

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 36 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 23,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Leonila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand products offered for sale

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn H. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 26 years old. Rudelyn is single. To make a living, Rudelyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Rudelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year, and she earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

Rudelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rudelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita B. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Yolita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business. Yolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aldrin

texts.en:
Aldrin E. is from the village of Nabilid. He is 26 years old, is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Aldrin owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut products such as copra in the local community. Aldrin has been engaged in his business for almost two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aldrin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aldrin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business and to improve  living conditions for his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold H. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is 13 years old and goes to the 84th secondary school in the city, and his youngest son is just 2 years old and goes to a local kindergarten.

Ariunbold rents a stall at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells various seasonal clothes for women and men. He purchases most of the clothes from Ereen, China, a border town where many small vendors purchase clothes for retail sale. Because the new year and lunar calendar year celebrations are approaching, he would like to bring in gift-related products from China.

He says that he has been in this small retail business for more than ten years. It is what he is good at and is the main source of income for his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes from China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from China

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a business selling selling personal collection Avon products like a make-up, lipsticks, etc., to local community members. She is just starting this business. Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita M. L. R., tiene la edad de 41 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos. Ellos tienen 16 y 14 y los dos viven en la casa. Doña Rita tiene 2 años de tener un pequeño bazar en el centro de Sabolito donde vende toda clase de articulos para la necesidades de la region. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de busutería para un bazar que tiene en el centro de sabalito. Este prestamo le ayudará porque con meter ese tipo de mercaderia puede cubrir los pastos del negocio y tambien obtiene una ganancia. Es la primera vez doña Rita se financea con FUDECOSUR. Ella desea que pueda ser independiente economicamente y salir adelante y poder ayudarles a los hijos a los hijos en los estudio y tener una cuota de pension en el futuro. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rita M. L. R. is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. They are 16 and 14 and both live at home. For 2 years Rita has owned a small store in downtown Sabolito where she sells all kinds of items for the region’s needs. The loan that she wants will be used to buy costume jewelry for her store in downtown Sabolito. This loan will help her because with selling this type of merchandise she can cover her business costs and make a profit. This is the first time Rita is receiving a loan from FUDECOSUR. She wishes that she can be economically independent and become successful and be able to help her children receive an education and have a pension in the future. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia M. S., tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos.  Los hijos tienen 3 y 15 años respectivamente. Sonia tiene 2 años de vender ropa nueva y ahora quiere vender ropa de segunda. El credito lo quiere para construir un bazar para vender en la comunidad. Este prestamo le ayudará porque tendra un lugar fijo para vender sus mercaderia y así no salir a la calle a venderla.   Es la primera vez doña Sonia se financea con FUDECOSUR.  Ella espera que pueda contribuir con el eesutdio de los hijos y tener un ingreso economico mejor. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Sonia M. S. is 34 years-old, married with 2 children. The children are ages 3 and 15 years respectively. Sonia has worked for 2 years selling new clothes and now wants to sell second-hand clothing. The loan that she requests will be used to build a sales stall in her community. This loan will help because she will have a fixed place to sell her merchandise and thus will not have to go out into the street to sell it. This is the first time Señora Sonia has requested financing from FUDECOSUR. She hopes that she can contribute to the studies of her children and have a better financial income. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan D. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest daughter is 26 years old and stays at home with his family, and his youngest daughter is 8 years old and goes to a local secondary school.

Jargalsaihan sells second-hand shoes imported from abroad at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. He runs his shoe retail business with the help of his wife. He has been selling second-hand cheap shoes since 2000, and the business has been the main source of income for the family.

He says that he is quite experienced in the business and would like to continue to expand. His dream is to build a small cozy house for his family to live happily. He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes for his business.

Mrs. Srey Mom M. is the group leader of four members who all live in Chuos village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more pigs for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. 

Mrs. Srey Mom M. is a 38-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is attending the local school.

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nai P. is a silk weaver. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young for school. Her husband, Mr. Horn Sokhy, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice. He is also a duck breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it to meet the demands of her customers. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more raw materials for weaving. 

Mrs. Nai P. is the leader of this group of six members who all live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province. She did not come to take out the loan but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Mrs. Samoeun Inn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. SamoeU. I. owns a small restaurant. She is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Lay SaroeU., is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He needs some money to pay for plowing the field and to buy pesticides. Mrs. SamoeU. I. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Eight people who live in Prey Ta Mau village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. They will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. SamoeU. I. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and pesticides

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Chhin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who all live in Dak Por village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Thoeun C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Her husband, Mr. M. Thy, is a construction worker. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to meet their needs. 

Mrs. Thoeun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy cement and other equipment to build a house for her family. She is 35 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two are attending the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy cement and other equipment to build a house for her family

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Orm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds pigs and chickens. She is a 39-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school. She is applying for a loan to buy a cow to breed to earn more income.

This village bank loan is for 18 people located in Prey Ta Khab village in Takeo province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Morn O. is the village bank president. Mrs. Em Yim is the group guarantor of this village bank and she is shown in the photo.

Mastora is group leader of the Shafequllah Atequllah group which has five members. She is 43 years old and married with six children who are at school. Mastora wants to take out a loan for her husband’s business of selling stock. He needs this loan because he wants to make his shop larger and to buy materials.

Rafeya wants to take out a loan for her husband’s business which is a general store. He needs to buy necessary materials for his shop. Ater Gull wants to take out a loan for her business of tailoring. She plans to teach tailoring to her students, so she needs the loan to purchase a new sewing machine and chairs so she can teach in a better way and progress her business. Also, Fazall Raham wants to take out a loan for his business which is a metal shop. He would like to make his shop larger. And Shafequllah wants to take out a loan for his business which is driving a taxi as he wants to repair his taxi.
They have requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani.

 They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and the Kiva process in Afghanistan which helps poor people of this country.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Ermila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ermila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ermila is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the tenth loan which she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
